locations.title: Horfield Leisure Centre
locations.address: Dorian Rd, Horfield, Bristol BS7 0XW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've attended Horfield Centre for many years (30+). The recent major refurb has given the whole place a lift.  It is so much more comfortable to exercise there now.  The facilities are good quality and clean, the sports equipment and exercise areas are in very good condition.  Poolside area for changing and showering is warm and working well.
The improved environment makes me feel more motivated to attend and enjoy the excellent classes even more.
The only downside is that the more popular classes are now so difficult to get a place on, even with the online booking system.
showerReviews.author: Christine Jamrozy

showerReviews.reviewText: Great place to take my grandson for his swimming lessons, can't recommend it enough for a lively 2 year old.  Dan is a great teacher, so positive with the children.  Grandson also loves the soft play and you can get a great cup of coffee in the cafe when you're finished.

showerReviews.reviewText: Too many in the pool at one time, from seniors trying to enjoy a good swim, to parents with kids wandering around in the water as if they own the place. Please reinstate the over 50 swim sessions. Pool temperature chilly. Shower area often full of hair in clumps all over the floors, and changing area not as clean as should be.

locations.title: Easton Leisure Centre
locations.address: Thrissell St, South Bank, Bristol BS5 0SW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The website is shockingly bad
Yes you've spent lots of money doing the place up but couldn't you spend a few quid building a proper website that's straight forward to use?And no I DON'T want yet another app on my phone..it's a leisure centre not a bank!
In the end I gave up and drove there only to find no swimming slots available for another 2 hours

If you really want customers to be able to use this place
-proper basic website
-paper timetables (for those without phones or tech savvy)
-answer the phone..currently we're left on hold with stupid messages playing and no clue when or if someone will answer
-allow people to pay cash for those who don't want to be monitored by your app/don't have a phone or tech savvy
-keep spaces for walk in customers

Until then,thanks but no thanks..you're just playing at being inclusive but you're really excluding many,many people with this truly terrible website

Edit-A friend who speaks good English (but not as a first language) described moving to Easton and trying to book a swim but giving up because the website is so awful. How many other potential customers are you losing because of this problem?
showerReviews.author: Sarah S

showerReviews.reviewText: It's not a bad space but there are issues with it. First, teenagers are free to go into the toddler pool, despite the larger pool being relatively empty; two teenage stood in the middle of the toddler pool throwing a ball to one another. Second, they halved the small pool so a little girl could have a swimming lesson meaning we were all squeezed into a much smaller space; it really didn't make sense. Also, building works are currently going on so it's incredibly noisy. The changing rooms are packed and some fathers have their young girls changing in the men's toilets; it's all very disorganised and could be managed far far better.
showerReviews.author: Jagon Chichon

showerReviews.reviewText:
Changing rooms stink of wee and are filthy. There has been ongoing construction work right by the pool side, active drilling and banging during sessions. No shower or toilet facilities by the pool as that's what they're working on, so you cannot shower before you get in the pool, thus who knows what the hygiene of the pool is like. I was told to walk around to by reception in a towel for the toilet. Staff refused to give my 3 year old daughter a pool noodle, which we were relying on (upon booking it states these are accessible or you can bring your own).

Disgusting place.
showerReviews.author: ruby graham

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked 1 hr session for myself, hubby, 5 year old and 9 month old. I used to go here as a child in the 90s and loved it, especially the flume. Thought my daughter would enjoy it but i didnt know until i got there that the flume is only on weekends due to staffing. So, onwards to the communal gender based changing room. All i can say is YUK. Never seen such a filthy area. Absolutely disgusting. People wearing outdoor shoes all around the pool and other areas you would be barefoot. Cant shower before entering the pool so a lot of people bypassed and went straight to the pool, although the water didnt look dirty whilst we were in there who knows... My daughter really enjoyed her time there but I was just waiting to leave. As previous reviewer stated there is a refurbishment going on which has clearly presented issues when trying to keep the pools operational at the same time. I would only return if after the refurbishment there are plenty of positive reviews for cleanliness and facilities. Until then we will be sticking to kingswood and longwell green.
showerReviews.author: rajdeep kaur

showerReviews.reviewText: Have only used the main pool a few times recently. All good except for the showers. The water pressure has been consistently awful. This makes it difficult to rinse off even a small amount of shampoo on very short hair. Staff very pleasant.
showerReviews.author: Cecilie Organ

showerReviews.reviewText: Have only used the main pool a few times recently. All good except for the showers. The water pressure has been consistently awful. This makes it difficult to rinse off even a small amount of shampoo on very short hair. Staff very pleasant.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We decided to visit Kingswood leisure centre on a Sunday afternoon for the diving board session.
It's really cheap for a great afternoon indoor swimming and it's never too busy.
On this visit only the 1 and 3 meter boards were open, but that didn't dampen our spirits and off we went for some diving fun.
You can feel relaxed as lifeguards are always on duty and the diving area is sectioned off to prevent wayward swimmers.
There is good access for wheelchair users and there is a nice viewing area for spectators. There are also plenty of vending machines for refreshments.
showerReviews.author: Weekend Wildness

showerReviews.reviewText:
We’ve been coming here regularly for 4 years with my daughters swimming lessons, it’s a nice pool with good facilities although sometimes there isn’t a pleasant smell in the changing room area! 3 diving boards although they’re not open to the public that often. My daughter has recently stopped swimming lessons as she reached a stage where she was no longer gaining any benefit from coming, although she still likes to come now for pleasure with her friends.
Staff on the whole very friendly, car Park very cramped and tight spaces (watch out for traffic wardens if you park in the bays outside!!)
showerReviews.author: #all of the adventures

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely, Clean and Welcoming — A Great Swim Session

We had a brilliant time at Kingswood Leisure Centre! It was my first time swimming in quite a few years, and I’m so glad we chose to go here — especially during half term, as it was surprisingly quiet and very relaxing.

The facilities were clean, tidy, and well looked after. Plenty of £1 lockers available, and everything felt really well organised. The pool was well manned with both male and female lifeguards, which gave a strong sense of safety and care.

What really stood out was how friendly, kind, and knowledgeable the staff were. They made everything feel easy and welcoming. My older daughter was able to use a float without anyone questioning her, which made a big difference — no judgment, just fun!

We had a lovely, fun time together and will definitely be back. Thank you to the team at Kingswood Leisure Centre!
showerReviews.author: Aliasvega Reviews

locations.title: Hengrove Park Leisure Centre
locations.address: Hengrove Park Leisure Centre, Hengrove Promenade, Bristol BS14 0DE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been a member for six years, and used to enjoy the 50m swim. In the past 2 months the slow lane has been narrowed to the point that people are getting hit when passing each other. I wrote to ask why these changes had happened, and to let them know that this was not safe. I have received emails where staff have blatantly lied about the consultation process - members were not consulted about these changes as part of the review. The swimming clubs take precedence. Speaking to anyone at all is like talking to the wall. This place has gone down hill as it is very poorly managed, staff are indifferent to members paying over £400  a year. Do better for your members Hengrove.
showerReviews.author: Mary Steadman

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been a member for six years, and used to enjoy the 50m swim. showerReviews.reviewText: The coaches at Hengrove Park Leisure Centre are really quite lucky. Working for a government-run organisation seems to have made them complacent—they don’t put much effort into teaching and just seem to take it easy. Whether it’s the fitness trainers or the swimming instructors, they tend to favour their friends or personal contacts and are very careless with everyone else, almost as if they’re running free trials or tests. They often avoid answering questions, which I’ve seen multiple times. The prices aren’t exactly cheap, so just because the location is convenient, they shouldn’t run the place so sloppily.
showerReviews.author: Yeseul Han

showerReviews.reviewText:
Even though we are quite far away from the centre,  we decided to sign our biys for swimming lessons. That was almost a year ago. We had two boys who were scared to go into the pool and now we have two crazy swimmers who love being in the water. The teachers are great (Lily and Anne-Marie). As far as the lessons are concerned,  they are very well structured and fun. The pool in clean as are the changing rooms. A+

The only thing that isn't going quite well is booking family swim sessions. We struggle to do it online but we're refused to be booked in person. Thumbs down here. Otherwise, a great place.
showerReviews.author: Ania Marsh

showerReviews.reviewText: My child started swimming lessons here and I wish I never bothered. He is not scared of the water but was nervous about going in to the class. The teacher did absolutely nothing to help re assure him and when he tried to hold her hand I noticed she tried to let go when she could. Disappointed is not the word, I only went twice and a lot of the swim staff were different both times. This teacher in particular was young and I’m struggling to understand why she is a teacher for young (first class) children when she has 0 empathy. Please take your children somewhere else if you think they will need any sort of support. My son is now saying he doesn’t like water. Lessons have done the opposite to what they should. Also not enough space if you want to watch your child as the parents whose older children are in the larger pool all cram in to the same area where the younger children are to watch. Reception lady was lovely and that’s about the olny positive I have.
showerReviews.author: Jasmine Bailey

The free parking is a plus!

showerReviews.reviewText:
How is this pool rated 4.1.
I wasn't clean.
The pool wasn't clean. The things I saw in that swimming pool. . . . .
Changing rooms: it was actually smelling like pee. I went into another cubical( thinking that someone had an accident), the smell was the same . . .. .
This is not their fault . . . . .it's ours, the consumers. Had we told them about this, they would have acted on it . . . . .
I am putting 2 stars because I don't see any good in having this facility closed up.
If you take the time to give a review, tell it how it is. Otherwise, you don't help anybody
Need to go . . . . . need to take a bath in sanitizer . . . . . .

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been a member of this local gym which is based in little stoke area of south gloucestershire Bristol. I started going to this gym in 2017 and have been a regular member since. I live within the local area, and it is local for me and easy to get to. I have enjoyed my time training at this gym and will continue to do so for the foreseeable future. I have made some few friends within the gym, and people seems decent. There is a swimming area, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. There is also a Physio centre attached to the gym, and there are regular gym classes and yoga classes. Some of the equipments could be better but you get that everywhere. I hope they upgrade some of the equipments soon.
showerReviews.author: austin ebohon

showerReviews.reviewText: The building is small, quite old, and dilapidated. The atmosphere feels like a terrarium—dark, overly stuffy, and humid, with almost no natural light, at least in the areas I visited. They have a swimming pool (with a maximum depth of 1.40 m), a jacuzzi, and male and female changing rooms, which are communal spaces without individual cubicles, except for a section separated by a curtain that offers some privacy. There is also a changing room with a shower for people with disabilities. Additionally, there’s a fitness area that I didn’t visit, as my primary interest was the swimming pool. From the signs on the walls, I understood they also have a physio clinic and a beauty salon. They have a café located right next to the pool, where the smell of mold and the feeling of humidity are almost unbearable; again, there’s no natural light. The staff are friendly and polite but not very well-informed about the services offered. The building has a sufficiently large and free parking area, though it’s not well-marked, so parking is somewhat haphazard. Overall, I wouldn’t choose this place for sports activities.
showerReviews.author: Stefanova Gi

They have made some improvements with new equipment etc. however the toilets are filthy (just age related issues like mould forming on old tiles and grout!)  can see improvements however as one of the more costly gyms in the area I would expect better for my money. Let’s hope they refurbish the toilets and put private cubicles in the changing rooms. And start actually keeping the idiot teenagers from acting like idiots around the pool area.
Either improve or drop prices because it’s not worth the money.
Update- gone back to Active Bradley stoke much better value for money

showerReviews.reviewText: CCSC is a private members gym that fits in around the school timetable. There are good facilities for cardio, resistance plus strength & conditioning and swimming. Some of the equipment is aging and suffers from lack of maintenance which is a shame as this could be easily rectified. Opening hours in recent years have become more restrictive causing congestion at peak times. Staff are friendly and there is generally a good atmosphere in the gym. Improvements could be made if management took a more proactive approach to members. On balance it remains a great place to exercise and good value for money.

showerReviews.reviewText:
EDIT: they have also got rid of a set of dumbbells for some reason, so now there is only one set in the free weights area. Which is ridiculous and means there are usually no dumbbells that you want left. I've seen arguments break out over this and it's made for an extra uncomfortable experience. Why would they do this?

They've done up the gym which imo looks really good. However, I've noticed a lot of issues since the refurbishment.

First of all, they've not added any cleaning equipment. It's insane to me that this gym doesn't have anything to clean sweaty equipment with, I feel dirty every time I leave. The place feels quite grimy in general and I can't help but think being able to clean equipment would help massively.

Second, they now host classes in an area where all of the free weights, medicine balls, barbells and mats are. Which is totally fine, except when I tried to get some equipment for my workout (I stayed well out of the way of the class, which was on the other side of the area) I was rudely shouted at by the instructor, Andy, who embarrassed me in front of the entire class. He said I'd have to ask for each piece of equipment I needed. Which is ridiculous considering I'd have to interrupt the class every time I wanted a different weight. So basically, if you want to use free weights you have to check the schedule and it's tough shit if a class is on at the time you want to go.

The WiFi has also got noticeably worse since the refurb and barely works on the second floor.

The decision to put all lockers on the top floor is bizarre and annoying.

Also, I've never in my life been told off as much as I have in this gym. I think my schoolteachers were more lenient than the trainers here. I've been yelled at for having a jacket with me, a small bag, my posture being incorrect, and, as said previously, just trying to get equipment.

If it wasn't for all of those things it would be a great place to go and exercise:)
showerReviews.author: Jaimie O'Connor

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym has lost a lot of it’s heart since it’s refurbishment. The original assets of this gym were its spacious size and it’s unique way of being bright and cheerful.

Most gyms are not blessed with natural lighting and are typically in basements or buildings which rely heavily on artificial lighting. This gym had a blessing and it made the most of natural lighting and large free-weight space.

I’ve been since the refurbishment and I needed to terminate my contract. Something is not right and it’s hard to describe it but it’s moved away from it’s core assets which is why I use the analogy that it’s lost a lot of it’s heart.

The weights section used to be sparse and large. It worked really well. The second floor was brilliantly designed but simple and effective. It’s changed significantly and I may be in the minority but it’s just not the same. Sometimes marriages don’t last, it can be said, and on this occasion I’m relocating to a gym up the road which I don’t want to spell out here as it’s already too busy as it stands!

I had great memories here though, and the rating can’t be one star because the staff are nice here. In terms of the Gym group it may be bureaucracy from above but replacing white walls with grey/black paint and the drastic change here was a big call!

To give feedback and I may be in the minority, I would agree with the aspect that knocking down the changing rooms was a good call. The third floor was definitely underused, but I would say the functional aspects could have been on the first floor.

In other words everything from the third floor (including new functional equipment) could have been paced on the first including classes. I feel the functional facilities could have been relocated to the first floor to better utilise the new available space and improve visibility, perhaps even serving as a form of advertisement for the classes offered.

Although equipment needed replacing and a lick of paint was required this does look like an entirely different gym/brand now. That being said, this is only one bad review! I’m sure I’m in the minority and it’s all personal preference. Thank you for the memories here! And all the best!
showerReviews.author: Jasper Lloyd

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym has lost a lot of it’s heart since it’s refurbishment. The original assets of this gym were its spacious size and it’s unique way of being bright and cheerful.

Most gyms are not blessed with natural lighting and are typically in basements or buildings which rely heavily on artificial lighting. This gym had a blessing and it made the most of natural lighting and large free-weight space.

I’ve been since the refurbishment and I needed to terminate my contract. Something is not right and it’s hard to describe it but it’s moved away from it’s core assets which is why I use the analogy that it’s lost a lot of it’s heart.

The weights section used to be sparse and large. It worked really well. The second floor was brilliantly designed but simple and effective. It’s changed significantly and I may be in the minority but it’s just not the same. Sometimes marriages don’t last, it can be said, and on this occasion I’m relocating to a gym up the road which I don’t want to spell out here as it’s already too busy as it stands!

I had great memories here though, and the rating can’t be one star because the staff are nice here. In terms of the Gym group it may be bureaucracy from above but replacing white walls with grey/black paint and the drastic change here was a big call!

To give feedback and I may be in the minority, I would agree with the aspect that knocking down the changing rooms was a good call. The third floor was definitely underused, but I would say the functional aspects could have been on the first floor.

In other words everything from the third floor (including new functional equipment) could have been paced on the first including classes. I feel the functional facilities could have been relocated to the first floor to better utilise the new available space and improve visibility, perhaps even serving as a form of advertisement for the classes offered.

Although equipment needed replacing and a lick of paint was required this does look like an entirely different gym/brand now. That being said, this is only one bad review! I’m sure I’m in the minority and it’s all personal preference. Thank you for the memories here! And all the best!
showerReviews.author: Jasper Lloyd

locations.title: Luxe Fitness Bristol City Centre
locations.address: City Centre, Luxe Fitness, Colston Tower, Bristol BS1 4UB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The pros:
Ok, for the money (£24 a month), this place is incredible value. The location is great if you work centrally, the equipment is all new, the place is clean and the dark/purple vibe is nice.... the music 8/10 times seems to be some deep house or trance, which I think is perfect for working out.

The crowd: This is pretty good too. No big egos. If you go too late in the day you do get several gaggles of students that bunch up around one piece of equipment and most chat and look at their phones, which sucks the vibe out, but you get there everywhere and it isn't that prominent here.

The cons: (or at least, caveats)

No mirrors. Apparently it's too make people feel less threatened (by themselves??) That feels like a cop out, I'd guess it's cheaper than insurance, but there are zero mirrors on the gym floor... not one... not only are they a useful tool for checking your form, but you'll never been as big as when you're at the gym, and not being able to see it live feels like I'm being robbed of an opportunity to see myself at my biggest... sad times.

Dumbbells only go to 35kg, and plates for the benches are limited, which is a real restriction and explains why you won't find big lifters here.

The equipment is quite jammed in downstairs, so it's a bit of a pain stepping over things and people to move around when it's busy. Upstairs as much more space.

They sell shakes, but there no information available on the macros... I asked and they couldn't tell me how many grams of protein.. or even how many total calories ... what maniac is training hard and then drinking a mystery shake that could be 1000 calories? Not this one.

The soap in the washroom sinks is out 7/10 times.

Reception often ignore you, the customer service could be better, I think it's a training thing.

Overall, easy worth the money.
showerReviews.author: James Mikkelson

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited at 6:40am today, a Sunday morning. Main gym area was untidy (weights not put back), there was some litter and the floor was a bit dirty. The downstairs bathroom had toilet paper all over the floor and the locker I used in the communal area I noticed STANK. Stank like old wet clothes.

The changing rooms were the worst. Smelt like poo, litter and clothes everywhere and what looked like tuna chunks in the sink. Just nasty.

Good it’s 24hr tho.

showerReviews.reviewText: I got my membership just recently, and I can say that is very good. I like that everything organised amazing and you can feel the staff's attention and care for their clients - whether it's in the pool, locker room, group training, or great equipped gym. Very clean, there are towel dryers and hair dryers, and it's very easy to figure out how to close the cabinets (maybe this is a small thing, but it's still nice that this was thought out for people's convenience). Steam room,jacuzzi and cold bath is just top! I think this gym is the best in Bristol. A big thank you to Ellie Reeves, who kindly explained everything and helped me get a membership, despite my poor English. She was very patient and polite. And the other guys are always friendly and helpful. I would recommend the Villiage Gym Bristol to anyone ❤️

locations.title: Anytime Fitness Bristol
locations.address: 48 Queens Rd, Bristol BS8 1RE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Here's My updated review :)

I previously left a review about some discomfort regarding freshness. My previous experience led me to leave the gym. However, after the recent renovations, I decided to rejoin and wanted to share my updated experience.

The gym has been an absolute breeze since I rejoined. There's always plenty of space available and it never feels overcrowded. All the necessary equipment is there, alongside new additions like shower rooms, a free BMI machine, and massage guns.

Despite being located in a basement, the air feels very fresh and the ventilation is amazing, maintaining good air quality even during busy periods. I think they've really put in a lot of effort to make it super comfortable. I really appreciate these new changes and, of course, love the new interior :-) .

I would say this branch at Queens Road has really stepped up their game compared to last time.
showerReviews.author: Mayur Hulke

locations.title: PureGym Bristol Harbourside | New Kit Just Landed!
locations.address: Explore Ln, Bristol BS1 5TY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
PROS
👍 Staff is friendly and helpful.
👍 Generally safe and friendly environment.
👍 Spacious premises.
👍 Good location.

One star rating due to the below

CONS
👎 No  fresh air on the premises. I imagine if measured professionally, it won't meet standards. But it's really off-putting and needs addressing. There are other reviews mentioning this issue. This has not been resolved yet.

👎No reasonable temp is maintained. It gets quite bad, especially when the gym is crowded and during warm weather. Other reviews mention the same. It seems like this will never be addressed.

👎 Paper stations are not sufficient. Have at least one more installed near the free weights area. It's a quick fix.

👎 Curently, both lifts on site are out of order. One for almost a year now, the other one for at least 3 months. Mind you, the gym is located on floors 4 and 5. It is absolutely ridiculous. Even if one lift is working, this creates lots of queues as it is out of of its capacity.

👎 Have seen people vaping on the premises. No one enforces gym rules to prevent that.

👎 Toilets are not cleaned up to standards.

👎 Lockers (inside surfaces) and benches in the men's changing room are not maintained sufficiently clean. The sink in the changing room is also disgusting most of the times, can't remember it being clean enough for the past couple of years, with a few exceptions, maybe.

Unfortunately, I don't expect any of the noted issues resolved effectively, given that the issues persist as seen with previous reviews. But I thought I'd give the heads up for any potential new joiners.
showerReviews.author: Simeon B

I went to this gym whilst spending time in Bristol. Even for a PureGym the standards are low. The dumbbells are out of order and dotted around the gym, left to be tripped over. This is the same with the plates. People would finish their set and just walk off, leaving plates on barbells and dumbbells where they were.
One dumbbell had chewing gum stuck on it, that was dirty and had clearly been there a while. There were empty plastic water bottles, used tissues and even blood stained plasters on the floor. With various handles for cable machines there are paper towels and wipes just left on the floor.
The staff don’t seem interested in keeping the gym tidy, rather leaning on their desk scrolling on their phones.
showerReviews.author: Harry Jennings

showerReviews.reviewText: Decided to give this gym a try and ignored the 3.6 rating at first, thinking people were just being too strict. But after going there, in my opinion, it should be even lower. The male changing rooms were bad — from toilets to litter on the floor. The bottom weights area has to be the worst part of the gym. Plates and dumbbells were scattered everywhere. Not sure if it’s the people who go to this gym being careless or the staff just not bothering to maintain the place. Maybe I came at the wrong time, but honestly, you guys can do better. Just disappointed.
showerReviews.author: Tinashe Mutimuvezwa

locations.title: University of Bristol Swimming Pool
locations.address: Richmond Building, The, Queens Rd, Bristol BS8 1LN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great swimming pool that I have been using since Filton pool closed unexpectedly in April 2025 (but has since reopened) if has up to 6 lanes for swimming (less when there are swimming lessons or casual sessions) - Experimented on various sessions and did find that the casual sessions on the whole were the quietest (but I do have some flexibility) Also used the sessions on the weekend - showers are great - separate ladies and gentlemen changing rooms - £8  for a one off adult swim (as of Sept 2025) or of you go more often then get the membership  - can be done on line just be careful which session you book on - I did the wrong one but soon got it changed to swim only!! Staff are great - if you can book in advance it would be great and easier and you can just used your card to present at the desk and not reliant on a member of staff being on duty (none will be around if the lifeguards are on rotation)

Great pool and great staff, great facilities - I still have membership and will use on an adhoc basis a the pool I go to has reopened but  would certainly go there as a back up and provided a great pol
showerReviews.author: ANN LIGHT

Ut was nice that there were places to put water bottle and towels next to the pool as well. Recommend it!

showerReviews.reviewText: I tend to go once or twice a week to the earliest lane swim session. Overall it's a pretty good pool that feels safe and clean but there's a few things that make it kind of run down (somehow despite bits of kit being replaced recently?). When you put a padlock on a lot of the lockers it doesn't actually lock it and you can still open the door afterwards. The scan-in gate hasn't worked for months meaning you have to wait for a member of staff to appear (I've waited 5-10 minutes multiple times) to scan you in. I appreciate the booking system because it helps you see how busy a session might be but it's pretty pointless when you can't scan yourself in when you get there. Despite two new ones recently being installed, just one of the three hairdryers in the women's changing room just about works. The costume dryer has worked less than half the times I've visited in the last year, even the recently installed one. Given membership prices increase every year it would be nice to see things get fixed properly instead of replacing things cheaply and then them breaking quickly.
showerReviews.author: Molly Thomas

Good pool with friendly staff and lifeguards, good student entry price and the changing rooms were spotless.

The only reason this isn't 5* is due to how crowded and narrow the lanes were. I was also confused as to whether or not the pool block made the length 20m instead of 25m.

Other than that I can see why it's a popular pool, and will definitely swim here again.

showerReviews.reviewText: I’ve been recently been using this pool as it’s one of the few that have a senior swim. Although it doesn’t have a car park I have been parking in Asda and walking , roughly a ten minute walk. I love this pool, the water is a lovely temperature and it’s a really good size . I like that you can leave your belongings in a cubicle around the side of the pool. The showers are good, the staff are friendly. I love the old 1930s decor . It’s a lovely building with great features. Thoroughly enjoy every time I visit.

showerReviews.reviewText: It’s a beautiful old building, it was even featured in “Accidentally Wes Anderson” and I love that the changing rooms are so close to the pool. The water is always nice and warm for the children too. But that’s where the good things end really. On the whole, the entire place is REALLY dirty. I don’t think it’s cleaned very often as even in the early morning sessions the baby change units are dirty and there is hair in the showers. The showers really need privacy as well. I don’t like that they are open right onto the pool. Feels like you’re on display. The buzzer for the accessible door is also never answered because they never have enough staff so there is rarely someone manning reception.

locations.title: Bristol Lido
locations.address: Oakfield Pl, Clifton, Bristol BS8 2BJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have wanted to visit here for soooo long! Finally got the perfect excuse and brought my best friend for her birthday. We were greeted at reception and given a quick tour of the facilities. We were given a robe and a towel each and we changed into these before going up to the massage waiting room. We were collected by our massage therapists and taken into our own private rooms for the massage. The treatment was lovely and the hour passed by way too quickly! We then were taken to a relaxation are and made a cup of tea which was lovely after the massage.

I would like to offer a pro tip at this point, there was an autumnal nip in the air and we hadn't remembered to take flipflops but the floor was super chilly on the toes! If you feel the cold like I do, remember your sandals or flipflops!

After we had booked time to use the pool and facilities. We had the best time popping between the sauna, pool, hot tub, and steam room. It was never too busy in any of the areas and they were all clean. We were incredibly fortunate with the weather and it literally felt like we had gone on holiday for the day!

We hadn't booked in for lunch but the smells coming from the kitchen were making us both hungry so we asked if they took walk ins at the spa reception and the lady said yes. We popped through a little door and were in the restaurant and were seated at a lovely table in 10 mins. Our waitress was lovely and we ordered some of the small plates and some lovely refreshing drinks. The food came out relatively quickly considering how busy it was (it was peak lunch time 1.30pm) and was well presented and oh so delicious! I don't often eat out so to me the food was amazing! The tapas style food we picked was so flavourful and the perfect amount for sharing. We were recommended a delicious pudding and enjoyed every mouthful!

My friend and I have been on a few different spa days together around Bristol and this by far took the number 1 spot! Thank you to all who made our treat day so wonderful! We will be back!
showerReviews.author: Ellie Coombs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked an afternoon swim session here and had a fantastic time.
Swimming pool and plenty of room to swim, really nice chilled vibe too. I loved the sauna and steam room followed by the cold water bucket, certainly felt refreshing.
Hot tub was really busy but I managed to squeeze in for five minutes.
Towel hire is worth it for £3 because you can get a fresh towel as many times as you want, very useful.
Shower rooms were clean and had lovely shower gel and shampoo.
Will definitely be back for one of the food and swim packages, especially when the weather gets warmer.
showerReviews.author: Paul Bobo

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked the swim and breakfast package as we were spending a week in Bristol and seemed a nice thing to do . I must say we were blown away by the whole experience more queens club than David Lloyd’s and with bells on . This lido was refurbished and reopened to the public in 2007 . Architecturally beautiful and lovingly restored with incredible attention to detail from the pool side cubicle changing curtains to the tasteful period furniture in the upper floors . The members and staff , friendly and charming shared their special place with us and we very much appreciated . Pool , steam , sauna and jacuzzi left us refreshed and ready for breakfast. Changing rooms and shower  areas were super clean and tidy . Then to breakfast well !!! This was another level and unexpected , ibérico chop with Catalan beans duck egg , morcilla and membrillo was a Hispanic combination I would have only expected to find in heaven , congratulations to the genius who pulled that baby to the pass at menu development . As in many cases sadly wonderful food not matched by service , would you like some toast with that or anything else we can get you would have been nice and a simple upsell , regardless come to expect these things and move on albeit annoying. Having said that the food quality setting and environment made for one of the most memorable breakfast. Thank you .
showerReviews.author: Gastronomía Europa

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ah, Henleaze Lake. The shimmering jewel tucked away in Bristol’s north, surrounded by trees, tranquillity and a silence that promises serenity. But make no mistake, what appears to be an oasis is in fact a fortress. A selfish, smug little fortress.

I arrived curious, hopeful even, eager to witness the lake I'd heard whispers about. A natural beauty, they said. A place to escape the heat, to swim, to breathe. And yet, as I approached the gates, I was not greeted with open arms or even polite disinterest. I was greeted with a sign. A sign so bold, so unapologetically elitist it may as well have read you are not welcome here.

Members only.

This is not a luxury hotel. This is not a spa. This is a body of water carved by nature, not privilege. And yet, Henleaze Lake guards it like it is a private vault handed down through aristocracy. The sense of exclusion here is palpable. The kind of pompous gatekeeping that makes your blood boil. The idea that something so simple and healing as swimming in a natural lake should be kept under lock and key for a few select residents with the right postcode or the right connections is nothing short of absurd.

What are we protecting it from exactly? The working class? Teenagers? The very community it sits in? If a lake cannot be shared, what can?

This is not stewardship. This is hoarding.

Henleaze Lake may pride itself on being pristine. On being untouched by the masses. But purity without access is not beauty. It is vanity. And if this place wants to be remembered as more than a snobbish relic clinging to exclusivity, then it must open its gates. Let the public in. Let the public splash. Let people swim without needing a golden ticket.

Until then, Henleaze Lake will remain what it is now, not a sanctuary, but a monument to exclusion. A lake drowning in its own self importance.
showerReviews.author: Ayyub Chowdhury

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ah, Henleaze Lake. The shimmering jewel tucked away in Bristol’s north, surrounded by trees, tranquillity and a silence that promises serenity. But make no mistake, what appears to be an oasis is in fact a fortress. A selfish, smug little fortress.

I arrived curious, hopeful even, eager to witness the lake I'd heard whispers about. A natural beauty, they said. A place to escape the heat, to swim, to breathe. And yet, as I approached the gates, I was not greeted with open arms or even polite disinterest. I was greeted with a sign. A sign so bold, so unapologetically elitist it may as well have read you are not welcome here.

Members only.

This is not a luxury hotel. This is not a spa. This is a body of water carved by nature, not privilege. And yet, Henleaze Lake guards it like it is a private vault handed down through aristocracy. The sense of exclusion here is palpable. The kind of pompous gatekeeping that makes your blood boil. The idea that something so simple and healing as swimming in a natural lake should be kept under lock and key for a few select residents with the right postcode or the right connections is nothing short of absurd.

What are we protecting it from exactly? The working class? Teenagers? The very community it sits in? If a lake cannot be shared, what can?

This is not stewardship. This is hoarding.

Henleaze Lake may pride itself on being pristine. On being untouched by the masses. But purity without access is not beauty. It is vanity. And if this place wants to be remembered as more than a snobbish relic clinging to exclusivity, then it must open its gates. Let the public in. Let the public splash. Let people swim without needing a golden ticket.

Until then, Henleaze Lake will remain what it is now, not a sanctuary, but a monument to exclusion. A lake drowning in its own self importance.
showerReviews.author: Ayyub Chowdhury

locations.title: Kingsdown Sports Centre
locations.address: Portland St, Bristol BS2 8HL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member for about two months now, using only the gym facilities. I go on my lunchbreak between 12-1pm and it's often full.

Pros: Spacious, clean changing room, reasonable range of equipment.

Cons: Lockers only take old pound coins, water dispensers don't work well, gym has on several occasions been used by local school for PE lessons (this was indicated to me when I joined but I was told they wouldn't be using the equipment, however on my last visit there were groups using the machines.)

All in all, comparably priced to other gyms in Bristol I would say I'm probably not getting value for money based on the availability and range of equipment particularly when schools are using the facilities. Would not recommend for anyone intending to go at lunch and wanting to use machines. Free weights are generally available, there are two squat racks but these are normally in use.

I've not used the sports centre so won't comment on that aspect.
showerReviews.author: Nick Veasey

locations.title: City Academy Sports Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Attended a kickboxing event here, decent sized arena's and sports hall, seating was poor, needs a pull out seating  system to accommodate the hundreds of people that attended. Toilets were 2 per changing room. Car parking was appalling. Road leading into the sports centre was double parked and an absolute nightmare to try and get through. This is a major event in the kickboxing community, parking really needs to be looked at for next year.
Cafe area was lovely, food and drinks little pricey especially when feeding the family.
Overall sports centre nice and big. Needs to be more marshals ringside too, a lot of people were blocking views of people that had paid good money to watch their clubs and fighter's. Not enough control onto the matt areas.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is so good, recently refurbished and with brand new equipment. The staff are friendly and helpful, the place is clean, and there is a good mix of people who use the gym, which is something I look for (i.e. not packed with gym bros).
The only reason I marked it down one star is that the changing room and toilet facilities are very basic and a bit dated. The showers in the women's changing room are communal (rather than cubicles) and there is 1 small mirror. No hairdryers etc so you'd need to bring your own if needed.
Other than that, I think it's really great!

showerReviews.reviewText: Decent gym with good availability of cardio equipment, but a few downsides. There are limited strength machines, even the most popular ones – for example, only one lat pull-down and one leg press – so you often end up waiting. The gym floor is quite crowded with equipment, leaving very little space for free workouts or stretching. The biggest let-down is the women’s changing room. The showers are in a terrible state: blocked with limescale and low water pressure, which makes them pretty much unusable. It’s frustrating not being able to shower after a workout and having to head straight home instead.

locations.title: Bannatyne Health Club and Spa
locations.address: 80 Redland Rd, Redland, Bristol BS6 6AG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked a spa package with my partner which included a 35 minute treatment, use of the spa facilities and lunch. The venue was nice, I was a little put off after looking at the reviews but as long as you know it’s a club not a spa then the price is a little more justified. The ladies who did our massages were perfect and very professional and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. The massage rooms are near a gym so there is constant banging and cluttering. The pool and facilities were okay, again definitely not a spa experience though - when we arrived there was a class happening in the pool which luckily ended in time for after our massage, hopefully that was booked and planned  according to the spa booking. We booked with lunch as well, but we most definitely lost money by booking with lunch instead of paying there. It was an extra £25 we paid for lunch and we did not get that value, lunch wasn’t the best but the guy behind the counter was nice! 3/5 because the massage was really nice but would only come back for the massages, spa experiences are meant to be relaxing, we couldn’t even paddle around in the pool as it was all lane swimming and if you don’t move you’d get disapproving looks and tuts from club members. Just a bit disappointed because £115 is quite a lot of money for a mid experience :(
showerReviews.author: Rebecca Rose

showerReviews.reviewText: I’m a member here and it’s so disappointing for the money it costs. There’s usually something broken, whether it’s the steam room or showers are cold. The women’s showers need cleaning more often, there’s always clumps of hair on the floor. Most the staff are lovely but some choose to announce over the speaker the closing time of the spa so many times in the last hour, it’s so unnecessary and ruins the relaxation. Then they come into the changing rooms demanding we leave, claiming the club closes at 8.55pm sharp - when it clearly says 9pm on google. I understand they want to leave on time and don’t want to do unpaid overtime but maybe they should be rota’d on and paid for 15mins longer because it’s clearly not working for them nor the guests and it’s not ok to be kicking out guests early who spend their hard earned money on these facilities. I could go on but I’m boring myself :)
showerReviews.author: Ellie Ferdinando

showerReviews.reviewText: Been a member for many years when they were called DW Gym, they were understanding during lockdown when gym use wasn’t been used by myself and cancelled my subscription. I ended up signing back up a few years later. £30 for use on gym and swimming is great value, free parking for up to 4 hours, ok I get that they removed the jacuzzi, but still, you get the steam room. But overall great value, staff are always professional and greet you when you come and go.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bitterly regret joining this gym. I've been a member for 4 months, and I'm so disappointed. I am a carer and literally wanted to come for a quiet swim once a week as a break from my demanding home situation. I joined solely to use the pool and the steam room. The pool is often booked for children swimming lessons, so a third of the pool is closed. In the mornings you usually have to dodge older men and women chatting walking or swimming two a breast, or its just simply over crowded. It feels like people soup. I have tried various times up to 6.30pm so far and found it always much the same except for the very rare occasions. Durring this time there seems to be an ongoing issue with hairdryers in the ladies changing room. Either none at all, a very small number, often the same sign from the management stating they will get more. Also the lockers are well past there best,  lots of broken doors, or locks that don't fully work. You can go through several to find a working locker. There are only 2 small changing cubicals, and the locks are broken.  The steam room has been out of order several times too.

I have spoken to the duty manager a couple of times to highlight the issues of broken items and have been met with further empty promises, or just bring your own hairdryer (i do, it's not what i paid for). Resigned to the fact I'm stuck in this contract for another 8 months, as on enquiry am told that I can't end it early, even with the poor facilities.
showerReviews.author: me BethHodges

locations.title: BS7 Gym
locations.address: Seat Unique Stadium, Nevil Rd, Bishopston, Bristol BS7 9EJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been at this gym since for a few years now and it has gone from strength to strength. A fantastic gym with great facilities, staff are super friendly and always up for a chat before or after a session. The sauna is a great added feature not to mention the addition of the squash court. The HPZ really takes the gym to another level and with it being recently refurbished its just incredible, really gives it that elite sports facility feeling. The gym has recently all been refurbished and it looks phenomenal, from the paint work to the new floor mats just a massive upgrade from the old version. The separation of each room is fantastic so you can pick and choose which room you would like to train in. They have recently moved the machines around in the machine room which has made it so much more spacious and a great environment to train in. Cant speak on the female changing rooms but the male ones are really spacious and clean, their hand soap always smells nice too which is a bonus. One of the best smith machines Ive used in a gym super smooth and makes using it an ease. Staff are always up to help with any questions you may have and very knowledgeable. Never taken a class there so cant really speak on that. Another massive bonus is the lockers to keep belongings, most gyms tend not to have these which is a brilliant feature which other gyms should adopt. The water fountain is also great provides ice cold water every time. Gym is regularly cleaned throughout the day keeping it in great condition all day. Regarding over crowding, it has only ever been over crowded once but that was in January / February when new year members join other than that never really had an issue with over crowding. Parking is great too you can park literally opposite the scenic Bristol County Ground and whilst on the topic of cricket you get free access to cricket matches during the cricket season which tops it all off for me as a massive cricket fan.

Overall a definite 5 ⭐️‘s from me
showerReviews.author: MRB cricket

showerReviews.reviewText: Separated into rooms makes people new to gyms much more comfortable, I find. Great selection of classes and a free personal trainer session when you join makes it so you always feel supported. Free lockers, plus a sauna. Best gym I've belonged to. It also gives you access to the cricket and discounts at several nearby cafés, etc. I do wish there was more space for bikes, and that it opened slightly earlier. There's apparently a swimming pool further away but I need to look into that more before I let the distance knock a star off.
showerReviews.author: Matthew Randell

showerReviews.reviewText: The ladies showers were out of order for the first two months I used this gym. The gym is old fashioned and overpriced for what you get. The classes were the worst I’ve had in a Bristol gym, with one of the PT’s just picking out newbies in every class and asking them what exercise they  wanted to do. Mortifying for newcomers who want to keep their heads down and not stand out as a ‘gym newbie’. Some of the exercises in the class were also dangerous, I temporarily damaged my back from doing them, after following instruction from the PT. There is also no air con so the whole place gets extremely hot as soon as any heat hits the roof, I asked politely why there was no aircon to a member of staff, as I’ve never had this in a gym before, and he responded very sarcastically ’because it would cost us £35,000 a year’. I requested to quit after not attending for over a month and got slapped with an extra £35 charge which they have for whatever reason struggled to take from me and now requested I go in to make the payment. Absolutely would not recommend. Do not waste your time.
showerReviews.author: Tula

locations.title: PureGym Bristol Brislington
locations.address: 2C, Brislington Retail Park, Brislington, Bristol BS4 5NG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is in desperate need of a full refurbishment. It hasn’t been updated since it opened years ago and the difference compared to other local gyms is embarrassing. The equipment is seriously outdated, squeaky, and in most cases rusty. On top of that, it lacks basic machines that every modern gym has — there’s no hip thrust machine (only an outdated time-consuming barbell setup) and no seated leg curl, which massively limits training options. Shockingly, there isn’t even a hack squat or v squat machine. Because of how outdated the gym is, the hygiene isn’t not very good either. Good hygiene is essential at a gym.

Members are paying for a facility that is far behind the standard of the area. A refurbishment is urgently needed to bring it up to date with better quality machines, more variety, and an overall safer and more motivating environment. Until serious investment is made, this gym simply doesn’t justify the membership fee.

Please refurb the gym!!
showerReviews.author: Sha

showerReviews.reviewText:
A client of 5 years but it’s time to go. I’ve had to cancel my membership as I’m going away for 3 months and had plans to continue as usual right after. I cancelled it way before it was suggested to avoid being charged for another month. I’ve had two weeks left to use but the membership was cancelled with an immediate effect and couldn’t use the facility anymore? Why, when I’ve paid for the full month? 3 tickets have been submitted to customer service - no response. Unacceptable, especially with it being the only gym group with no scales in the men’s changing room (might be just Longwell Green).

UPDATE: The team has now been in touch and provided an alternative solution. Please count on this review as neutral. The facility however is worth your attention.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not available for locals who need a shower.  So unless you're truck driver who's also paying for the meals and parking, don't botheryoull be turned away smelly🤨.

I came especially because I dont have a shower and I've bought several meals here recently.  I felt pretty shoddily treated. I won't come back until the policy changes

The claim is that the truckers won't have enough shower access but when I went to the loo last time there was an empty female shower that didn't look too well used.  Also, how many truckers are female?

Thanks for responding and for considering a change in policy.  I've added a star back for that.
I'll add five ⭐️ if you allow locals to use the showers too. You could link it to buying a meal? I've bought two meals there recently  so perhaps we could have some sort of loyalty points that allows a shower to be purchased for every meal or two drinks etc?
showerReviews.author: Jo Blick “Little Green Man”

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having recently experienced the cleaning service for the toilets, I can confidently say it was excellent. The attention to detail was impressive, leaving the facilities spotless and fresh. It’s clear that the team prioritizes hygiene and thoroughness, which made a notable difference in comfort and overall cleanliness.

Whether for a home, office, or public space, such meticulous care ensures a pleasant environment for everyone who uses the toilets. The surfaces were gleaming, and there was no lingering unpleasant odor—just a clean, welcoming atmosphere.

In summary, if you’re seeking reliable and high-quality toilet cleaning, this service stands out for its excellence. It’s a small but essential aspect that contributes greatly to a tidy and hygienic space, and I highly recommend it.

locations.title: Chippenham Pit Stop
locations.address: Oakleigh Acres M4 Motorway, Draycot Cerne, Chippenham SN15 5LH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Chippenham Pit Stop is one of the best places I’ve stopped at while driving a truck.

The food is fresh, tasty, and served quickly – proper portions and fair prices.

The whole place is very clean, including the toilets and showers.

The shop has everything a trucker might need – from snacks and drinks to truck supplies and tools. It’s clear they really care about drivers here.

Highly recommended for anyone passing through – especially if you’re in a lorry.
I’ll definitely be back! ❤️🚛

Oh and shaun 😆
showerReviews.author: Michael Porebsky

showerReviews.reviewText:
So you can park, eat, shower and drink here. But god forbid you buy a pack of beers from the shop to drink with your meal.
Ale drinkers aren't catered for in the dining facility.
I asked in the cafe which I could bring into the establishment from the shop next door, as it sells the  beer I like, the reply was whatever you want.
When trying to pay for my 4 cans plus the meal I'd ordered i was informed I couldn't drink them inside, I was entitled to sit in the outside seating area.
To make things easier I said I will get my food to go, I've only been in the truck for over 12 hours today, and to sit and have a meal and a beer would of been nice.
So if u drink larger you'll be fine as you are catered for.
I do understand its to do with licensing laws, but surely a better selection of ales should be available both from the shop and the cafe section.
Possibly also some staff training as to what is correct to inform customers??
Still a good truck stop, but this  has let it slip a little bit in my opinion
showerReviews.author: Russ McClure

locations.title: Onroute Truckstops - Swindon Truckstop
locations.address: Swindon truck stop Oxford road, Oxford Rd, Swindon SN3 4ER, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow! Onroute Truckstops have been very busy at Swindon! What an amazing difference! My last visit to Swindon was shall we say, ‘below expectations’; I really struggled to believe this was the same place.

On arrival the entrance was clean, clear and has obviously been attended to with the usual rubbish and debris cleared away. The security hut has had a complete refurb which was much needed. As a driver attending any truck stop if your first line of sight is dirt, rubbish and dilapidated buildings it immediately raises alarm bells as to what sort of site you’re visiting.  Signage to parking was clear and concise, and there was ample space available.  Traffic flow was moderate and free.

First engagement was the canteen, by which entry was via a newly developed entrance.  Stunning.  New groundwork’s was colourful and very pleasing to the eye.  There were new picnic tables positioned outside - and were being used.  New plants were positioned, giving the homely welcome.  A huge effort has been made to greet customers to this area and the transformation from the old side entrance is worlds apart.  There are new big screens displaying menus, new information points, leaflets, all safety measures present, serviceable, in date and correctly placed where applicable.

I met ‘Claire’ behind the counter, who was welcoming, bright and bubbly and just what you need to lift your spirits from the drama and stress of the highways. Also in attendance were approximately 4 other staff and the whole food counter experience was top class.  A very nice touch was a bowl of free healthy fruit for visitors. Well done there.  Food service was very quick - top marks.

The canteen was spotless. There were plenty of customers throughout the day (I was there for a 24hr stop) and I watched with interest the positive energy this team had going on. Everyone was greeted with a welcome and a smile.  No name badges though, I’d like to have seen that - it’s a more personal presentation to thank someone and show appreciation by referring to them by name. It’s also awkward to have to ask, maybe this should be considered. On the opposite side of the coin it equally encourages staff to deliver excellence as it’s much easier to identify individual failings. Certainly not the case here today however.

No sooner had a diner finished a staff member was instantly on hand to clean and disinfect and prepare the space for the next customer.  There was also excellent promotion and encouragement by the staff to download and use the Onroute app.

Feedback: drivers are still struggling to find the SNAP terminals to pay for parking and are constantly having to queue and ask at the counter, disrupting staff from the catering flow.  The terminals hidden away in the toilet corridor and are not signed. A staff member had put a handwritten sign on the access door to highlight the location but was told by management to take it down. This was a poor decision and negatively impacted good staff initiative.  It may not have been ideal or as professional as a custom branded sign, but it was better than nothing!  There is still no clear signage to the SNAP payment terminals and needs addressed for full score achievement.

The shop was well stocked and inviting. It’s bright and has most of the essentials needed for drivers. As soon as I approached the shop a member of staff was there to assist if needed. I made several purchases and the whole experience again was very good.

The toilet corridor from the canteen leads to access snap terminals, ladies, gents and disabled toilets, and showers.  It was clean, fresh, clear of debris; and both snap terminals were fully functional. All fire safety measures were present, in date and clearly identified.  Health & Safety measures were also in place and being used effectively.

Unfortunately I can’t give any further details as I’ve run out of characters! Happy to be contacted if necessary. Staff deserve special credit for a near perfect experience. Well done. Very well done.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

showerReviews.reviewText: It's been upgraded. Tepid soup was the order of the day and it just about made it out of the "cold " bracket. It's now a very small space in which the drivers eat compared to previously. Showers and toilets get the thumbs up though. I've eaten better food for less money. Next time I'll go to Sainsbury's next door and just buy something from there, it will be tastier than what I had. Do something about that soup, it's really bad, it was the vegetable soup and it was like someone just decided it would be best to use the old vegetables up by making a soup. The chef can't be happy, or doesn't have a tasting spoon. A dreary 1 star. Overall the old place was better for space. It feels cramped with 10 people in there
showerReviews.author: Mick Ward

showerReviews.reviewText:
👍 The Good
Secure parking – that’s a big win, especially with today’s load theft
Well-marked bays – no guesswork, no getting blocked in
Decent layout – you can actually park without playing Tetris with a 44-tonner
On paper, it ticks the boxes.
👎 The Bad (the stuff that actually matters at 2am)
2 toilets for 100+ spaces
That’s not a truckstop — that’s a queue simulator.
Cubicle size designed for jockeys
If you’re built like a proper driver and not a racing whippet, you’re fighting for elbow room just to sit down.
Only 2 showers
Again… for 100 trucks 🤦‍♂️
Token-only showers
And here’s the killer:
How do you buy a token when nobody’s around?
Answer: you don’t.
So you’re:
tired
parked up legally
doing the right thing
and still can’t wash or take a dump in peace
That’s when a place officially fails as a driver facility.
showerReviews.author: Jay J

showerReviews.reviewText: The best way to describe this place is a "Spit and shine." They don't seem to care about getting your tuck clean, They just want to get you out as quick as possible. I arrived that the truck wash as another truck was leaving, Ni one waiting behind me the entire time (it was not busy), so there was no need to rush. They simply sprayed the truck with TFR (soap) and started the roller wash. They then scrubbed my windows and only parts of the truck with a brush (no soap). I can safely say that that process is not enough to clean the truck properly, as I spent an hour cleaing the rest with quick detailer. Overall, I'm not happy with the outcome of my visit, and I will not be returning in the future.

locations.title: Moto Leigh Delamere M4 Westbound
locations.address: Junction 17 and 18, M4 westbound between, Chippenham SN14 6LB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Review of Moto Leigh:

Moto Leigh is a decent rest stop with a few notable highlights and areas needing improvement. One of its strong points is the cleanliness and organization of the restrooms, which were consistently well-maintained. This attention to hygiene certainly adds comfort to travelers.

However, visiting Moto Leigh during hot weather can be challenging as there are no cooling amenities available. The lack of air conditioning or fans makes it uncomfortable to rest, especially during peak summer days.

Additionally, while there are several restaurants on-site, most of them did not meet expectations in terms of food quality. This could be an area where improvements could enhance the overall experience.

On the positive side, the location is convenient, and parking facilities are ample, making it an accessible choice for travelers. With some enhancements, particularly in climate control and dining options, Moto Leigh could become a top-tier rest stop.
showerReviews.author: iman shahsamandi

showerReviews.reviewText: As an HGV driver frequently stopping at the Moto service station in Leigh Delamere West, I found the overall experience quite mixed. The food and seating areas were absolutely disappointing—far below expectations, with cleanliness and upkeep noticeably lacking, which made breaks less enjoyable. However, on the brighter side, I was genuinely impressed by the cleanliness of the showers. They were well-maintained and a pleasant surprise compared to many similar stops. That said, the extraction system in the shower area could use improvement, as it made the space very hot and uncomfortable at times. Overall, if cleanliness in the shower is your priority, this place scores well, but for food and seating comfort, it definitely needs attention and improvement.
showerReviews.author: Larry Holmes

locations.title: Ramada Bristol M5
locations.address: Welcome Break Gordano (Bristol) Service Area J19, M5, Bristol BS20 7XG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cheap and basic hotel next to M5 junction 19 Portbury.
Staff very friendly and efficient. Meals and drinks available until late.
Rooms large and clean. Usual tea/ coffee available. Hair dryer hidden away in a drawer.
Bathroom clean and large. Drench shower head a nice surprise.
Rooms not refreshed daily, you'll need to ask at the front desk for replacement items.
Only negative issue I had was the windows did not close fully, allowing the sound of passing cars through.
I used the Port Way park and ride into Bristol over the Long Ashton P&R as it is easier to get to and to pick up in town.

I would use this hotel again providing it's still value
showerReviews.author: Andy Parry

locations.title: Welcome Break Sedgemoor Northbound Services M5
locations.address: Sedgemoor Services Northbound M5 Jct 22/21, Weston-super-Mare BS24 0JL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Probably the worst services I’ve been to! We stopped at the southbound on the way down, which was good and so we stopped at the northbound on the way back up. What a mistake!! Baby changing facilities were poor, no separate baby changing/family room, it was included in the disabled which you needed to go and ask for a key for. But there was a separate shower room? Tell me which one would get more use? Proper family changing facilities or a shower room? Changed my daughter in the women’s toilets (is there a separate changing table in the men’s I wonder?) and it was set far too high. I’m 5ft 4 and the changing table was at chest height. Food options very limited  Tiny Burger King with no seating, the main seating are is very small and had food and rubbish all over the floor. Starbucks had my dad waiting 15 minutes for them to hand a cinnamon bun over to him (not heated up, why it took 15 minutes to give it to him I don’t know). There is a subway which seemed popular (no doubt because it was the only place you could a proper sandwich, the WHSmiths had a few sad looking, overpriced sandwiches. I ended up buying a small packet of crisps and two chocolate bars for £5.15. A woman next to me paid £4.50 for one pre packaged sandwich. Such a difference when compared to the southbound services over the road, where they have extensive seating, better food options and even a small farm shop selling cakes, coffee, flowers and local produce. Best avoid the northbound!
showerReviews.author: Elizabeth Beal

locations.title: ibis Bristol Centre
locations.address: Explore Lane For Car Park Use Bs1 5ll, Bristol BS1 5TY, United Kingdom
locations.street: Explore Lane For Car Park Use Bs1 5ll

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here for 4 nights and 5 days, and it was a great experience overall. The location is very convenient — walking distance to the station and close to great restaurants, attractions, and key places to visit around Bristol.

The room was modernly furnished with a vibrant touch. The facilities were great: comfortable bedding, a spacious bathroom, a large desk, hangers, and efficient heating that kept the room warm. The bed was super comfy, and the towels were excellent quality — room was cleaned and we were even provided with fresh towels on the fourth day without asking.

Staff are absolutely lovely and kind, room services presented every day asking if any tea/coffee top up needed or fresh linen or towels.

Check-in and check-out were quick and smooth. There’s also a scenic bar/café on the ground floor, and they even offer umbrellas for rent — a thoughtful touch for rainy days.

There were some minor constructive comments to share but nothing major

Overall, a great stay and excellent value for money compared to similar hotels nearby. Definitely recommend!
showerReviews.author: zeekay olee

showerReviews.reviewText: The dirtiest hotel I've stayed in in a long time.Desperately in need of a deep clean.My room was really grimy...a bit like tired student accommodation.There was an old fashioned shower curtain stained brown on the inside, a rim of brown in the shower tray, something brown around the shower handle and sticky dust in the corners of the bathroom floor that had accumulated over time.The carpet had brown stains on it like someone had spilled hot chocolate by the door.The bedding smelt fusty and was slightly off white and the towels were threadbare.No soundproofing from the road so take earplugs if you really don't mind the grime.Staff are unhelpful.I saw previous (young pretty) guests leave luggage but when I asked they said they didn't do it.No one asked how my stay was when I left so I've left a review instead. I paid £124!!! and needed a shower when I got home to recover.
showerReviews.author: alex bagnall

showerReviews.reviewText: Friendly greeting and quickly checked in. Room was standard Travelodge room which I expected. Now the not so good bits.  Lots of hairs in the room , dirty towel so not great.  The car park woefully small. I took the last slot in-between two vans. It was tight. Why build a hotel with insufficient parking. Local area not great. Aircon sounded like a tractor with a broken exhaust and no way could anyone sleep with such a noise. Got woken up at 3.15 with police sirens due to a police station being directly opposite, from then on I could just here road noise and couldn't get back to sleep. Best part of my stay was leaving and I won't be going back.

locations.title: The Camp at The Wave
locations.address: Main Rd, Bristol BS35 5RE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We decided to stay here for one night on our way down to Cornwall. I am a seasoned camper and festival goer, my sweet husband is not. I have had more comfortable camping experiences in the pouring rain at Bloodstock than I did here.

The rooms are small with high ceilings, so any heat is immediately lost upwards. The mattresses are thin and worn out. The double bed is actually two single beds pushed together and feels incredibly claustrophobic. The only room that is heated is the living/dining area, the wood burner is a lovely touch but due to no fan aspect, the heat is once again, lost upwards. In the end, we swaddled ourselves in the duvets on the sofa bed in an effort to keep warm and comfortable. There are no towels provided, not even a tea towel or a hand towel.

As far as location goes, it's okay, it's near enough Bristol and a few amenities. It is not peaceful or relaxing as advertised though as it's very close to the M5 and there's a freight rail line that runs very close and all through the night.

To call this 'glamping' is an insult to camping. For anyone who thinks camping has to be this dire, it doesn't!
showerReviews.author: Katherine Booth

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Wave is an amazing place and we are so happy it's back in business, the kids had an amazing time. The Camp was a good experience overall but still room for improvement. I was expecting the tent to be much cleaner considering the price per night. I'll list what we noticed:
1) Bedding didn't appear to be clean as we saw hair from previous guest.
2) Not enough wood for a booking of 3 nights, the tent gets very cold at night and if there's no sunlight in the day. So enough wood to keep the tent warm is a must.
3) Not enough toilet roll for a family of 3 for three nights, though the tent toilet (porta-potty) is for night emergencies, it was actually used during the day as my autistic son didn't want to constantly walk to the shower area where there are proper toilets.
4) Rubbish under beds, old socks from previous guest under bed, food wrappers, food crumbs, a lot of dust, spider webs and spiders living under the bed crawling up to the bed was upsetting. This shows a total lack of proper cleaning of our tent (tent 4) which was unfortunate to see. Of course the odd insect in the countryside is normal, it would be expected that spider webs would be cleared out for guests staying as best as possible.
5) Sign said food up until 8:30pm, but didn't say that food is only served until 5pm on Tuesdays, this was not noted on the signage upon arrival, and went without dinner and ended up with two very  hungry kids. That needs updating as it's misleading to guests. Went in to buy snacks and was turned away.
6) The surfing experience was amazing, but The Camp can make some major improvements as noted above, especially for the price that they are asking per night.
7) Staff at the camp generally very helpful, especially the girl with the northern accent, unfortunately didn't catch her name.

Hope this is helpful for The Camp to see and make improvements for future guests. Thanks for the experience.
showerReviews.author: Liz Farrow (ERFarrow)

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently spent four days surfing at The Wave in Bristol and stayed two nights at The Camp. Overall, we had a great time surfing — the wave pool is absolutely brilliant, with perfect waves for all levels and friendly, helpful instructors. However, our experience with the accommodation was quite disappointing.

Five days before our arrival, our booking for the first night was suddenly cancelled, even though we had made the reservation three to four weeks earlier. We were told it was due to a booking error with Booking.com, but it was frustrating to receive such short notice and to have to rearrange everything so close to our trip. As a suggestion, better communication between The Wave and Booking.com would help prevent this kind of issue — cancellations shouldn’t happen only five days before arrival when the booking has been confirmed for weeks.

We were also not offered any help to store our surfboards during the cancelled night, which meant we had to carry them unnecessarily.

When we finally checked in, there was no firewood left for the evening, and no one came to bring any before leaving for the night. The tents don’t have any heating apart from the wood burner, which only warms up the kitchen and living area — the bedrooms stay quite cold.

The tent hadn’t been properly cleaned either — there were food scraps and bits of plastic on the floor around the kitchen and living area. There was also no toilet paper in the small private toilet (which is meant for emergencies at night — during the day you’re expected to use the shared shower block).

The shared showers are actually very good — clean, with adjustable hot water, which is much appreciated when it’s cold.

As for comfort, the mattresses are quite worn out and sink a lot; you can feel the springs. The Velcro fastenings on the bedroom windows don’t close properly, so cold air comes in during the night. The kitchen lacks a proper coffee maker (only instant coffee provided), one of the pans had been stored dirty, and the cookware is of poor quality — food sticks easily. Everything else was fine.

In summary, The Wave itself is an incredible experience — the wave pool and the staff (the “Wavemakers”) are outstanding and made the surf sessions really enjoyable. However, The Camp needs much better maintenance, cleaning, and communication with guests. We hope these issues can be improved, because the place has great potential.
showerReviews.author: Victoria Lorca Cámara
