locations.title: Brook Lodge Farm Camping & Caravan Park
locations.address: Brook Lodge Farm, Bristol BS40 5RB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Honestly this was my first time camping in UK and you can imagine what would be my situation. But trust me from the day I decided this place till the end Debbie and Steve was so helpful. Let me talk about the place I reached the place without any trouble. If you are coming via Bypass A38 just keep in mind the nearest landmark is Holiday Inn Hotel, the farm is just 10mtr ahead oppst side of the road and if you are coming from Bristol Airport once you cross the Cowslip Grn you have to slowdown due  to low visibility, it’s immediate sharp downward . The Campsite had all the facilities as mentioned in their website, incase if you need anything extra just give a call to Debbie she will arrange in no time. They really built everything keeping guest in mind multiple toilets with shower facilities. There is a freezer and refrigerator to keep your food and drinks. The campsite is fully secured no outsider allowed. Just ensure you are carrying enough food and grocery you won’t find any store nearby, you have to travel all the way to Bristol which is not really far though (approx 6.7mls). The farm is surrounded by lot of places to walk and jog around. And if you have kids I suggest should visit Wookey Hole in Somerset. It’s a nice smaller campsite, good facilities, brilliant service from the site owner, would stay again!
Check on their website they have music fest coming up.
showerReviews.author: Nihar Ranjan

showerReviews.reviewText: Tidy clean site located on a chicken(egg) farm close to chew valley lake. Lovely and quiet with trees sheltering the outskirts and fields surrounding , ideal for dog walks. The site was very well kept with beautifully clean toilet,  shower, washing up area. They provide ehu, fridge and freezer, chemical toilet disposal, information shed and book swap. The lady who was in charge for the weekend was helpful and very attentive. You can buy eggs from site, watch the local birds and alpacas or even pop to the local pub. I would definitely recommend and return.
showerReviews.author: Melly Kennedy

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic place to camp (for motor homes and tent campers) near to a beautiful lake. We camped right up next to the alpacas which were so cute! There was plenty of room on the field and the toilet/shower/kitchen facilities were clean and nearby. They even had a freezer and microwave in the kitchen. On one morning we woke up and the gas for hot water in the showers was out and the owners were very helpful in getting this sorted for us. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. Thank you for having us!
showerReviews.author: Alice Appleby

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just come back home, from staying here for a night.
After not camped out for over 20 years (and almost 50 years for my sister) this site exceeded our expectations.
It took a lot of persuading for my sister to camp in my tent, and after our stay here, she is smitten by the camping bug, and is wanting to do this again soon!!
A lovely levelled grassed site, very easily reached from the road along a stone driveway.
We were greeted and shown to our pitch-right by the 3 alpacas-what an absolute joy!
Shown where the amenities were. Super clean toilets (newly installed in the last 2 years) lovely showers and washing up block with a  fridge, freezer and microwave oven provided ..this block is open 6am -10pm.
Dogs permitted and they were all on leads..they enjoyed the walks from the site.
Being an adult only site, it was tranquil, and most relaxing. There is a pub within easy walking distance.
If exploring the area- Cheddar, Bath and Frome are within easy driving distance.
Really enjoyed watching the stars, hearing the owls hooting and listening to the fire pits crackling.
This site is within Bristol airport flight path, but honestly, it didn't spoil the quietness of this lovely site.
Highly recommend! We will be back again
showerReviews.author: Helen Smith

We had the most delightful stay at Gosswood park campsite this weekend. The grounds were very well maintained,  lovely showers and facilities in peaceful surroundings. Electric hook-up was available on a large flat hard standing pitch, which was very welcome since it got quite chilly at night and we could use our heater in our camper.

We had a warm welcome from Simon  soon after our arrival who gave us good pointers on local walks and pubs within walking distance (there were loads).

We luckily only live an hour away from Gosswood park and will definately be back soon to enjoy the tranquil beautiful surroundings again soon. :-))))

Thank you, we will be back.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We came here to camp as a base to explore the local area.
The campsite is large and very relaxed. It did feel more like a festival than a campsite which made noise levels a little unsociable. If you are prepared for this then it's not an issue.  Due to the large number of visitors they could definitely have done with more showers and washing up facilities.  The water also needed to be warmer than 40 degrees for washing up. Everything was clean though.
Obviously, there is plenty to do here as it is part of the larger activity centre. There is also a lovely walk nearby.
I would highly recommend bringing screw rock pegs as even standard rock pegs weren't strong enough to secure tents to the ground.

showerReviews.reviewText: We’ve just had two nights at Nettwood Farm Campsite in the Woodland Pod - it was the best weekend. We loved the pod, it was perfect very well equipped. The wood fired hot tub was a dream - although in this 30 degree heat wave we didn’t bother lighting it and enjoyed it as a cool dip plunge pool instead to cool off each afternoon and eve after some gorgeous walks around the area! We aren’t ‘campers’ but this Glamping pod was wonderful. We forgot to bring tea bags, but nipped to the Tesco nearby on the Friday night, and also didn’t bring enough towels but this was sorted by Debbie and we collected what we needed that night too! Pizzas were great!l too! All in all it was a fantastic weekend away - we only live in Bristol so it was about 45-50 min drive but felt like we were a million miles away! A proper break celebrating our 7 year wedding anniversary and great to be somewhere different in this heat wave and able to cool off :) Thank You! We’ll be back! :)
showerReviews.author: Gemma Dunford

locations.title: Towed Town Camping
locations.address: 152, 179 Kingsland Rd, Bristol BS2 0QW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
You couldn't pay me to try and attempt to stay here again. There was long curly black hairs in my "clean" bed (neither of us have black hair), the caravan was in poor condition with stained walls and peeling fake wallpaper held up by tape, the "clean" shower and toilet cubicle was still damp with shower water. Our water jug inside was still half empty by whoever was there last and not refilled, nothing stocked in the honesty bar except half-empty bottles of room temp booze. The menu for the bar has been vandalised too and not changed back.
No one cares about this place, it is in awful condition!

Cute concept, the worst execution. We booked for one night to stay over for a train the next day and it was horrendous. Left after two hours of trying to make myself not feel sick by the dirty state of everything and spent money on a different accomodation. Owners should be ashamed of themselves, literally any hostel is better than this. Makes my skin crawl just thinking about it. 0 stars if I could.

DO NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE WHO VALUES CLEAN BED SHEETS OR A ROOM THAT DOESNT STINK. There are similarly priced places with better hygiene.
showerReviews.author: Summer

showerReviews.reviewText: I struggled to enter the building, in the cold and dark trying to figure out the door code, it didn't recognise my finger because I was so cold and I felt unsafe being stuck on my own outside at night. Place was empty with no one to greet or help you. I tried to call the number for help but it went to voicemail and no one returned my call. The shower holder was broken, meaning for an awkward shower. Upon arrival, the shower block smelled strongly of damp from not being aired out properly. The room was fine but not great. The TV remote was out of battery. There were clumps of dust meaning I was sneezing and had itchy eyes from the allergies. At the time of booking, I asked a question about how to keep the room cool at night (because I can't sleep if it's too hot) and was told there was a heater in the room if I got cold ...? That didnt answer my question ...? Turns out the place is deathly freezing cold so that's good! I asked about using lockers the next day after check out, but had to follow up with this query that morning, and was told that I could only use them for 2 hours, which isn't very helpful for a whole day of exploring a city. I think I left my phone charger in the room so I enquired but never heard back. Turns out other people were staying there, but they didn't shut the front door properly after their night out. They also left the next door open so my section was really cold in the morning. Not worth the money, much better staying in a hotel for the same money but better facilities and customer service.
showerReviews.author: L V D T

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely Perfect for a peaceful no frills, no fuss stay! Very easy and helpful booking, with directions and information. Just what I needed for an overnight stay. There are showers and toilets in the campervan field, waste bins and a caravan sales and service centre the otherside of the road! Met some friendly chickens and there’s a nice walk nearby. All this for £12.50 pp per night! Will definitely return again for hopefully a longer stay.

showerReviews.reviewText: Bristol camping has been fantastic for me! I have been doing some training for a new job in the area and hotels are crazy money (but I do also enjoy camping) I actually have been using my car with a bed in the back and some make shift window covers! Very reasonable good facilities toilet and a nice hot shower. I even messaged at around 9pm at night as (user error) I couldn’t get the shower to work and they came to look which I thought was amazing considering it was nighttime. There are lovely animals that roam the site (chickens and I believe to be turkeys!) which is really fun. Will definitely stay again when I’m in Bristol next year. Nice and quiet too considering it’s close to the motorway Thanks , George
showerReviews.author: george payne

showerReviews.reviewText: In a busy, nonstop world, this campsite offers you an escape and the freedom to be free. The wilderness allows for foraging and fires, whilst offering the creature comforts of the best hot, clean shower outside of a regular abode. Annalisa is friendly and makes sure you are super comfortable and feel right at “home”. Without a doubt, see you again next year! Would highly recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText: Fabulous tent camping spot with large woodland area, open green areas, crop fields, and surrounding countryside. We rented for 3 nights in summer, 3 adults, 5 kids (3-7 years). The tenting location has no direct car access, but there’s a small parking area in site around 200m away, where you’ll leave the car and drop stuff (if tenting), they do have caravan and tourer areas separately. There are a couple of pubs within a decent walking distance of 45mins perhaps leisurely. Otherwise, there are superstores, pubs, small local shops a short 5-10 min drive away. This site is close-ish to the motorway, so if it’s real quiet you may hear a background buzz but we didn’t notice it. Finally, fair to mention that there is an electricity pylon on the car park area, where a clear buzzing can be heard when near, and when local usage is high (Sat nights) the buzz is more intense - this wasn’t a problem, and barely noticed (only when passing or intense Fri & sat night buzz in dead if night). If you’ll be having a few beers and you’re not alone, you won’t notice a thing. Very friendly and accommodating owners who past by and said hello. Excellent warm shower facilities, fires and BBQs welcomed! Great for kids
showerReviews.author: R Willis

showerReviews.reviewText:
Positives:
•Feels wild
•Best toliets/shower I've ever seen on a nearly wild site
•Pitches are hidden away in a woods so you feel like you are looking for a true wild spot
•Dogs are allowed but only on lead, this benefited us as we have unfortunately had too many random dogs approach us at other places
•Fires are allowed as well and wood foraging
•Wheelbarrows provided for easy transportation of gear
•Car parking

Negatives
•Yes there is road noise but it's not that bad

Overall we loved it, it was peaceful and easy to get to and great value for money.
Booking again soon.
showerReviews.author: Samantha Bailey

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bucklegrove holiday park is an amazing site to stay at. We stayed here for an overnight stop in a motorhome and decided to come back for another 2 nights at the end of the week.
The pitches are great, giving plenty of space.
The swimming pool is great.
The bar & restaurant was lovely, with great friendly staff and entertainment for the kids.
This site has such a personalised approach with lots of character.
It's unique that it's a smaller site with lots to do (without it being a big chain holiday park).
We will definitely be coming back to try one of the lodges 💛
showerReviews.author: eleanor bourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff and nice and straightforward getting in and setup in our camper.

Toilets were clean and showers had great pressure and ran nice and hot.

The bar and restaurant was also nice, offering the standard sort of food you'd expect at a very reasonable price.

Gravel pitch was somewhat level and electric hookup worked faultlessly. Water point was also close by.

Would recommend this site for anyone looking for somewhere to stay in their camper.

locations.title: EuroResorts
locations.address: Woodlands, 17, North Court The Courtyard, Bristol BS32 4NQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have spend a wonderful 2 months with Euroresorts on Alannia Costa Blanca last February and March (2025). The mobile home was perfect. Clean, relatively new, 3 bedrooms, bathroom and a livingroom with kitchen. Gas stove with 4 burners, so perfect for our cooking ;-) Preferrably we would have liked to have a little bigger bathroom/shower, but we have managed well. Clean towels and bed linnen every week to collect, and that was really nice.
Sales and aftersales/customer service has been great. Very responsive and helpfull, all to just make sure we were accommodated prior to and during our stay.
We also loved Alannia Costa Blanca. Very well equiped camp site, with loads of things to do on site and off site. Wonderful swimming pool, great spa, and very useful supermarket for fresh bread and the things you might have forgotten to buy end need at the minute.
Good and relatively safe biking or hiking opportunities around the site.
Long story short, we have already booked again for next year, and we can really recommend Euroresorts and Alannia Costa Blanca.
showerReviews.author: RW

locations.title: Bath Sports and Leisure Centre
locations.address: N Parade Rd, Bathwick, Bath BA2 4ET, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visit regularly with my kids mostly to use the trampoline park.  It's always clean and tidy, staff friendly and helpful. Only downside being there's no water dispenser in there now, so take your own refreshments! And they could be more punctual starting the induction video on time for each session. Twice now we've booked for a set time, but dont actually get into the trampoline park until nearly 12-15 minutes into our hour session because of waiting for staff to come up and play the 3 minute safety video. Also it's never emphasised by staff to the mostly young visitors to actually watch and listen to it given its a safety video.

The swimming pool is really nice, one large slide, a smaller one for 4-8 year olds and a tiny one for toddlers. Lots of features in the leisure pool for kids too like fountains etc and plenty of lifeguards on hand who are also very helpful (given free changijg room tokens as one of the machines were working and arrived in reception at exactly at booked time so they gave us extra time to ensure we got our full hour actually in the pool! Changing facilities are clean, pools warm and sessions arent overcrowded either.  Really nice place to go!

Bowling alley isnt great. Narrow Isles which dont seem to be entirely level, need better maintenence and the food served isnt great.

Overall a really nice place to visit with great staff, also has a soft play and now a 'putting range' too.

Just check before going that there isnt a Bath Rugby match on when youre due to visit as you'll get stuck in traffic backed up to Widcombe with fans attending, and you won't get a parking space!
showerReviews.author: Sarah Y

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing to express my concern regarding the pricing at Bath Leisure Centre. My recent visit with my two children for a swimming session highlighted what I feel are excessive costs. The total expenditure for a single hour of pool use was significant, with a combined entry fee of £19.65, a parking fee of £3.50, and an additional charge for locker use.

As a facility operated by what I understand to be a charitable trust, I find these costs to be unexpectedly high and a significant barrier to entry for many in the community. Such a pricing model makes it difficult for lower-income families to access a valuable recreational activity, which seems to run counter to the purpose of a charitable organization. I believe it is important to reconsider these charges to ensure the center is truly accessible to all.
showerReviews.author: RJH

locations.title: Combe Grove - Health and Wellbeing Centre
locations.address: Brassknocker Hill, Bath BA2 7HS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the outset the grounds and main building are beautiful, followed by a really lovely older lady on check in which to be fair was the highlight of our stay, she was simply wonderful.

From there it was less pleasing, but I can't be too critical as all in all it was fine. The breakfast was ok, although it lacked a few items I'd have enjoyed as the cooked breakfast was served in Bain Marie's as opposed to cooked to order. You have to pay extra for a flat white (which ok I agree with had it been any other time of the day, but it should come as part of breakfast at no extra cost). The breakfast area is in the bar and in the bistro all of which have windows overlooking the lovely scenery, but none of the tables were placed in the windows and it was lined up like a school dinner hall, we of course done some DIY and moved our table in to the window (as you can see in the photos) to the delight of some staff but to the dismay of others (one staff member in particular but it's not worth going there, as unlike the others she seemed as though she was there for the money and to get home as quickly as possible)

The rooms too are basic and lacked essentials such as a fridge, bottle opener, fresh milk etc. Little attention is paid to the cleanliness as we found the room to have cup ring residue on the surfaces and quite dusty. views were a "woodland" view which I don't really have an opinion on but would have preferred more of the rolling hills view. It was comfortable don't get me wrong and I guess you get what you pay for (and what's available).

The worst part of this is the leisure facilities in particular the pool and changing rooms (popped my head in the gym which looked good and had some good equipment) but the pool area was very dirty and NOTHING worked. This area needs serious attention as it really let's the rest of the place down. I spoke to someone who was a member and I asked is it always like this and he said yes, and they are going to leave as it's been like that for months, despite multiple requests from members to fix the place up and get everything in working order.I would have put 4 stars had the full experience have been there but by no means is it a 4 star hotel.

The staff were all pleasant and helpful so I guess theres not really any room for improvement there. So all in all I've had to give this 3 stars. I would of course come back if the facilities were to be improved.
showerReviews.author: Wayne Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolute gem in the countryside near Bath. The welcome by John was friendly and efficient and he escorted us to our room. We had a garden terrace room away from the main house and we were very impressed. The views spectacular. The walk to the main house was less than 3 mins but you do need to be mobile due to steps. The steps are not steep or high steps so manageable. The staff were knowledgeable and welcoming
Introducing locally sourced produce including beers and gins.  Food exceptional. Perfect break... inc driving range tennis courts swimming pool and spa... even classes to join all free to guests...
Fantastic place.... downside....hmmmm prices not evident.. when adding items to your room.
showerReviews.author: Sharon Harwood

It was easy to book but you can turn up but it can get busy

Changing rooms are great too - separate male and female

showerReviews.reviewText: Wow. What can I say. The swimming lesson provision at Dragonfly leisure for my 3/4 year old has been life changing for her!! She was terrified of the water until she started with Lotte and Charlene - particularly due to her poor vision. They were so wonderful with her and created the most beautiful relationship with her. She can now swim 10m confidently and that is all down to their incredible and friendly teaching. We have moved away to London and one of the biggest sadnesses of moving away has been leaving her swimming lessons. On a visit back to family in Midsomer Norton we made sure to go swimming and visit Lotte! Thank you thank you thank you.
showerReviews.author: Beth Hollidge

showerReviews.reviewText:
Appalling.
Rude staff, freezing pool.
Myself and my family of five had to leave because the pool was so cold. Staff refused to listen to my complaint and told me to take a hike when I asked them about it. We paid £26 and got out after a few minutes because it was so cold. Cherry on top the changing rooms stank of urine.
AVOID - I will never be going there again.
Update - I was asked to email the manager who sent me an equally obnoxious email and threatened me with libel for writing this review! Ridiculous. Spend your money elsewhere people. 🤣

NB in response to the patronizing response below from the management - NO WE DID NOT STAY UNTIL THE END AND NO WE DID NOT ENJOY IT. This kind of public gaslighting from “the management” is disgraceful and should make your customers ask if they really need to be treated like this. Please don’t leave another response to my review in an attempt to silence me.
showerReviews.author: Will Harwood

showerReviews.author: Will Harwood

If you want to learn to swim give it a go.

showerReviews.reviewText: Been going to this gym since the day it opened and it does the job for sure. It’s not a massive gym but it doesn’t get particularly busy compared to other gyms. Changing rooms are too small. Could do with more machines such as a seated cable row machine, a standing calf press, and another smith machine (ideally with a thinner bar). Has a few too many treadmills as there’s only ever max. 5/6 people using them but usually less. Special mention to Adam Sellick who’s one of the staff/PTs there who has been there since day one and is fantastic. More so than any other staff member I see him spotting people with their lifts, dusting and cleaning, and reracking weights as well as rearranging dumbbells to make sure they’re in their designated place. Always got a welcoming, smiling face or is ready to lend a helping hand. The gym would NOT be the same without him. You can see he takes his job seriously and keeps himself in peak physical condition, further showing his dedication.
showerReviews.author: Matt Singh

locations.title: PureGym Bath Victoria Park
locations.address: Upper Bristol Rd, Bath BA1 3AT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Previously left a review on how it's a good gym but how gross the toilets/changing rooms are. Seems all they do in such an instance is request that customers get in touch to "discuss it" more - I'm not sure if this is just deflecting, or if a quota of complaints has to be met before head office would do anything? Both in terms of cleanliness and fittings/facilities, they're worse than the toilets you might expect at a secondary school gym (and not a private one, at that!). Yes, there are a lot of careless people who make it worse for everybody, but ultimately the same brown patches have been in the same places for months, and one tap has been broken forever. Could we get a macaque and train it to spray some bleach around?

showerReviews.reviewText: The Cross Bath was an ok experience for me. The water temperature was not warm enough for me on a day in late May, and it's situated outside. I was shivering about 10 minutes into my session, which was disappointing since you are able to stay for 1.5 hours. That wasn't possible for me because I was too cold and unable to relax. The shower was actually warmer than the thermal water. It's nice because it is limited to 10 people per session, but unfortunately, the day I went had a group of 7 college students who weren't respecting the essence of a spa, and the bath employees didn't do much to make the atmosphere more comfortable and relaxing. The staff apologized as I was leaving, but it would have been more appropriate to try and fix the situation in my opinion.
showerReviews.author: Erin Hinz

locations.title: Cleveland Pools
locations.address: Hampton Row, Bath BA2 6QS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful pool(s) in a beautiful setting. I've been swimming at Cleveland Pools once or twice a week since soon after it reopened this year and count myself lucky to have such a gem nearby. The staff are lovely and helpful, the pool itself (the main pool - the smaller children's pool is closed for the winter) is always clean and a delight to swim in. There are well-maintained toilets and 12 changing cubicles (each big enough for a family in the summer) around the pool, and the room that used to be the ladies' pool is well worth a look to see the display boards about the pool's history. There are hot and cold showers poolside and of course always a lifeguard on hand. Weekday sessions in the winter are very calm (usually a handful of people per session) but hopefully enough to justify keeping the pool open in future winters! Saturday morning sessions seem to see 20+ swimmers each (the limit is currently 40 per session). I imagine it will be far busier in the summer.

The heat pump is due to kick in some time around April, although as it is drawing heat from the river, it's not expected to make the pool spa-level hot (approx. 28 °C is the current expected maximum, I believe). In the winters the pool is unheated and predicted to get below 5 °C in the coldest months. Currently, in early December, the water temperature is about 8 °C. I've seen fellow swimmers in anything from full wetsuits to standard swimming costumes, and staff are always happy to advise on and chat about kit (hats, neoprene gloves and socks, etc.) if needed.

Parking can be tricky (there is none available onsite, with the exception of two disabled bays for Blue Badge holders) and there is not much public transport nearby. Sometimes you find some free on street parking or paid parking a little way away, but count on at least a 10 minute walk. If all else fails, the nearby Morrisons offers 3 hours' free parking, but it is a 20 minute walk. Walking from the train or bus station takes around half an hour.

All in all, Cleveland Pools is a real pearl and I hope it becomes at least a bit better known and manages to stay open year-round for many more years to come!
showerReviews.author: Claire Ruaro

showerReviews.reviewText:
Closed from Jan 2024 due to flooding of plant room. When will it reopen? Who knows? The trustees - despite having allegedly received £8m of public money - are extraordinarily uncommunicative.. In the 4 months it was open (Sept-Dec 2023) it is was good for very cold water swimming.

EDIT: rumours (unfortunately the only source of information that seems to exist) suggest that the trustees are at 'lawyers at dawn' with the builders/architects, and the baths won't reopen in 2024.
EDIT2: … or in 2025, but who knows? Possibly the Trustees but they don’t talk to us mortals.
showerReviews.author: John Sewell

showerReviews.reviewText:
A review of Cleveland Pools - which has been open a week or so following a complete restoration to its former glory.

The approach to the pool is through quiet and unassuming residential streets. A grand piece of metal work signage naming the pool marks the entrance. You then descend down a pathway to the riverside pool complex - which starts with panoramic views across the site. The pathway to the pool has beautifully presented information boards exploring the history of the lido. The main buildings and entrance are crafted in gleaming golden Bath sand stone - which takes the visitor back in time to a bygone era. The work has been done sympathetically and is not overly polished. It’s under Fusion management and the staff are very  helpful and friendly and clearly and rightfully proud of the place. The online booking was a little tricky and places well oversubscribed, so I had to use a few tricks to get in 😉. The quality of the restoration is excellent and the attention to detail and craftsmanship superb. The lido is flanked by 12 spacious stone changing rooms - each individually numbered with original lettering and inside each door is a storyboard of an historic figure that frequented the lido or was associated with it. The pool itself is unheated and was about 19 when I swam. The pool is about 20 or so meters - so good for proper lengths and has 3 lanes with an additional wider lane taking in the arch of the pool. A heat pump is being installed which once complete will warm the pool all year around to about 28! There are grassy areas, seating areas, spacious and clean modern toilets, a communal changing area and bag storage room, good showers, lockers, a small cafe and a good sized toddler pool. A pontoon is under construction on the riverside which will allow boats to dock and drop off swimmers who have journeyed by river. Overall this is one of the finest lidos in the world and is unrivalled in terms of structure and history. Highly recommended - but book via App well well in advance to your planned visit. — at Cleveland Pools
showerReviews.author: shockingvibes2000

showerReviews.reviewText: This was my first Aufguss ritual and I couldn’t have asked for a more perfect setting. Warleigh Weir is the perfect backdrop and swimming in the Avon is better than any cold plunge that I’ve tried! The sauna itself is excellent - spacious and very hot. Can’t wait to come back
showerReviews.author: Jack D-J

showerReviews.reviewText: This was my first Aufguss ritual and I couldn’t have asked for a more perfect setting. Warleigh Weir is the perfect backdrop and swimming in the Avon is better than any cold plunge that I’ve tried! The sauna itself is excellent - spacious and very hot. Can’t wait to come back
showerReviews.author: Jack D-J

showerReviews.reviewText: A unique and delightful sauna experience! Yes, not just a sauna, an experience. Firstly the location is unique. Situated by the Avon at Warleigh Wier, the sauna’s picture window allows you to gaze upon the river valley during your session. The Wier is a well-known wild swimming spot so perfect for cold plunges during the session. Then the session itself is like no other sauna I’ve tried. The sauna “Gus” leads a guided meditation while wafting scented, super-heated throughout the space. All accompanied and enveloped by music from the sound system embedded behind the sauna walls. It’s wild, exhilarating, and relaxing all at the same time.
showerReviews.author: Jon Williams

showerReviews.reviewText: A unique and delightful sauna experience! Yes, not just a sauna, an experience. Firstly the location is unique. locations.title: Public Toilets
locations.address: 1 Railway St, Bath BA1 1PF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: These toilets are my favourites in bath. The location is convenient, they are clean, well lit and free to use. There used to be long queues while they were being refurbished as there was just one toilet, but now I don't find that there are long queues. There's also an attendant, which makes the toilet feel safer and keeps it clean.. The cubicles are spacious too.
showerReviews.author: Stanley Laird

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice queuing system to ensure civilised toilet etiquette. Reasonably clean and new facilities. Male, female and disabled toilets available. All cubicles are stocked with toilet roll. Always a member of staff ensuring smooth operation.

Unfortunately, the light turns off after about 5 minutes, so if you plan on an extended stay, please be warned, you may need to wave your arms every so often.

Great location, but capacity could be increased to reduce waiting times. 4/5 will come again.
showerReviews.author: Donny

locations.title: Royal Victoria Park Bath
locations.address: Marlborough Ln, Bath BA1 2NQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Superb park with plenty of open green space, views of the famous Royal Crescent, and the beautiful Botanical Garden.
A lovely place for a walk, not far from the city centre. Plenty of benches to sit and enjoy the calming influence of nature. The Botanical Gardens boast an impressive collection of trees, with wonderful colours in October.
Facilities include a café, play area and plenty of paid parking. There's also a distinctive historic bandstand. One criticism - toilet facilities were poor when I visited, with several cubicles out of use due to damage, despite a 20p charge.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Thomas

showerReviews.reviewText:

locations.title: Pilot Travel Center
locations.address: 7767 NY-53, Bath, NY 14810, United States

showerReviews.reviewText: Very nice people and well stocked store. Bathrooms and showers were clean. Very busy pilot as most are with 70 semi spots available. The spots are definitely short if you have a longer wheelbase tractor. I first parked in the back corner but I was blocking the other corner spot to my right so I move to the front. Some pretty sad drivers tho when I saw a driver who pulled forward after fueling get the front end of his truck ripped off by some non English speaking driver in flip flops! Plenty of room and should have never happened.
showerReviews.author: Doug Sitko

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the cheapest if not the cheapest local to in and around Bath.
diesel and petrol available here.
There is also a tyre inflator and screen wash (guessing just water) and vacuum and fresh whatever that is from a machine.
Easy to access when this place is not busy and no traffic but when there are vehicles waiting out on the road then it causes traffic build up as it's a busy road not the best of locations but still useful.
This station is one way! Some people seem to not see the no entry signs  and cause issues on the road trying to back out.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Worst kept service station toilets I've ever been to.

On the way back to Ireland I stopped to take a break & use the toilet facilities before getting some food. Half of the gents was shut off with a barrier. That's fine, it was a quiet time of the day, so why keep it all open (less cleaning). Cleanliness-wise, no issue, it was clean & smelt okay. What was really disappointing was firstly despite the "caution hot water" notices on each sink, not a single hot tap worked. In fact, some were hanging off & one was even taped up (so staff know about the problem). Secondly, not a single soap dispenser had any soap in it. The final thing that then prompted me to write this review was the fact that the only two accessible hand-dryers didn't work either (& there are no paper towels).

All in all, far from the 'Welcome' you'd expect from a Welcome Break. Management at this establishment should be ashamed. All things that should be easily fixable.
showerReviews.author: Shaun Leahy

locations.title: Roadchef Strensham M5 Northbound
locations.address: 8, M5, Strensham, Worcester WR8 0BZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited today, I have been a few times to stop for a shower whilst on my 45 min break / daily rest. Waited 20 minutes to use the only female shower as it was in use. To my disbelief a man came out, I did ask him what he was doing in the only female shower when there were several male showers, he said a showers a shower & 'genders don't matter anymore'. This is disgusting, not only is there one shower for women, but its so easily accessible for anyone. Shower floods and the sink and toilet were an absolute state. Shower doesnt last long so you have to keep pressing it. I'm not going to lie it is probably one of the better showers ive been too however it's still not great. There is plenty of room to park & I like the variety of food outlets. However this experience is bad enough for me to complain about it. Around 1500hrs 17/7/25 I went to shower.
showerReviews.author: Lauren O'Shea

showerReviews.reviewText: Very convenient for City centre activities and shops. Room 32, a small room at the top of the building up 3 flights of stairs. Our toilet leaked, seemed like an on going saga and towels were readily provided. It was clean and comfortable but needs some love. The carpet is frayed by the door and it needs a coat of paint, particularly in the shower room.  Staff were helpful and efficient.  Rooms are above a busy, town centre pub next to a main road. Good breakfast.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Highly recommended as accommodation for your trip to Bath!
- The location offers excellent access to the city centre.
- The room was clean, quiet, and very comfortable. Plenty of hot water for showers as well.
- Above all, the breakfast was incredibly delicious — it truly became one of the highlights of our stay😋

A few things to note:
- There is no on-site parking, so you’ll need to use one of the nearby public car parks. They are only a short walk away.
- The accommodation is located on the upper floor of a pub. There is no elevator, so be cautious if you have heavy luggage (though the staff can help if you let them know).

showerReviews.reviewText: I had a great stay! I was there for 4 nights. It's such a homely and cozy place. Plenty of bathrooms and showers, loads of plants everywhere, tons of books! The vault is a really unique place with games, crafts supplies, desks, and musical instruments. The dining area has cozy couches. The mattresses are comfy. I appreciated being able to get an all female dorm. I also appreciated the free coffee and tea and oat milk. Everyone was welcoming and friendly including the staff. I made new friends! Also it's 5 minutes walk from the train / bus stations as well as the Abbey and the Roman Baths. I'll be back!

locations.title: Julian House Homeless Hostel
locations.address: Julian House, Manvers St, Bath BA1 1JW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Julian House Hostel is the awful looking dungeon beneath 'The Baptist Church' in Manvers Street, Bath.
It consists of 20 'Pods' (old shipping containers) 4'5" wide x 6' long.
The endless number of staff are made up of untrained volunteers who seem to have a noticeable inability to communicate with each other. These so-called staff are very secretive, well beyond the GDPR requirements, a tool that they seem to use at their convenience to hide everything that goes on.
People staying there are referred to as 'clients'.
Whenever enquiries are made concerning a 'client' the staff seem to manage several different lies all within the same day.
The Hostel is also an 'overspill' for prison and is now known locally as 'Bath Open Prison'.
After around eight months, some 'clients' get moved to;
1-15 Bladud Buildings, The Paragon, BA1 5LS (backing onto Walcot Street) where they are told "it's a secret address" and that "visitors are not allowed".
On finally meeting a 'client' (a very good friend that I've known for around 16yrs.) it's rather evident that coercion and manipulation takes place within Julian House.
Holly Flewitt is supposed to be the manager. However, she made it perfectly clear in an email to me that she refuses to communicate with people on the outside.
We now know that messages DO NOT get passed on to 'clients'.
DO NOT GIVE FUNDS TO JULIAN HOUSE, it goes straight into the pockets of the staff. Give it direct to the 'client', if you are able to find them.
Julian House claims to be a helpful, caring charity.
In reality, it operates as a corrupt, controlling, brainwashing CULT that urgently needs investigation.
showerReviews.author: steven eyles

locations.title: Green Park House Accommodation
locations.address: 6 Green Park Rd, Bath BA1 1BQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed in Green Park for my first year at uni of so I thought I'd write this to help out any future students who get put here and want to know what it's like. It was my last choice of accomodation by preference and I was disappointed that I was in the city at first, BUT it turned out to be a really good place to live.

Pros:
- The LOCATION! It's so well situated for going into town, you have access to so many shops, pubs, clubs and literally all of the city centre is within walking distance. It is also right across the road from a nice park and more importantly a big Sainsbury's, which was so convenient.
- Buses are a big deal at bath uni and living at green park is the best you can get. The bus stop is right at the front of the building, no walking needed. And the green park stop is the FIRST STOP on the U1 route, so you don't face the same issue that people getting on other stops have of not being able to get on because it's full. Bus times are still annoying but generally about every 15 -30 minutes.
- The Flats have living room areas which are absolutely great for pres and socializing. comfy sofas and a big shared space.
- 24/7 friendly security desk in the building (sorry useful for when you inevitably lock yourself out of your room). it's also fairly easy to report any maintenance issues this way
- Don't have to leave the building to collect any post as all post for city accommodations get delivered here
- 24/7 access to the common room which is extremely useful during exam season as it is a good study area.
- The rooms are nice. Objectively much nicer than a lot of other accommodations. Most rooms have double beds and are ensuite with a proper shower rather than a wetroom.

Cons:
- not being on campus does mean you have to buy the £399 bus pass which honestly sucks. You also have to wake up earlier to make it to lectures on time. The bus takes 15 mins on a quiet day and 30 minutes if it stops at every stop. This is definitely the biggest drawback.
- The mattress is super hard. It took a while to get used to.
- Annoying loud seagulls will keep you up all night
- sometimes the area sinks of weed
- The fire alarm is insanely annoying and goes off in the morning sometimes for like 5 seconds. it's a jumpscare every time.
- some flats have issues with silverfish.
- in summer some of the rooms get REALLY WARM
showerReviews.author: Chardonnay Blair

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed here in the Villas which are separated from the student accommodation and run like a hotel.  I absolutely loved the mini apartment.  It was just fabulous.  Beautiful decor, a massive TV, a mini kitchen and beautiful shower room.  The whole thing was spotless.  And when I arrived, early, the receptionist made me a cup of tea and gave me a biscuit.  Secure on-site parking for £10 a night which is a bargain in Bath.  On my last day I could leave my car in the carpark all day, a great bonus!  I will happily stay here again when I'm next in Bath

locations.title: Twerton Mill - iQ Student Accommodation Bath
locations.address: Lower Bristol Rd, Twerton, Bath BA2 1EZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I lived in Twerton mill over the 2024/25 year in a townhouse room which is the shared bathroom option. The townhouses comprise of seven rooms (the only room downstairs has an en-suite and is more expensive) you share two fridges and freezers between 7 people which at times can be difficult if everyone cooks lots, there are also two ovens. My biggest issue I had over the year was the tint on the kitchen windows, it made the kitchen feel really dark and it felt unnecessary due to us facing trees and the river. In the actual room you get all the basic amenities, I didn’t really have much of a problem with noise but I think that really depends where your room is. The bathroom was good, definitely better to go shared bathroom over en-suite as you only share with two others and instead of just a shower it was a bath and a shower. I swear from being in other flats within Twerton that the townhouse rooms are bigger as there isn’t a need to fit a bathroom in. The staff are very friendly at Twerton mill they are really lovely and it’s always the same faces which is nice. It feels like a nicer community of staff at Twerton rather than waterside and Charlton where you have to walk past a desk to get through to your flat it feels like there is much more trust and respect at Twerton for those that live there. The only thing I sort of feel lacks is the security, the security team were ok I defiantly felt safe on the premises however when it came to issues over immediate maintenance or parcels I felt at though it wasn’t quite up to scratch, I understand that the security can’t be expected to know a solution to every issue that is brought to them but it just never felt quite as good as when the day staff were there. Overall for the price I paid for my room I felt ok with Twerton as I made use of the gym and the events as well as the bike shelter however if I was in an en-suite room I don’t think I would have felt the same
showerReviews.author: Nina Fleur

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stay in an ensuite bedroom sharing a kitchen with 4 others. The room I had is bigger than I originally expected and the bathroom had plenty of space for things. The kitchen also has enough space for everyone's things with 2 fridges and ample shelving. Staff are welcoming and helpful, always willing to lend a hand and help out if needed.

Maintenance works quickly to fix any issues you report through the app/tell reception about. There's frequent events in the downstairs area that offer free food and drink; they often giveaway energy drinks and protein bars for free too. The downstairs communal area is great for socialising with plenty of space and a pool table. There's usually enough washing machines and tumble dryers for everyone to use, but sometimes you may have to wait until others are done to start your washing.

Only a 5 minute walk from a McDonald's and Lidl, which is great for convenience. If you study at Locksbrook campus it's also a 5 minute walk away, though Newton Park students will have to take the U5 into campus (luckily there's bus stops right outside the front entrance of Twerton for going in and out of campus/town).

All in all, a welcoming environment with lovely staff and great living spaces. Probably the only complaint I have is that my room's window faces another flat's kitchen, so they're able to see me through their window. Makes it a little awkward when they can just watch me through the window, but that doesn't detract from everything great about this place.

I would definitely recommend Twerton Mill to first year Bath Spa students!
showerReviews.author: Nathan Leyland

locations.title: Bath Waterside & Marina
locations.address: Brassmill Ln, Bath BA1 3JT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
After trying to find a campsite to visit the Bath Christmas Market, I’m relieved we were only booked in for two nights. While the site itself looks passable and the pitches are acceptable, the facilities are completely unacceptable.

At £40 per night, the standard of the amenities is disgraceful. They are run-down, dirty, and foul-smelling, and have clearly been neglected for some time. The showers are extremely small and flood badly, leaving you standing in inches of water.

It is obvious the facilities are not cleaned or maintained properly. Leaking urinals with urine pooled underneath them were present when we arrived and were still there when we left, which is completely unhygienic and frankly revolting.

I’m not sure why this place has so clearly gone downhill, but there needs to be rapid improvement. I do not find the level of cleaning acceptable, nor is it okay for the cleaning sheet to be signed first thing in the morning claiming the facilities have been checked four times that day when this is clearly not the case.

This site is massively overpriced for what it offers and falls far short of even basic expectations. A huge disappointment and a wasted opportunity for what could otherwise be a decent campsite.
showerReviews.author: William Jukes

showerReviews.reviewText: Unfortunately we hoped for more here for the price we paid (£64 for two nights) - there was no sign of staff or the reception and shop being open. The pitch was ok but quite close to the next pitch so privacy felt like it could be an issue. The toilet and shower blocks were heated and clean enough but the shower cubicles are far too small (I'm not particularly large and it was hard to bend down without touching all walls of the shower!). It's great that you can walk into Bath from the site but it's still a good 45 minute walk and a lot of that walk is quite industrial. I can also validate that like other reviews there is a lack of security around the site as there is open access from public paths. As a result of all of the above, we'd be unlikely to return.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just outside of Bath with a bus stop across the road outside the Crown Inn.

Lovely adults only campsite! You have to ring the farmer when you arrive and he will give you the code for the gate.

Two hot showers with good pressure and very clean. Two separate toilets as well. Water taps on pitches that had electric hook up but if your in a tent there are plenty of water taps are dotted around. There is a little hut/pod with a fridge and ironing board and also lockers if your hiking and want to keep things safe. Farmer is lovely and chatty will definitely call here again.
showerReviews.author: Kelly

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just outside of Bath with a bus stop across the road outside the Crown Inn.

Lovely adults only campsite! You have to ring the farmer when you arrive and he will give you the code for the gate.

Two hot showers with good pressure and very clean. Two separate toilets as well. Water taps on pitches that had electric hook up but if your in a tent there are plenty of water taps are dotted around. There is a little hut/pod with a fridge and ironing board and also lockers if your hiking and want to keep things safe. Farmer is lovely and chatty will definitely call here again.
showerReviews.author: Kelly

showerReviews.reviewText: Great site, large and specious with water & electric on each hard standing. Park ups are right next to the river and in a beautiful country setting. Washing up facilities and excellent toilets & showers which are immaculately clean. The excellent local pub is 5 minutes walk away as is the bus stop with very regular buses into Bath. Bathford itself is a beautiful village with a local shop and Cafe and well worth a walk round. The campsite toilet/shower block is a bit of a walk away but is very private. There's a very short walk on a busy road to get to the village/pub/bus stop.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very calm camping site with a limited amount of campers each night.

Yes, as someone mentioned here before, you do hear quite a lot of traffic, definitely when the ambulance from the nearby hospital heads out, but this didn't really bother us ...

The owner's wife greeted us, was super friendly and helpful. She even offered to take us with her to the local store so we didn't have to use the campervan. Bless her!

Sanitary block is quite far from the camping pitches, but they were very tidy and I absolutely loved the spacious shower rooms!

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed at The Riverside Farm Campsite near Bath last summer and we were greeted by Neil the friendly farmer and Jack a lovely Labrador puppy. Obviously, he has spent a great sum of money and a lot of efforts to keep his little place very clean and tidy. Very clean toilets and large shower rooms. This is a dogs friendly campsite and there are plenty of spaces for our Bertie to have good exercise ( chasing the rabbits) as well.There are several larger than average pitches with electric & water on each pitch alongside the river Avon. The campsite is very close to Bath city centre only few minutes by bus. We just rebooked with Neil again for June for family gathering. Well done Neil.
showerReviews.author: S Scott

showerReviews.reviewText: Very friendly people. Lovely flat ground. Easy to put tent pegs in. Modest-sized field with option for power. 2 female showers, 2 male showers and 2 pairs of toilets and 2 pairs of sinks all in one block. Sink with hot water for washing up. Chemical waste disposal point. Waste bins. Fresh water tap. Picnic bench. Combination lock on barrier at entrance. Dog friendly. Very pleasant birdsong in the morning. A lovely stay. Good value. Recommended.

Balloons flying over are very entertaining.

showerReviews.reviewText: This campsite has it all! We loved our stay, excellent facilities that are immaculately maintained, great location, lovely friendly people. We will return and will recommend to others. I know it's all on the website anyway but we found the fridges and huge freezer really helpful for storing a few bits. Play facilities conveniently located in the middle of the campsite, good distance away from tents so not noisy but you can easily keep an eye on your kids. There's a washing machine there too and the woodfired pizzas that you can buy on Fridays and Saturdays were really good. We also recommend the pub the mill at rode, a few minutes away. Loads of great days out to be had, we enjoyed wookeyhole and trips to Frome, Wells and Shepton Mallet prison!

locations.title: CAMPWELL FARM
locations.address: Winsley, Bradford-on-Avon BA15 2JH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have just celebrated a big birthday here with a group of friends and we had the most wonderful weekend. It felt like the perfect escape from busy city life – away in the forest, surrounded by nature and enjoying every single moment.

We spent our days talking by the fire, taking forest showers, and simply watching the sheep wander by. One of the highlights was the stove-heated hot tub – bathing in the middle of the woods like that was pure magic.

The cabins, the yurt and the bell tents were all beautifully set up, with everything we needed and more. The communal areas with a kitchen and dining area were so well equipped – everything was top quality. I also really appreciated the focus on sustainability, which made the whole experience feel even more meaningful.

And then there was the roundhouse – warm, wooden and a little bit tribal. It had such a special energy. Honestly, I could have stayed forever.
showerReviews.author: Slavenka Vukovic-Bryan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I spent the night here with my van. Had a great few days. There's loads of space, either in a family orientated field, where it's quiet and relaxing. Or in a grouped field, where it's a bit more lively. There's an electric hook up available as well.

The people that work there are helpful and friendly, and it's clean with everything you need. Toilets, showers, etc. Place to wash up your plates and a pub. The pub sells decent food at a very good price. There is also live music every weekend in the barn till late. The cider is amazing and strong.

A really good stay, we will be returning without a doubt.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location for exploring local area. Easy access to the site though the entrance  road is a little bumpy its fine if you travel slowly. There was a little traffic noise but we found that didn't disturb us at all. The fully serviced pitch was a good size with access to the services easy, though some would require a longer electric cable, though having stayed on other sites with fully serviced pitches we do have longer electric cable and water hoses for those that require them. The toilets and showers were always kept clean and well kept.
We will definitely be staying again when in the area.

showerReviews.reviewText: The site is very easy to access just off the M4 and the surrounding area is lovely. The pitches are a good size and the site is well laid out. There is some road noise but that has never bothered us. This was our third visit to Plough lane, unfortunately on our recent visit we did notice that the site doesn’t seem to be so well cared for, the barrier is not working which did cause us some concern. We also felt that the toilet block is looking tired and was not as clean (toilets don’t flush properly) and the showers aren’t great (push button). The pitch smelt quite badly of dog 💩. I did report this to the guy on reception but he didn’t seem at all interested.

Amazing place to camp! Honestly so so happy with Yellowtail Camping, it was my daughters first time camping and we couldn't of picked a better place to go. The owner was super helpful and friendly making sure we were happy each day, the toilet block with showers and toilets was so clean each day with plenty of room. Multiple drinking fountains to use and the field is the perfect size for lots of space! Seeing the cows every morning was lovely too. Can not fault the place at all. Will definitely be camping here again!
Felt super safe knowing you needed a code to the gate to enter and to leave, and to be able to use the bathroom at any time without a mile walk was lovely. 100% recommend camping here!

showerReviews.reviewText: Very nice campsite. Owner friendly and helpful.  He has fixed hot water for washing up. Showers and toilets clean and quite roomy. Shower hot. But cold water in basins.  Toilet paper, soap and paper towels provided. The site hasn't been open that long and the owner is gradually improving and adding things.  Although by a main road traffic noise wasn't really obtrusive. Handy for Bath park and ride and there are some footpaths round about that you can visit a couple of interesting places.  Some footpaths have cattle in fields though so I avoided those.  Cotswold Way is fairly close by. Owner has installed lights on steps going up to showers and toilets and there are lights in various other places including washing up shed.  All in all a good site.
showerReviews.author: Philippa Young

showerReviews.reviewText:
Room was nice, 4 of us in room was a bit of a squeeze.  Room was dirty in places (marks on curtains, marks on towels and cobwebs) but beds were comfortable, clean and plenty of decent pillows.
Shower was nice and the dove shower gel & shampoo is a nice touch.
Free breakfast was yummy and plenty.
We brought our dog and was still all able to have breakfast together but just a bit further away which was really appreciated.
Main downside was, even though we booked for 4 (2adts & 2 chd) the room was set up for 2.  Only 2 sets of towels and mugs. Reception were funny about giving extra towels and refused to give an extra mug which wasn't appreciated when paying nearly £100 a night.
Very close to M5 and restaurants, shops and petrol very nearby.
Staff were very friendly and so were guests, would stay again
showerReviews.author: Law Family

locations.title: Longleat Caravan and Motorhome Club Campsite
locations.address: Longleat, Warminster BA12 7NL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Clean facilities. Clean pitches. Friendly staff. And good for SEND families, giving the staff a heads up about our daughters additional needs before our arrival helped alot. Lovely having fast food stalls in the evening. Games room closed to early at 6pm. So close to Longleat Safari Park it reduced alot of stress going back and forth. Good pitches with electricity with no issues. Terrible WiFi. Nice listening to the sealions next door! And a word to anyone who is planning to camp here who minds children playing....children are only children once. They are more limited these days where they can play freely so please be mindful of that if you want peace and quiet 24/7. You won't get that here. No one was unruly or noisy but there were some lovely children playing football and when their ball accidentally went near someone's campervan pitch they were screamed at to move away. Totally uncessary to scream and shout and children when they were already apologising. If children are bothering you on site complain to staff properly who will take action or find somewhere adult only. Thank you for a lovely stay. Only reason for not 10 stars is people kept walking through our pitch instead of around due to being next to facilities and next to a clue to treasure hunt and the WiFi issue and the games room closing early.
showerReviews.author: Lizzie B

The campsite is so close to theI safari/zoo that you can hear the animals from the campsite. We also had a pair of tame ducks come to our awning daily and the kids feed them.

showerReviews.reviewText: An excellent club site that not only benefits from the natural habitat well away from any towns but also adjacent to the pedestrian entrance for Longleat Safari Park which allows you to jump on the Double Decker and ride around. Facilities are superb, clean and plenty of hot showers. Excellent positioning of a number of  Chemical Disposal points as well as recycling and water points around the site. A small wooded area fenced off for dog walking also on site. Work underway on our visit in March 22 for a small number of service pitches so they should be ready for Summer 2022. Highly recommended and we look forward to returning soon.
showerReviews.author: Terry Reddings

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a great weekend away at haven burnham on sea, staff was so helpful when needed help and advice. We had issues when we arrived with the heating which was sorted within 20 minutes of going to reception desk.

Staff who did the football activity was also really good with the children, my son had a fab time doing this activity. the haven site is so close to the town within walking distance so easily accessible. Evening entertainment was great for the children.

Only thing I can say was that the swimming pool was quite cold especially for little ones so we didn’t stay in there for the whole hour but was a great swimming pool. It was our first time at a haven and would definitely be returning to a haven site at some point. It is really handy that the eating places offer a take away to the caravan as it rained on one of the days so meant we didn’t have to drag the children out in the rain.

The swimming pool is ok but the flume isn't a medium speed as advertised. My children had to push themselves off the end. If you're not allowed to wear shoes in the changing room then there really needs to be seating in the entrance. Too many people don't bother so it gets filthy very quicky. It's well placed to visit the surrounding area.

showerReviews.reviewText: Can't say if it is any good or not, as failed at the first hurdle.  Tried to book a swimming session and had to complete the usual pointless "log on", with question, such as date of birth??  and passwords. Why? Then you get to the unfathomable list of choices, but picked one with a time and went with it. It said that there was 65 spaces, so went on to book. When I got to payment, it was "FULL" WTH.  Went back and picked a different  time and this time got through to payment section, put in card details and got the time wheel of doom.  Tried again with different card.  Same result.  So went old school and rang them to book (twice). No one answers the phone......  Left message and as of yet no one has called me back after an hour.  Given up on the health kick and off to the pub, as a lot less hassle.
showerReviews.author: Alan Myatt

showerReviews.reviewText: I regularly take my children here for swimming during the family sessions. The pool is warm and there's a small flume that my children love. Staff are currently trying hard to space people out in the pool to maintain covid restrictions. Lockers are still usable but again spaced out. Staff have been polite every time I have visited. I've always been able to park (for free). My only ask would be more changing rooms that are larger in size, as when it's busy and I need to use a small cubicle, it's tricky to sort out my two children as the space is limited.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Decent pool, friendly staff, clean changing rooms, the water is wet! Some say it is cold but I disagree.

Different sessions for different age groups, aquafit sessions etc, plenty of opportunity for lane swimming.

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you value your health...............Avoid at all costs.
I used the facilities last year when visiting the area and was surprised and disappointed with the cleaning standards in both the gym and pool. I thought I would give it another try, but it seems nothing has improved. In fact, it seems to have gotten worse. During my visit at the gym, the vast majority of users avoided cleanng the equipment after use. There is no signage to promote this and no supervision by staff. I was informed by another user that the only time staff are present is when they require their water bottle to be refilled. The onto the pool. This time I witnessed no one showering before entering the pool.  There is a sign requesting shoes be removed prior to entering the changing facilities, but this also seems to be selective. Mind you, there was so much water on the floor, perhaps wellies would have been appropriate. Yes, it is outdated and could do with a thorough upgrade, but there is no excuse for cleanliness and this applies to both the providers and the customers. Re-educating customers on hygene standards and running an occasional mop over the floor is not to much to ask. I happens in my home town municipal pool, so it can happen here.
showerReviews.author: Paula Whitworth

Had a bit of trouble with the lockers when I realised that you needed tokens instead of a pound coin and we were not told this. Luckily another member of the public told me to leave my stuff by poolside as it's easier than going to reception in my swimming costume to get a token. The swimming session itself was pretty good and would definitely come again

They go on about removing your shoes in the changing rooms but look at the state of the seating area. It’s not been clean for 3 weeks which is more unhygienic removing my shoes. #EveryoneActive

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and I visited leisure centre for the 7pm swim today (6/1/23). Upon entering the women's changing room, I saw that the floor was in a filthy state, way beyond the level it usually is

I asked the lifeguard on duty at the time if he could ask someone to clean the floor; he said he would. I saw him talking on the radio to someone - I don't know what was said, but either he didn't ask someone or my request was ignored, because when I went back into the changing room, the floor was in the same state - covered in dirt and grime.

Also have now seriously reduced weekend slots to just 1 on the Saturday and 2 on the Sunday, so no chance of going swimming on a weekend unless you want to be surrounded by families/kids (some of us don't)

Lastly, the aqua aerobics and aqua Zumba slots used to be designated an hour - for some reason 2 of them now have 45 minutes, which means the people who pay to start swimming at 8 now have to wait for the class to finish, the lifeguards get no time at all to sort the pool out, and the changing rooms are now much more cramped due to the crossover

Absolutely appalling, I don't know how this place is still open
showerReviews.author: Tiffany Markwick

For that reason alone I won't be going back. £18 and we were in there for just over an hour. Disgraceful. I wouldn't join as thr monthly membership prices it way too expensive.

There's great views from the Lido plus toilets and also the coffee pod serving hot drinks that are very reasonably priced. The lovely Lily who served us  was a great host. Big thankyou to Lily really enjoyed our coffee and meeting you.
Definitely be returning in the summer next year to have the full experience.

locations.title: Little Moor Haven
locations.address: Little Moor, Plympton, Plymouth PL7 5AR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It was our first time here today and i can definitely say we will be back again.
We booked it as a treat for our son’s 2nd birthday and he loved it so much he didn’t want to get out of the pool when our time was up. We are a family of 5 with 2 older children as well & they equally enjoyed their time here too.
The pool temp was perfect no one was cold.
Facilities very clean & looked after. Added touches of shower gel, shampoo & conditioner in the shower and also various sizes of swim nappies if you forget your own!
There are pool noodles to use, a ball & some toys that sink to keep the kids entertained.
Loads of parking.

All in all we had a lovely time and can’t wait to visit again - thank you x
showerReviews.author: Emily Stolworthy

showerReviews.reviewText:
We used Little Moor Haven for a quick swim with our 10 month son.

It did really hit the mark for exactly what we needed. To start there was plenty of parking and wasn't busy at all. CCTV is everywhere (except private rooms) which was reassuring that everything was safe. The pool was easy to find with signs.

The pool area was really clean including the changing room, shower room and toilet. Shower pressure/temperature was perfect. Exactly what you'd expect.

My only criticism was the pool's temperature, for a indoor and heated pool it was on the cold side which meant our son wasnt in for very long and was shivering. That being said it might have been fine if it was a hot day.
showerReviews.author: Macauley Waites

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely, well maintained, private indoor pool available to book online for upto 6 people for 1 or 2 hour time slots. Toilet, shower, changing room, table, chairs and a couple of loungers included. Much more pleasant than a public pool in my personal opinion. Sufficient parking outside. Steps down to entrance door. You are wholly responsible for your own safety whilst using as there is not a lifeguard. Nice sized pool with shallow end and deeper bit at the other end, which is not at the end but about a third the way in from the other end. I believe it is quite popular as it can be fully booked several weeks in advance.
showerReviews.author: Stephen Frow

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely, well maintained, private indoor pool available to book online for upto 6 people for 1 or 2 hour time slots. showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing experience.

- Firstly The shower is unfit for purpose / faulty it would go dangerously hot and then freezing cold, we was not able to use it, and also the tap in the WC wasn’t running hot water either so couldn’t even wash my baby with a warm flannel after.

-The website states the pool is maintained 28-30, it most definitely was not during our time slot, in fact it was actually cold, much to our disappointment.

- Overall the facility is very run down, looks nothing like the pictures online, I appreciate they may have been a while ago, but it really does look tired & felt dirty to me.

Definitely will not return, did email the owner but they didn’t even have the decency to reply to me.
showerReviews.author: Mrs W

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing experience.

- Firstly The shower is unfit for purpose / faulty it would go dangerously hot and then freezing cold, we was not able to use it, and also the tap in the WC wasn’t running hot water either so couldn’t even wash my baby with a warm flannel after.

-The website states the pool is maintained 28-30, it most definitely was not during our time slot, in fact it was actually cold, much to our disappointment.

- Overall the facility is very run down, looks nothing like the pictures online, I appreciate they may have been a while ago, but it really does look tired & felt dirty to me.

Definitely will not return, did email the owner but they didn’t even have the decency to reply to me.
showerReviews.author: Mrs W

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked 2-3. We was getting out the pool at 3 and was told we could not even shower. Due to someone having lessons after us. I had my 2 year old child with me and my autistic cousin. Even still, we got changed and left straight away. We were given dirty looks by people there. My autistic cousin was then swinging on the tree swing whilst waiting for a taxi. We then had a call from the owner KAREN who told us to remove him from the swing. We then had to leave the property and wait in a lane for a taxi.
Would not recommend for people with children with disabilities. They're rude and do not accommodate for others needs.
It was then posted on social media that they cancelled swimming lessons because of the atate of the changing rooms and pool. However the pool was left in the same state we found it. Changing rooms were clear as we literally only got changed in them as we were not allowed time to shower.
I then messaged Karen and asked to have a conversation about this, as I know it was left in the same state we found it in and if Karen could send evidence of this? Karen said it wasn't about us, blocked me from the page and ignored my messages.
Absolutely vile behaviour.
Sounds like Karen just sits watching the camera, which I don't feel comfortable with. I also know others would not feel comfortable with this either.
Karen clearly has some issues around people with disabilities. I suggest Karen uses her money to get herself some counselling around this.
Will not be going again.
showerReviews.author: Charmaine Tapscott

showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff is friendly and helpful.
A special cleaner is needed, daily and weekly thorough cleaning is carried out, because the changing rooms and showers require regular and thorough cleaning, the floors are dirty, slippery, full of hair, the showers, unfortunately, are terrible.
The drying machine ruins swimsuits.
Sauna, the steam room should be perfectly cleaned, everywhere is dirty, slippery.
The sauna should be fully prepared for use, various problems, without panicking
This spoils the whole relaxing mood.
Money taken but the place is a dump.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Facilities are dirty and barely cleaned ever. I have never seen anyone with a mop and bucket or a vacuum cleaner . The staff are nr always sat behind the desk using the computer. We pay good money for membership but must we really not receive a clean gym ? I know nothing gets cleaned as I have seen the same things on the floor and walls since I joined. Go in bare feet at your peril .
Air con has been broken for a couple of weeks now and a treadmill for a month . I reported faulty equipment to Brett but he does not act on it and often no shower gel . Reduce priced accordingly or do your job please!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great little gym.
Rarely busy (some evenings I'm the only one there)
Friendly staff.
Very un-intimidating (people of all sizes and age).
Decent steam room and sauna.
Decent pool (15 metres but VERY shallow end!)
Early till late openings (think 6:30am-10pm most days)

TIPS
Quiet times after 7pm on evenings and quiet on Sundays.

Pool busy in half term and when it's raining.

Bring £1 for lockers.

They do have towels for rent (50p) but sometimes they're being laundered.
showerReviews.author: Jon

showerReviews.reviewText:
Friendly local club to visit with great facilities.
On Friday I felt sorry for the staff because the pool was busy and several people who used the showers in the ladies’ changing room  left them in a terrible state.
It is easy to blame the staff but everyone should see that places are left in a decent state and clean up after they use the facilities.
A safe and happy environment for those who are on their own and dislike to be surrounded by crowds of people.
I have used the pool for several years as it is situated close to home.
However I felt I needed to write the above review because more cleaners are needed at the club due to some people leaving such a mess behind them.
The last few years it has been getting worse.
I wonder if other clubs and hotels are getting these problems.
Time for change if they are.
showerReviews.author: Pamela Gotham

showerReviews.reviewText: A great gym and pool. The staff there are brilliant and so helpful. The changing rooms are always really clean and well maintained. The temperature of the showers doesn’t fluctuate which I’ve experienced at other gyms in the past. The pool and gym can get busy at times, but that’s expected at peak times, and it’s not too much of an issue. It’s never been so busy that I couldn’t use a machine I wanted to, or haven’t been able to swim. Toby is really friendly and so helpful. He put together and walked me through a great programme which wasn’t too daunting and just what I was looking for.
