locations.title: BLOCK Gym
locations.address: Royal william yard, Melville Building, Plymouth PL1 3RP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member of BLOCK Gym for around nine months now, and I can honestly say that joining up was one of the best decisions I made upon moving to Plymouth. The gym itself has a good range of machines/equipment, and although it is not a large gym (compared to some other franchises) I find that it is never overcrowded. It is kept very clean and tidy both inside the gym and in the changing areas/shower facilities.

There is a very friendly atmosphere from the staff to the clientele, which (as someone joining a gym for the first time) I found incredibly welcoming and has kept me coming back multiple times a week. I would implore anyone signing up to opt for a membership that includes studio classes as there are options such as yoga (varying proficiencies), pilates, and more that are worth trying and offer value for money if you attend weekly. The 30 minute Small Group Training (SGTs) that run multiple times a day are an excellent gateway into general gym exercises: a quick shoutout to Ben, Poppy, and the rest of the team for making these a pleasure to do. Most members of the staff are qualified Personal Trainers, so if this is something you'd be interested in there is also the opportunity to hire them while still using the gym itself as a venue to train.

Finally, I couldn't leave a review without mentioning the location itself; BLOCK Gym is in the middle of the Royal William Yard area, which is an upmarket suburb of the city filled with nice cafes/bars/restaurants and flats. Being a member of the gym will allow you to park here for free during your visit (remember to enter your car registration when you enter and every 60-90 mins or so thereafter) which also means you can treat yourself to a much deserved drink or bite to eat after a workout.

I couldn't recommend more highly.
showerReviews.author: James Campbell

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member since open day, and I have to say, the improvements they've made are impressive! When I first joined, I noticed a few issues, but the team really listened to our feedback and made some fantastic changes.

The equipment is now in perfect condition—every machine feels solid, and the quality is top-notch. They've completely revamped the changing rooms too; the new showers with improved drainage have made a huge difference, manager said locker are coming soon. The sauna is much hotter making my recovery sessions both relaxing and effective.

Overall, the dedication to providing a better experience is clear. Plymouth Gym has truly turned things around, and I’m excited to continue my fitness journey here in such a well-maintained and supportive environment. Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: ethan b

locations.title: JD Gyms Plymouth
locations.address: Transit Way, Plymouth PL5 3TW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
SUPER GYM IN PLYMOUTH!
If you're in need of a gym, come visit this place.
Located on Transit Way next to Tesco, it's a massive gym full of shiny-sparkly bits of equipment and everything you could possibly need.

Huge weights area, so you won't need to wait long for anything and there's multiples of everything.

One of the coolest things about this place is a dedicated glute area, specifically for working out your lower body.

It also has classes, changing rooms, saunas and 24 hour access (but no Ladies-only gym or spinning classes).

If you're intrigued, go in and have a look and someone will show you around. But the price alone is tempting enough for you to join straight away.
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

locations.title: UPSU Gym and Sports Centre
locations.address: Nancy Astor Sports Centre Drakes Circus, Plymouth PL4 8AA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not as clean or well-maintained as expected – disappointing experience overall

I’ve been attending the UPSU Gym 4–5 times a week for several months, mainly because it’s conveniently located near my workplace. While the staff are friendly and create a welcoming gym community, the cleanliness and maintenance standards are far below acceptable, especially for a university facility.

Despite what older photos on Google Maps suggest, the gym today looks very different — worn out machines, dusty equipment, dirty mirrors, and stretching mats with stains that remain uncleaned for days. The cardio and cable machines often have dust, hair, and even nail clippings, and mirrors haven’t been cleaned in over 6 weeks. Some equipment is held together with black tape, which pulls hair and causes scratches during use.

It’s disappointing to see such a great space neglected. I’ve raised a formal complaint, and although I’ve received a polite response, many of the claims don’t match reality. I strongly suggest management visit the gym floor personally to see the actual conditions.

Until real changes are made, I cannot recommend this gym — especially not for those who value hygiene and safe equipment.
showerReviews.author: Carla G.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately, this gym falls short when it comes to both hygiene and equipment maintenance. The men’s showers have a strong, unpleasant odor of urine, which becomes very noticeable when pulling the curtains to step in. Several leg machines have torn seats that are crudely patched with masking tape — an uncomfortable and unsafe “fix” that can even pull at your skin or hair if you’re wearing shorts. A few other machines are unstable and make worrying noises during use, raising concerns about safety.

The lack of proper maintenance and cleanliness makes this facility a poor choice for anyone looking for a professional and well-kept environment.
showerReviews.author: Playtime

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great price for students and conveniently located on campus. The gym itself is ventilated well so it’s great for cardio! The shower facilities are okay and I appreciate the private cubicles. There’s only two for the female changing rooms but at least one has always been available for when I’ve needed it.

The equipment is outdated compared to many other gyms (e.g. buttons instead of touch screen) but still functional. It has mostly what you need but they are limited in space with everything in one room. I also wish they opened earlier, as 7:30am is quite late in my eyes… even half an hour would make a great difference.

locations.address: Unit 9, 6 Burrington Way, Plymouth PL5 3LX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Love The Climbing Hanger and we are members who are lucky enough to be between both Exeter and Plymouth so we regularly visit both. Plymouth is great for access with a huge free carpark and step free access. There is a nice sized cafe with the usual relaxed Hanger vibe where dogs are welcome and there are better bathroom facilities there than in Exeter with showers too which means you can truly hang out there all day! There’s a table tennis table and a gym and workout area plus a great shop for merch.  For climbing it is brilliant of course.. tons and tons of wall space with plenty of room to sit and study your course and hang with friends, loads of levels, loads of variety and lots of bouldering arches to boot.. Staff are friendly and helpful too.. it’s a special place and we love it.

locations.title: National Marine Aquarium
locations.address: Rope Walk, Coxside, Plymouth PL4 0LF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We went to the Rings and Dragons Candlelight concert at the National Marine Aquarium during the Christmas period and absolutely loved it.

Sitting there with a glass of wine, listening to a string quartet play music from Lord of the Rings and Game of Thrones, with candlelight all around and fish swimming in the background, was such a cool and relaxing experience. It felt really special without being formal or over the top.

The Haldon Quartet were great and the music worked perfectly in that setting. Definitely something a bit different and well worth going to — I’d happily do it again.

showerReviews.reviewText: Really great sauna in a beautiful natural setting. Great place to relax with dip tank and cold shower too. Laura was a really welcoming host!  Would definitely recommend!

showerReviews.reviewText: Set in a small valley near to a small stream (not big enough to swim in) neighboured by holiday huts/lodges, it was a nice environment and a thoughtfully laid out site with a picnic bench, a covered & semi-screened changing area with storage bins for your stuff and hooks to hang coats. You then walk down a very short wood chip path to the sauna which has a cold shower and a cold plunge bath nearby. There were water cups just outside and orange slices at the end. The sauna has essential oils in the water too which is a nice touch. The session was 50 mins long, and we were given a 10 minute reminder before the end of the session. We were well looked after and blessed by sun on this occasion! The sauna was about 75 degrees Celsius when we were in there. The only constructive feedback I would give is just to mention the road name in the directions FAQ just for clarity, but the Google maps pin is actually accurate, so you can actually trust that, it’s just a bit of an odd road network! Great way to start the new year!
showerReviews.author: Rory Supka

showerReviews.reviewText: Unpretentious gym that I gave been a member of for years now (though I don't use it as often as I should!) locations.title: Be:Unique Wellbeing
locations.address: 68 Cattedown Rd, Plymouth PL4 0PH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I started this year, like many others, wanting to get in shape and get fitter. I wasn’t in bad health, but I’m approaching 40, work in an office and as a father of two young kids my dad bod was beginning to get the better of me. I felt self conscious at the swimming pool and was buying a size larger in all my clothes.

I reached out to Paul at BeUnique after seeing the boot camps run at Victoria Park. I said my goal was to take back control and get in better shape, but to do this in a way that had structure and would last and not just a quick fix that I couldn’t sustain.

I’ve never been a member of a gym and so the thought of starting was dawnting.

Right away Paul made me very comfortable. He worked with me to ensure that I was able to work around a busy life and we started working on building short and long term goals that felt achievable. The gym is full of a lovely bunch of people and I never felt out of place.

Fast forward 10 months and I am loving the gym and my sessions with Paul. I’ve lost weight, got in better shape and my mental health has improved dramatically as a result. I look good, feel good and have way more energy and enthusiasm.

BeUnique is a great place to go for a first timer and someone that has been going to the gym their whole life. Paul and his team are all great and would highly recommend you pay a visit to see what you can get from it!
showerReviews.author: Matt Cook

locations.title: Cullompton Services
locations.address: Old Station Yard Old, Station Rd, Cullompton EX15 1NS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cullompton Services (M5) – A Hidden Gem on the Route to Cornwall

Despite being one of the smaller motorway services on the M5, Cullompton Services never fails to impress. I regularly stop here on my way to and from Cornwall, and it has become a favorite spot for a quick break.

One of the standout aspects is the cleanliness—especially the toilets, which are always well-maintained. It’s refreshing to find a service station that prioritizes hygiene so well. The staff here also deserve a mention; they are consistently friendly and welcoming, making each visit a pleasant experience.

While it may not have as many food options as larger service stations, it still offers everything needed for a comfortable stop—good coffee, snacks, and a relaxed atmosphere. The convenience of easy access from the M5 makes it even better.

Overall, Cullompton Services may be small, but it delivers big on cleanliness, customer service, and convenience. If you’re traveling along the M5, it’s well worth a stop!
showerReviews.author: Ania Cummins

locations.title: Welcome Break Oxford Services M40
locations.address: Road, M40 Motorway, Junction 8a Thame, Oxford OX33 1LJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped at Welcome Break Oxford Services (M40) while driving from London to charge my Tesla and take a short break. It turned out to be one of the better service stations I’ve visited. The toilets were spotless, with plenty of cubicles available even during a busy afternoon, which made the stop quick and convenient.

There’s a good range of food options including Burger King, Subway, and KFC, along with a well-stocked WH Smith for snacks, magazines, and travel essentials. The EV charging area was easy to find and worked smoothly, though it’s worth checking availability ahead if you’re stopping at peak times.

Parking is free for the first two hours, which is perfect for a short rest or a quick meal. I also appreciated the step-free access and other accessibility features, which make the site welcoming for everyone. The green frontage and small water feature give it a relaxed, open feel—nice to unwind for a few minutes before getting back on the road.

Overall, this service area is a clean, comfortable, and well-equipped stop for anyone driving along the M40. Whether you’re recharging your car or yourself, it’s a sound choice with everything you might need. Just plan a bit of extra time if you’re depending on EV chargers or particular restaurants during rush hours.
showerReviews.author: sandesh raikar

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped at Welcome Break’s Oxford Services on the M40 (J8A) recently during a long drive, and it was a surprisingly polished and diverse pit‑stop. The place is clean, bright, and even has a free piano you can tinkle on while taking a break. The food court offers something for every craving: KFC, Burger King, Subway, Chopstix, and the bright The Good Breakfast breakfast bar (step‑free access and all – ideal for stretching your legs)  . If you're in the mood for coffee, there’s both a Starbucks inside and a separate Drive‑Thru, plus a Taco Bell that opened in March 2025. And for a slightly more upscale sit‑down, there’s a PizzaExpress and a good-sized Waitrose & Partners for everything from grab‑and‑go sandwiches to snacks  . Between those options and WHSmith, Krispy Kreme, and the petrol forecourts, it really does feel like a small food village on the motorway.

From my point of view, it’s one of the best service‑station experiences on the M40. You’ve got the classics—KFC, McWhopper‑style flame‑grill from Burger King, Subway subs—plus hot‑food diversity with Chopstix noodles and Taco Bell’s new menu. I particularly enjoyed the sit‑down at PizzaExpress; it felt like a proper break rather than just refuelling. The two hours free parking, clean baby‑change areas, EV chargers, showers, and a Ramada hotel on‑site make it practical for any kind of stop—whether it’s a quick food run or a short-freshen‑up break. I’ll definitely be adding this to my travel rota—I’d rather stop here than settle for a rushed snack at a less appealing service station.
showerReviews.author: Pranav

Welcome Break Fleet Southbound Services is a motorway service area located on the M3 motorway between Junctions 4A and 5, near Fleet in Hampshire, UK. It offers a variety of facilities for travelers, including: ￼
•	Dining Options: A selection of eateries such as Burger King, KFC, Starbucks, Subway, and The Good Breakfast.  ￼
•	Shopping: Retail outlets like WHSmith and Waitrose & Partners for convenience and groceries.  ￼
•	Parking: Free parking is available for up to 2 hours. For longer stays, payment can be made via the PayByPhone app or by calling 0330 400 7275. The car park includes designated Blue Badge parking bays and electric vehicle charging points.  ￼ ￼
•	Hotel: An on-site Days Inn hotel offers family-friendly accommodations with comfortable rooms and unlimited Wi-Fi.  ￼
•	Additional Amenities: Facilities such as accessible toilets, baby changing facilities, a Changing Places facility, free Wi-Fi, and a petrol station with both accessible and standard fuel pumps.  ￼

The services are open 24 hours a day, providing convenience for travelers at any time.

For more detailed information, including accessibility features and specific services, you can refer to the AccessAble guide for Welcome Break Fleet Southbound.  ￼

locations.title: Welcome Break Hopwood Park Services M42
locations.address: Jct 2, M42, Redditch Rd, Alvechurch, Birmingham B48 7AU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A nice convenient pit-stop while travelling, with a large car park for the coaches. The place is very bright and colourful. The 🚻 toilets are on your right as you enter. The ladies is very large with lots of cubicles. Its quite clean, though I don't think you can keep it spotless when used by dozens of women and hour. Theres various eating cafes to choose from with numerous drinks, either from the cafe or a machine. The turnaround is quite quick so you're in and out if the coach is leaving after you've been to the loo. Or there's seated tables to eat a full meal as well as benches along the wall for resting. Its also a gift shop, so be prepared to be assaulted by merchandise as soon as you go in. But its quite expensive too, I'd save your money for the trip you're on. Staff are efficient, though young and bored looking. Theres dozens of these stops along the motorway and all identical to the girl chewing gum.
showerReviews.author: Linda Cross

locations.title: Welcome Break London Gateway Services M1
locations.address: Jct 2, Welcome Break, Gateway Services M1, 4 Mill Hill, London NW7 3HU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It’s the last chance, or the first I guess, to  have a wee, get fuel, food, papers or just a coffee on the M1 Motorway. I didn’t used to like it much because the potholes were big enough to take your tyre of its rim and I dread to think how many were and how the Miriad of delivery mopeds coped. The certainly didn’t need traffic calming measures but guess what? They had the biggest road humps I think I’ve ever seen.
Anyway thank the gods all those problems have gone. Tarmac is good and smooth and the traffic humps are normal. The most used part of the services are always the toilets and these are placed through the front entrance and down to ,the right. There is a Game Zone on the corner. Due to it being just below ground level the are both a few steps and a ramp for the less mobile of us. Toilets are fine with the weird Dyson hand driers stolen from scooter handlebars but they work great despite that. Coming out of the “Loo’s “ there is a Waitrose and then WH Smith’s on your right and then round to the left you have Subway and then Burger King. To finish the food and drink there is a Starbucks as you come in the Services entrance who have a sit in and an outside seating area for when it’s nice weather. Outside there is a washing machine pod where you can wash upto 20kg  (or so the sign says).
There are 24 Tesla superchargers then 4 Grid serve chargers by the walkway to the entrance and all round the outside left of the car park (with your back to the entrance) there are 24 charging points, but I’m not sure of the company who operates them,
showerReviews.author: Bobby Dazzler

locations.title: Extra Help Plymouth & Saltash
locations.address: 2 Bronte Pl, Plymouth PL5 3DY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Luda and her team are just so amazing.

We don't believe the difference their care and professional attention has made to my 93 year old Mums life each day

My Mum is living at home alone and had been managing so well, then comes that time where you all feel, including her, that the day to day chores of life are too much.   Yes we can pop in and help, support as a family but our lives mean we can't be there every morning to do a welfare check, make her bed, do the dishes, washing clean etc.

They always keep us informed of how mum is doing, if they notice or feel she needs anything, it's real caring! 10/10

My Mum honestly loves her visits and the friendship and support.  Luda and her team have changed my Mums life, it's not only doing jobs, the carers have become friends and they cheer her up EVERY DAY.   Knowing somebody is going to be there to help the day.  This just adds to the love and support we are able to offer as her family.

Extra Help and Luda  are super professional, lovely, kind, compassionate and also competitive on price for this quality of care.

We did lots of research and after meeting 4 companies representatives it was clear who was going to offer the personal service.  We struggled with some of the larger companies, these seemed to have poor admin, call centres, you didn't speak to the care givers at all, one company didn't  even turn up for the first meeting when we were still deciding who to use.  We soon discarded them chose Extra Hands on a two month trial and we are so so pleased with our decision

THANK YOU LUDA & Extra Hands

Peter K
showerReviews.author: Slapton Villager

locations.title: Crowne Plaza Plymouth by IHG
locations.address: Armada Wy., Plymouth PL1 2HJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This hotel is  like a 1970s tower block in Eastern Europe. Decor is dated and room/ bathroom is dirty in places. Its been several years since I've seen artex on ceilings not to mention the polystyrene ceiling tiles! Windows don't open properly and air conditioning doesn't work well making the room too hot to sleep in.
The 'swimming pool' is more like a paddling pool - advertised as 15m, but only suitable to swim in about 5m due to shallow depth. The pool/ leisure area was the reason we booked this place so felt very short changed about what we feel was false advertising. The leisure area not pleasant or relaxing with several guests having loud conversations on mobiles and one applying very smelly ointment in the steam room - yuk!

Booking stated we had executive lounge access, but this was not offered at the location or details given at reception.

Oppressive and unpleasant building and atmosphere with noise coming from external air conditioning units outside the room which is particularly annoying given how bad the in room air con is. Overall a sub standard experience , nowhere near 4 star in my opinion and we couldnt wait to leave!!!

Would have addressed with reception but already had to raise the issue of being given a cheaper room than we paid for upon arrival and had lost the will to engage further with them.

I'm usually a fan of IHG hotels but this is the worst one I've stayed in, certainly worse than most Premier inns I've stayed in.
On a positive note location is great... that's about all.
There must be better places in Plymouth - would advise you to look at other options before booking.
We won't be back.
showerReviews.author: V Cullen

locations.title: Plymouth Backpackers
locations.address: 102 Union St, Stonehouse, Plymouth PL1 3HL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
For £23/night, 10/10.
Quaint little hostel and the staff run a tight ship. I came here for a couple nights to take a break from the weather during a camping trip. I arrived early and was very grateful to be allowed to leave my luggage in the staff area while I walked around town, waiting for my room to be available.
Once I arrived, I was given a helpful tour. I had all the instructions I needed to make my stay.
The communal area is very welcoming and carries a calm atmosphere at all times of the day. Brilliant for taking a load off and relaxing. There is plenty of space to put your own food in the dining area and even bins for yourself to label your name on. Lovely.
The beds were comfy, the bathroom was clean, there was a table to sit at in the room, a towel comes for free, and there were plenty of places to plug in my devices.

Cautions:
The laundry is clean but the detergent leaves a very strong scent.
If you like hot, hot showers, that isn't gonna happen here. The shower water stayed lukewarm -but it wasn't uncomfortable to shower in. A fine temperature for a fine shower.
The shower stream is also very powerful (which is great to clean you well as a backpacker!) -but the water can be a bit of a bother for those with sensitive skin.
The rooms are not wheelchair accessible.
showerReviews.author: Hello It's Me Mario

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely hostel, with a warm atmosphere just a few minutes walking from the city center. A few beautiful hikes easily accessible by public transport. To common areas are cozy and make you feel like at home (the decoration is just lively!). Very good breakfast with cereals and toasted bread, all good quality products. locations.title: Astor House - iQ Student Accommodation Plymouth
locations.address: 163 Notte St, Plymouth PL1 2AQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’ve been staying at IQ Astor House for over a month now, and I’m really happy with my experience. The staff are very helpful and friendly, always ready to assist whenever needed. My room is clean, well-maintained, and in great condition, with no maintenance issues at all. The washroom is fully equipped, and every room has a heater, even though it wasn’t mentioned at the time of booking.

I live on the 6th floor, and the lift works perfectly, making it very convenient. The IQ app is regularly updated and easy to use, which helps manage everything smoothly. The Wi-Fi is super-fast, and I’ve had no connection issues.

The laundry area is convenient, and the location is excellent — Tesco supermarket is just nearby, making shopping easy. My online orders and packages are handled safely by the IQ staff, who manage them with great care. Privacy is also well respected here.

I’ve spoken with many friends who live in other student accommodations, and most of them aren’t fully satisfied — but everyone I know at Astor House is happy. Overall, it’s great value for money and one of the best options for international students at the University of Plymouth.

Highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: Dulaj Mendis

There was not enough towels and no floor mat in the  bathroom which meant the floor flooded and was very slippery.Would not recommend this hotel to anyone lots of people seem to be living here and a body was found on our level the day we arrived even though the police were still there the floor was not closed off and we found out about it on social media it was very upsetting.

showerReviews.reviewText:
What are all these bad reviews?! Honestly, I think some of these people were expecting the Ritz for £30/night. I've stayed in more expensive 8-bed dorm rooms.

Personally, I had a great time here- good location, fab room (which was nice and warm with the heater on in winter), comfy bed.

Unfortunately, on the last night, there was a couple arguing the whole night and then the fire alarm went off at 2am, but I slept through most of this because I brought earplugs with me. You can hear some base noise from the club downstairs but it wasn't that bad in my room. Shower was a bit tepid, but for £30/night it was manageable.
showerReviews.author: Hannah

locations.title: Ocean Stays
locations.address: 218 Citadel Rd, Plymouth PL1 3BB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This wasn't a B&b, this is now a faceless hotel with nobody on site,I am totally against these faceless, corporate owned air bnbs so called hotels... A hotel is supposed to offer hospitailty? This one doesn't. Rooms are allocated by a message through booking.con 15 mins before the check in time... I only figured this when another couple rocked up, having already waited half an hour and several pointless phonecalls to automated answering services. Getting access was similar to completing a task in an escape room.
The room, below ground level was musty and dare I say it stank of damp, two doors led off the room, one to an underground cellar which doubled as a ventilation room, the other was locked with access prohibited... The problem is that the one that was open was open to the outside, so the security conscious individual would probably be a bit put out at this.
The single bed ( incorrectly advertised as one twin bed)was rock hard consisting of two wooden blocks topped by a barely sprung mattress acquired from a skip which pinged on every turn.  Although the room was clean, it is advisable that the guest should not look too closely. Complementing the room a full size fridge was present and made full sized fridge noises, and as it was surplus to my requirements, turned off.
Despite the offer of scratch cards for reduced parking charges (£10) these were not available nor was there anyone in reception as the reception didn't exist. So the guest can expect to pay the full whack of £16.70 for 24hours of parking.
One positive was found in the shower, clean and reasonable pressure, it was actually a pleasure to have a shower after the most uncomfortable nights sleep since sleeping on a deflated airbed.
To sum up, if you don't like people, have a strong back and not averse to a bit of damp, and have a bit of cash to spare this is your perfect getaway.
Personally I felt cheated, by both the owners and booking.com, having paid £144 for 2 nights.
showerReviews.author: Ian Black

Hotel arranged our parking permit before we arrived.

Great location. Will definitely return.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently had a wonderful 2 night stay here for my birthday. The hotel’s facilities were brilliant and we loved using the swimming pool, sauna, steam room and gym. The spa was beautiful and I had 2 relaxing treatments by the lovely Tina (I hope I got her name right!) Our room was spacious, clean and had a stunning view over the golf course - the balcony would be perfect in summer! All food and drink were spot on, and every single member of staff we encountered were helpful and friendly.

We will be recommending to anyone looking to stay in a nice hotel in the countryside near Plymouth.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Saltash Travelodge is clearly one of their older hotels. I say "hotel", really I mean "Motel". It is located in a Service area just off the Tamar Bridge, so in Cornwall, just.

It is described as two star and to be fair, I'd say that's accurate. It's pretty basic, clean,  though my room faced the setting sun so when I went out, I left the window open and the curtains closed, otherwise the room was prone to being stuffy. The fan helped.

I stayed there for 3 nights, using it as a base to explore Cornwall on my Harley. The amenities there food-wise, aren't great unless you like Burger King or Subway, both of whom share the Motel's foyer. I tended to eat out and simply sleep there overnight.

The staff are quite friendly and helpful, the room was clean, everything worked, shower was fine. It is just basic and to be fair, I'd say it could do with being upgraded as it is showing its age somewhat. I probably wouldn't be inclined to stay there again personally unless it was for just one night either on my way into Cornwall, or on my way back out.
showerReviews.author: Mitch Peeke

locations.address: Leigham Manor Dr, Plymouth PL6 8LL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site is fairly well located and next to a nice dog walk close by.
The site itself is very pleasant and the pitches are good.  You cannot choose the pitch and you are told where to pitch and whether to go in forwards or backwards.
Unfortunately however the toilet block lets the site down enormously as it is absolutely horrendous.   It is very tired, outdated and unclean.  The block has not been cleaned at all during the week we have been here. The toilets are old and unclean.  There are broken bits everywhere and un emptied  bins.  The showers are even more unpleasant.   They too small, dirty and in the women’s they have  plastic curtains which cling to your body as you try to wash (🙈).  There is a push button to get the shower started and then you have to keep pushing that button every 7 seconds to keep the shower running.  There is nowhere to hang your clothes and there is no bench.  Your clothes have to be wrapped up in a plastic bag or left outside so they don’t get wet but even outside of the shower there is nowhere to put that bag.  The whole block is disgusting.
In the laundry room is ok but again dated and there is no running hot water and two of the taps don’t even turn on.
Unfortunately we will not be using this site again and the two couples I spoke to this week have both said the same and for the same reasons.
If you have a dog you are NOT allowed to toilet it inside the grounds…
The other Under 25’s and same sex groups of over 3 are not allowed to stay here???
showerReviews.author: Sara Ross

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked a "ferry pitch" for the night which is a spot in the car park with EHU and the bonus of being able to stay until the evening ferry departure time. Full use of facilities £27

On arrival we were upgraded to a fully serviced pitch and still allowed to stay until 2pm to go the the ferry.

The site is so welcoming and clean. Toilets and showers spotless. Laundry room has really large machines, £6 for a large load, 80p for the dryer.

Swimming pool, takeaway, and restaurant - everything you need. Grounds are beautiful too.

A great spot before the rest of our travels.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice cheap campsite with the friendly staff it's walking distance from the beaches, although it would take a while! There seems to be plenty of space although there's no washing machine, there are good facilities a good amount of shower space especially if you are Female! and the possibility for electric hookups, the kitchen has a microwave only not a cooker, it does have a lot of fridge space. The campsite is on the edge of Plymouth and would take ages to get into a shop.
Nearest big food shop is Morrisons about 3 miles and there is a smaller Co-op in Elberton 1.5 miles away.
One field looks out across a field that looks like land on a stately home with big trees and the odd sheep here and there.
Separated from the campsite by a bramble hedge.
showerReviews.author: Ian Pownall

locations.title: South Devon Wild Camping
locations.address: South Devon National Landscape, Plymouth PL8 2EP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The lake is lovely, with carp and swans, however that was about it.

We arrived late (around 8 or 9 PM) in fairness, and there was nobody around. The only person who was around seemed to be a farm worker, who wanted nothing to do with us.

We couldn't find the toilets in the dark, even with our head torches. So just went to bed and hoped things would improve by morning.

We went for a wander around the grounds in the morning, still couldn't see any signage for toilets or showers. Luckily, just as some people were packing down their tent, we asked them and they told us where to go. Only to find 1 shower and 2 toilets, very basic.

There was no signage for the washing up, happened to see a sink covered in cobwebs with sponges covered in snail trails and opted for that.

With nobody else around, instead of the place feeling surreal to have the lake to ourselves, it felt eerie. We didn't feel comfortable, weren't impressed with the basic facilities that didn't seem to be maintained at all, and opted to leave after 1 night.
showerReviews.author: Aaron Upton

showerReviews.reviewText: Couldn’t recommend enough. We were left to our own devices completely, able to play music quietly in the evenings round of a fire. Even had a little spot to cook under when it rained as well as a hot shower and toilets. The site itself is so tranquil, bats flying around in the evening, a lake to swim in and big pitches so no overcrowding. Meet Mike as we were leaving, seems like a really lovely guy and you could tell he’d put a lot of effort into creating somewhere so peaceful. Also thank you to the lovely north London chap who worked there and helped us get wood.
showerReviews.author: Meg Brook

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site is great with lots of feasants and cosy spaces but is really hard to find. The lake is more like a pond which means mosqitoes and not a really comfortable place to swim. 3 kayaks are available on site as well as a BBQ which is great.
The facilities must be upgraded. One shower and two toilets (one men, one women) only for the whole camping. The shower does not work well (no hot water in Eco mode and having electrical devices in a shower feels unsafe). Only one sink with no hot water and one electrical plug for the whole camping as well. Owner is nice but pricing feels too expensive.
showerReviews.author: Augustin PINET

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely views and a good location. But extremely basic for the price. Just a field with a (very dirty) set of portaloo's (dirty when we arrived and not cleaned once in the week we stayed), a single outdoor shower that was muddy with stinging nettles underfoot (which we had to remove in order to shower) and no hook to hang your clothes. No bins and no washing up facilities. The service, whilst very friendly, was not what I'd expect at that price either... there was no gas for the shower and we waited 3 days (from the point at which we alerted the owners) for it to be replaced, so went 5 of the 7 days without being able to shower on site.

I'm not writing this review to complain, but rather to inform others in our position. As I would not have booked this sort of campsite for our first camping trip with a toddler in tow, had I not (very wrongly) made a few assumptions based on the price, reviews and the professionalness of the website. We have stayed places like this (pre baby) and loved it, so pls don't let this put you off if it is appropriate to your needs. I hope this is useful.
showerReviews.author: Helen Harvey Wilson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a beautiful place to come and stay. The scenery is absolutely amazing. The owners are such lovely, friendly people, he made the effort to come say hello every day, even made me jealous saying he was off to play golf .
Would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for somewhere to camp.        ( quote a lady that was there) its like a haven.
The lake is beautiful and was not as cold as exspected. Ideal for paddle boarding or just swimming. Will defo be staying again in the future. Thank you again for opening your land up for people to stay and enjoy its natural beauty with you.
Thanks again Liam gunn and family
showerReviews.author: Liam Gunn

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful and tranquil pitch right on the lake, however we were made to feel unwelcome and told it was not a fairground. This is not a child friendly site. Our second visit this year and very possibly our last. I spent the week telling my girls to shush as the owner was so rude on our first day.
The laughter of children playing certainly did not bother me as much as the machinery that was constantly bombing around the site. Our stay in April consisted of listening to chainsaws day in day out.
I feel sad that we were made to feel this way  as in April I could not fault the owner at all hence why we booked again!
The stars have no reflection on the beautiful surroundings.

REPLY
Oh wow I feel it's only fair to reply as the tone of your reply is so very different from your tone during the phone call you made to me in which you offered a free camp, that I might add I politely declined.

My tent was by no means the largest on the site, the gazebo that we used was highly commended by your father in law during our April stay. The washing referred to was the children's towels and swimming gear, I would of happily pegged this to our guy ropes as our fellow campers had, however the fence was handy! As an NHS professional I am an approachable person and had I been made aware this was unacceptable I would indeed have used the guy ropes.
My children were settled no later than 9pm and enjoyed making friends and playing with other children visiting the site.
I will apologise for the noise level of my youngest at times due to SEN needs she does struggle to regulate sometimes, however this was delt with appropriately at the time and never occurred during unsociable hours.

We visit many wild camping and butlins sites and my children are very aware of the differences.
showerReviews.author: Rebecca Freeston

locations.title: Dartmoor Domes
locations.address: THE OLD LONGHOUSE, Plymouth PL7 5JT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow!! We had the most magical stay at Dartmoor Domes.

Before arriving Emma texted to make sure we had directions and if we had any questions and what time we were arriving.

As we pulled in, she was there waiting, happy to greet us and helped us to our Dome with all our many bags. So happy and chatty.

The location is stunning. Private stream running through the woods and bluebells, sheep in the surrounding fields. No one else in sight.

Our Dome (Haytor) was the dog friendly option and she loved the holiday as much as us. Double bed, bunk for kids and even doggy blankets. Beautiful rattan furniture and a log burner.

Outside in our private space was the provate compost toilet which honestly had no smell whatsoever, private kitchenette, private shower room which had great water pressure. As well as our own log burner hot tub, hammock, fire pit and bbq with seating.

We had 1 day of sun and one of rain and on both we had a fab time, kids still enjoyed the hot tub even in the rain and loved running up the stream in there water shoes.

I had mentioned it was my husbands birthday and they had left special birthday message and treat as well as bunting and balloons. Such lively little touches.

Although there is no mains electricity they have solar lights a old USB attachment to the solar for emergency charging if needed but we loved the excuse to just turn everything off and relax.

Then on our last day we were taken up to visit the Alpacca/horses and feed them.

Honestly a wonderful family run set up. We had the best time and you were so welcoming. I have told everyone I speak to about our trip how much I reccomend going and hope that we get to come again ourselves.

Thank you for a perfect mini break.
showerReviews.author: Caroline Brady

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a four night fantastic stay in mid September in this lovely secluded glamping site on the southwestern edge of Dartmoor.  The moors were only a ten minute drive with access to walking and even some wild swimming! The domes were luxurious with everything you could need and more. Loved the wood burner inside the dome which kept us toasty on those chilly evenings.  The hosts were very friendly and really helpful including ferrying us out for dinner one evening!  Definitely recommend and will certainly return.
showerReviews.author: Stephen Gaskell

showerReviews.reviewText: Simply stunning! A truly amazing and unique place to stay. I felt like we had our own little small-holding with a dog pen, dome, kitchen, shower, picnic bench, hot tub, toilet, BBQ - and all done to the highest standard. Super comfy bed, gorgeous view of the stream, crackling log burner - this truly is a blissful experience! And a huge thank you to our hosts - I felt like family from the minute we arrived and your dedication to each and everyone of your guests is so genuine. Thank you for the lift to the garage! Hope you have a wonderful rest of 2022.
showerReviews.author: Vicky Lush

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just returned from a fantastic 4 night stay at Dartmoor domes. The location is perfect, they have thought of absolutely everything for the site….we wanted for nothing.
We loved that the beds were so comfortable (in fact we are now looking into buying our own Emma mattress). The kitchen area was undercover so we weren’t trapped in the dome when it rained. The hot tub was bliss - it warmed up so fast and the shower was really powerful. Just perfect!
There’s so much to see and do, we loved exploring Cadover bridge , our daughter thoroughly enjoyed it!!
Can’t fault this glamping experience!!
showerReviews.author: Verity Escott

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed on the meadows pitches in our camper. Spacious pitches (big enough for our long wheel base camper and a car) and decent spacing from neighbouring pitches. Toilets and showers both very clean. Access to some great coastal walks (some …

showerReviews.author: lewdaw84

showerReviews.reviewText:
A fantastic camping site in a spectacle location with great food and art businesses on the same site. Beautiful panoramic views across the Rame Peninsula and the Plymouth sound. A 20 minute walk down to Kingsand and Cawsand beaches (harder work going back up with tired kids).

The facilities are well maintained (there were staff members cleaning the loos at 6am and still topping up supplies of loo roll at midnight). There is a common room with sofas, lots of charging sockets, some books and board games as well as lots of sinks for washing up.

The showers were actually verging on being too hot which seems a strange thing to complain about for a campsite. Great for adults once you got used to them but a couple of degrees cooler would have been good for kids.

We've been here for the last 4 years and will keep coming back. It was as busy as we've seen it this year with some very large groups of families but everyone is respectful and friendly.

Easy access to lots of great businesses on the same site. The Canteen does great breakfasts and lunches. Everyone loved their cream teas. The Garrison cocktail bar was great fun on Saturday night with live music.
showerReviews.author: Simon Hall

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've spent many times at Maker over the last decade.
My latest 2 night stay was our 3 year old daughters first ever camping experience and we all had the most wonderful time!
She tells everyone how much she loves camping and is now constantly asking to go all the time. She spends a lot of her time building tents with blankets and chairs, it's very sweet.

The shower and toilet facilities were always clean and could be accessed at anytime during our stay.
There is a dish washing and chill out area with sofas, a large table and communal fridge/freezers.
At the check-in point there is an extensive list of items you can purchase should you need to.
Various food and drink venues to choose from, nearby beach and town which can be accessed by foot or the bus which stops right outside camp.
Staff were friendly and extremely helpful, especially when we accidentally attempted to set up camp in a reserved spot. While me and my daughter went off exploring, a staff member helped my partner move our tent across to a vacant pitch.
The staff at an on site food truck kindly set out a blanket for my daughter under the light structure and lent her a bubble wand to play with which was one of her highlights of our trip.
The best part of Maker is definitely the place itself, wild camping without the wilderness.
There were so many bugs and beasties due to the wild nature of the place. We enjoyed watching the bees, caterpillars, birds and butterflies.
My favourite part of our first night was listening to all the crickets in the tall grass.
The view out onto the Plymouth sound and beyond is stunning!
We will definitely be back again very soon!
showerReviews.author: Emma Powell

very disappointed, visited earlier this week. camp site was over filled. The pitches numbered but had two/three groups on each pitch. We were given an area with no gap with neigbour both sides and drive route right on us.
We were supposed to stay two nights but left after first. This is not as it is advertised. Would not recommend.
Kitchen/common room smelt musky, Not allowed fires/bbq but then people did have them. Not enough showers for the number of people.
I like rustic camping but this was awful.
I gave two stars as 360 view was great but why over book guests?

locations.title: Bush Farm Wild Camping
locations.address: Bush Farm, Saltash PL12 6QY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
An amazing wild camping experience. I took 3 grandchildren and we chose a spot near the river and orchard, perfect.  A campfire every day and evening, showers nearby.
One great thing is you are not a,lowed to camp less than 50 metres from someone else.
We had loads of space, kids loved it, met new friends, swam in the river and explored the hills and fields with walkie talkies to stay in touch, great fun.
Make sure you are warm at night, we used rechargeable lighting at night which was perfect for getting sleepy kids tucked up in tents.
Breakfast was a choice of a cooked breakfast on the campfire or cereals and then get ready for a lovely day again.
Originally booked 3 nights but the children wanted more so we stayed 6 nights.
Lovely experience, staff amazing and so helpful, making sure you are okay.
Perfect and I am definately going again!
showerReviews.author: paul aston

showerReviews.reviewText:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
This has to be the best wild camping (or camping of any kind) we’ve ever experienced. The site is spacious and well thought out, with toilet and shower blocks scattered around so you can enjoy the outdoors without missing basic comforts.

We loved exploring the quarry and ended up parking right next to the river – such a peaceful spot. The off-road trials section was a fantastic bonus too!

We honestly haven’t slept this well in ages, and we’re already planning to come back next summer, 100%.

locations.title: South Devon Camping Lower Terawhiti Farm
locations.address: Lower Terawhiti Farm, South Milton, Kingsbridge TQ7 3JT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a truly wonderful place! There was a huge group of us and they gave us a great space where we could make a camp. This site is back to how camping should be, no expensive on site shops, over priced food shops or rude staff.
The campsite was clean, showers were hot, toilets were impeccable, clean and pretty much odour free. Anita and her family really couldn't do enough for us. Kids and the big kids had an absolute blast, being able to play in a very safe environment. Football matches with the other field, late night light up Frisbee and cubby. Veg shop was amazing, cows mooing was wonderful to wake up to and the sound of tractors thundering around made it even more homely.
Fantastic beaches 10 min walk/3 minute drive away. Wonderful places to visit. Honestly what more could anyone need!
Seen you next year
showerReviews.author: Emma Courtman

The toilets are drop toilets which we dont mind but always clean. The sinks are always clean. Fire pits can be rented and the wood is cheap. Honestly the best campsite I have been to. Throughout the booking process Anita responded quickly and gave us so much information about the local area. A beautiful spot and great chilled and relaxed campsite. Thoroughly recommend this place.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Could have been an amazing experience. However:
When I first emailed a request for 'one room for one person for tonight' the receptionist responded with an email saying she didn't know what I wanted (?) Then apparently went home!
When I arrived to enquire about a bedroom fir the night i got a very frosty response from the manageress who felt afronted that i'd walked in the open door asking for a room when they were infact closed. Her response was 'we're fully booked'. This of course was not at all true.  It turned out most bedrooms were actually unoccupied and available. She must have felt sorry for me or  something because she reluctantly asked me back inside and when she  'checked' to see if she could find room for me she actually found one ( or a dozen!)!!
Once i was allocated a room,  i was told it was £80 but when I said no way, it was discounted to £60, which I paid but later discovered the rooms were advertised for  £50.
The 1st room I was given had no working lights. The 2nd room I was given had a pretty strong amonia type smell, which I initially attributed to very strong washing powder. Given all the issues in getting the room I didn't complain but i was woken by the very strong smell in the night and tracked it to the smell of drainage coming up through the plug holes. Closing the bathroom door and peming the outside door for a while lessened the smell and allowed me back to sleep. The smell was really strong when the bathroom door was opened in the morning. Surely previous occupants must have reported this?
The internet write-up says breakfast is included in the roomrate - it is not, infact the cafe does not open at all in the mornings.
What was good though was the bed, it was extremely comfortable. The tea and coffee supples were plentiful. The room was clean, warm (with thermostatically controlled heaters), of ample size with an open wardrobe/dressing area. The shower was easy to use, open walk in type, with plenty of hot water, cleaning supplies and towels. Views from the bedrooms are amazing!  All other staff encountered were brilliant!
showerReviews.author: S

showerReviews.reviewText:
As wardens we like to get away for a night and try different surroundings.

We booked at 11.30pm Sunday evening for the following day, received an email asking for our arrival time.

We replied back asking when the earliest was we could arrive.

Fabulous response the following morning to say we can arrive at 2 instead of 3.  Lovely

When we arrived the reception lady was very nice, helpful and showed us where to go.

First impressions of the bedroom was lovely, walked inside bed comfy, towels, hand towels, shampoo and shower gel all on the bed.

Tea making facilities all ready.

Clean lovely bathroom.

View was very nice you could see the ocean and at night all the lights in the distance.
We went back and booked for a swim. The staff were fantastic, we had forgotten towels and they kindly gave us a couple for free.

The pool was okay, it didn't seem to be heated but not freezing cold. You could see it was near end of season and could do with a bit of a clean however it didn't offend me and we enjoyed ourselves. Thank you.

I have absolutely no real negatives just a couple of comments.

The outside furniture has seen better days with one of them being broken and mismatched.

The kettle which was brilliant being normal size was a little tricky to fill but we used a cup to fill it from the sink.

The wardrobe area looked a bit dated.

Considering the above none of this spoilt our visit and we would absolutely return again.  Thank you all for being great.
showerReviews.author: Terrie Nichola Mayo

locations.title: California Cross Camping and Caravanning Club Site
locations.address: Modbury, Ivybridge PL21 0SG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This campsite is adequate. The usual good quality shower blocks, clean and well looked after. The wardens were all friendly and helpful.
The site itself is difficult to negotiate if you are disabled 😕  steep slopes. Steps need work to make them less steep and deep cracks need filling.
The flower beds around the shower block are full of weeds and dead plants.
The approach from the A38 is nerve rattling,  narrow lanes and a few passing places. Very difficult with a caravan on tow especially when you meet a lorry or harvester as we did. Got scratches right down both sides and it took us 50 minutes to travel 3 miles.
We will not be returning 😒
showerReviews.author: Sylvia George (Sylv)

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a FANTASTIC stay at Stones and Stars – every little detail has been thought of. The beds were super comfortable, and the whole site has such a tranquil, relaxing feel. Spriggy’s food van was absolutely brilliant, and both Joe and Spriggy made us feel so welcome. On Joe’s recommendation we chartered a sailing boat and had the best day out on the water, swimming off the boat in Plymouth Sound. Evenings were spent around the fire pit, BBQing and soaking up the peaceful surroundings. Couldn’t recommend it more!
showerReviews.author: Rachel Codling

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a FANTASTIC stay at Stones and Stars – every little detail has been thought of. The beds were super comfortable, and the whole site has such a tranquil, relaxing feel. Spriggy’s food van was absolutely brilliant, and both Joe and Spriggy made us feel so welcome. On Joe’s recommendation we chartered a sailing boat and had the best day out on the water, swimming off the boat in Plymouth Sound. Evenings were spent around the fire pit, BBQing and soaking up the peaceful surroundings. Couldn’t recommend it more!
showerReviews.author: Rachel Codling

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have to be honest camping is not in my top 10 list of holidays ideas. Apart from the odd luxury tented camp in Africa I’m much more of a posh hotel kind of person. Well, Stones and Stars has completely changed my mind. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by Joe and his team to the moment we packed up to leave we loved it.

Imagine camping without all the rubbish bits that we all pretend to enjoy but secretly hate. Gone are the days off dirty kitchens, mouldy showers, and sleeping on an uncomfortable mattress wishing, not so secretly, that you had booked a hotel. Everything at the site is brand new and sparkly clean. The kitchens, showers and beautifully appointed tents are spotless.

Stones and stars have found the magic formula, distilling camping down to just the fun bits.

You know you are onto a winner when the kids are still asleep at 9am then eagerly run off to collect the firewood, play the longest game of hide and seek in Devon’s history (safe in the confines of the quarry) and then after a long day of outdoor fun even offer to wash up the bbq pans in the outdoor kitchen!

This is camping but not as you know it with comfy blankets, throws on the beds, great pillows all set in a idyllic location.

The kids loved it. From helping with the bbq to disappearing  for hours exploring the quite beautiful quarry. From campfire dinners to falling asleep to the sound of the local tawny owls reminding us we’re not in a five star hotel but sleeping under canvas. There have even been sightings of deer roaming the camp.

Surrounded by beautiful walks, good pubs and amazing beaches but only 15 minutes from Plymouth train station stones and stars is a little slice of Devon heaven.

If, like me you would usually prefer a nice hotel but know the kids desperately want to go camping this is the place for you. A long weekend of fun, outdoor activities and no iPads. We will be back and if the kids are too busy I’ll happily come on my own and do some deer spotting.
showerReviews.author: Rob Gosman

locations.title: Plymouth Sound Caravan and Motorhome Club Campsite
locations.address: Bovisand Ln, Down Thomas, Plymouth PL9 0AE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Comfortable. Spacious site on a gentle slope, with the more level pitches being at the top of the site close to the entrance and service point. The remainder of the pitches slope gently down to the bottom.

The pitches are a good size with electric points. The main service point is on the service road close to the entrance and reception.

We visited to watch the fireworks festival in nearby Plymouth in August (2025). We saw the fireworks looking out over the bay and towards the golf course with the fireworks in the distance. On a clear night the view isn't too bad. There were quite a few people on the site doing the same.

It's about a 5 to 10 minute walk into the nearby village, which has a small shop and a village pub, which serves food and has a nice beer garden.

The site is well maintained, the grass nicely cut and kept to a short length. There's also a dog walking field, that's enclosed, with several paths cut through the long grass.  There are a number of pitches without electricity, offering an element of wild camping.

The services are quite limited and the price is, as with most CAMC sites, on the high side. As I write this review I'm sat in France, having visited several aires and campsites that have, almost without exception, all been significantly cheaper. In fact in Annecy in the French Alps I paid €125 for 4 nights with a lakeside location, shower blocks, toilets, small shop and bike hire; though generally campsites and aires are generally cheaper on the continent.

Level 10 Google reviewer with over 1,200 reviews with 2 million views plus 14,000 photos with more than 60 million views and still going strong 💪.

My reviews aren't sponsored, they're based on mine, and often my wife's experience at an establishment whether that be a shop, restaurant, service or activity, with the aim of highlighting great service plus areas for improvement, if necessary. And boy sometimes it is necessary.

Check out my other reviews 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is an amazing place to stay if you want a relaxing trip to nature on the outskirts of town with polite staff and a great place for a family.

Before we even arrived we were treated with a free upgrade to a lodge from a caravan and a free cot as we travelled over 600+ miles to get there. I cant fault Candice and James and the other staff. The grounds were clean and maintained. With their family being third generation since being founded since the 50's which is amazing and you can tell they are proud and so they should be.

Everything you wanted was there from body wash, sewing kits to BBQ tools and even a paid amazon prime account. Even chocolates on the pillow and a fresh single pint of milk in the fridge - very classy!

The indoor heated pool was my favourite for sure, taking my son swimming for the first time made it something I wont ever forget.

All in all I highly recommend staying here. Oh and a big thanks to James for helping me get my car battery going when I left the light on overnight. Bovisand really will do everything they can to help.
showerReviews.author: James Allan

locations.title: Churchwood Valley Holiday Park
locations.address: Churchwood Valley, Plymouth PL9 0DZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Muslim family of five stayed for two nights. Overall a great memorable experience the whole family enjoyed.

The main appeal of the cabin was that it was absolutely spotless and fresh, bed linen and mattresses were of high quality   👌

The cabins themselves are quite basic but didn't spend much time in it as the day was filled with excursions.

Great water and shower facilities the cabin has all the basics but below is a list of things you may wish to take for convenience.

Hand wash
Own towels/bath mat
Tea towel /kitchen roll
Extra loo roll (they only gave one)
Cooked/frozen food (there's an oven)
Milk bread beans eggs (there are pots/pans) and serving dishes provided inc cutlery.
Do take cutting knives and a pair of scissors.
Fans ( kids didn't want to open windows) you are in a forest so things may enter like spiders, wasps!
There is a local shop near reception, but not sure on prices!

Good choice of halal food places in Plymouth!

We booked via booking.com but would call them directly in future.

Some beautiful isolated beaches and wildlife.
showerReviews.author: Rash Huss

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had the pleasure of staying here for a local weekend break. The wardens greeted us in a warm & friendly way & were helpful.
The fully serviced pitch we were on was large and relatively level. The holiday park is a hidden gem. There is a pool, plenty of things to keep little ones entertained & for the fur children there is a fully enclosed field, be aware that it has a steep slope at one end of it & if you have a fluffy dog be prepared to pick out all the leaves & brambles from their fur. On a plus note there is a wonderful doggy spa just after you emerge from the dog walk.
We were slightly disappointed by the amount of toilets & showers considering the size of the park. One of the doors of the toilets in the women’s block doesn’t close, rendering it unusable.
Overall we were pleased with the holiday park & the snack shack was a welcome bonus for the start of our break.
Would recommend Woodovis as a wonderful place to holiday.
showerReviews.author: Kerry Bowman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely Outstanding Stay at Woodovis Park!!

Our experience at Woodovis Park was nothing short of exceptional! From the moment we arrived, the team went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and cared for. You can tell that every member of staff really cares about going the extra mile and what they do there. The facilities are first-class the indoor heated swimming pool was a particular highlight, perfect for a relaxing swim whatever the weather.

The park itself is beautifully maintained, with every corner showcasing the care and attention that clearly goes into keeping it in pristine condition. The location is simply stunning peaceful, picturesque, and surrounded by the kind of scenery that takes your breath away.

If you’re looking for a getaway that combines comfort, beauty, and genuine hospitality, Woodovis Park is the perfect choice. We left feeling relaxed, refreshed, and already planning our next visit.

locations.title: St Sidwell's Point Leisure Centre
locations.address: Paris St, Exeter EX1 2JX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely pool for toddlers and little ones. We had a very enjoyable morning here, and came back the next day we loved it so much - I'd definitely recommend it. It's lovely and warm and my 2yo and 3mo infant were plenty warm enough. Pool and changing rooms are clean and well maintained. Nice that you can stay as long as you like. My only complaints were:
- that it was so full they stopped people from entering the pool, but only once they had paid, were changed, and on poolside! We even had the reception ring down to check beforehand, but when we got down to the pool it was at capacity.
- The other slight issue was that the toddler/splash pool closes at 6pm whereas the training pool closes at 6.45 (which we weren't informed of). We would've like to have known this before going in at 5.55pm!
Overall a really nice pool and I'll definitely be back. Thanks

showerReviews.reviewText:
I do not recommend this facility. It could be excellent, but its potential is completely wasted. One of the biggest issues is the lack of cleanliness... the grime and unpleasant smells, especially in the health suite, are unacceptable.

To make matters worse, guests are asked to leave the health suite midday for cleaning, which shows poor planning. Even more concerning, I’ve witnessed female cleaners entering the male changing rooms and beginning to clean while men are fully naked... completely inappropriate and uncomfortable.

The health suite is consistently dirty, poorly maintained, and often smells bad. The jacuzzi is also out of order around 50% of the time. It's an absolute joke for a place that’s supposed to promote health, hygiene, and relaxation.
showerReviews.author: Dominic van Os de Man

showerReviews.reviewText:
Things I like - new equipment, not very busy, regular gym staff are great.

Things I don’t like - 3 days a week private sessions are ran in the free weight work out room, the staff there are rude, they wouldn’t even let me come in to take one of the benches out and told me to wait 15 mins until the end of their session… it would’ve taken me 20 seconds to take that bench out?! And that was for my last exercise… very inconvenient

It’s dirty… bathrooms/changing rooms often smell like faeces. The water fountain probably has never been washed, yellow stains in the bowl.

No small weights in either free weights areas, all the smaller weights located in the different area so they constantly have to be carried back and forth to the benches or the mattes :/
showerReviews.author: Hot Snob

showerReviews.reviewText: Liked the gym, much smaller than Sidwell's but friendlier and much better Aircon flow. Don't see any strutting egos and bad attitudes and although on a smaller scale the equipment is just as good. However the signposting to the gym and its changing rooms needs improving. Also the changing room lockers need attention, the first two I tried didn't work and the third one didn't exactly feel secure. All in all though considering where I live in Exeter this gym is a good alternative.

locations.title: Wonford Sports Centre
locations.address: Rifford Rd, Wonford, Exeter EX2 6NF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A few useful things to know:

- Free wifi for customers, and small seating area near reception where one could potentially work from.
- Either bring 50p for the use of the lockers, take your belongings with you wherever you go, or leave them in the changing room/ reception/ lockers without locking.
- The bracelets from St Sidwell's point do not work here, and vice versa the cards that do work here do not work at St Sidwells, so if you don't have a card- give your name at reception to get signed in.

Comparatively small gym (compared with St Sidwells Point) but warm and helpful staff when I went and good range of equipment for the exercise that I was interested in!
showerReviews.author: Josh Hamilton

Great site . Excellent value for money , it's only around 30 quid a month ...go as much as you like , PLUS  you can use all of the councils other sites as well in the price .
It's good kit , got a heavy weights room too .
Showers and changing areas aren't The Ritz ..but for 30 quid a month you can't complain.
Plus , you always get a warm and friendly welcome from Vicky , Andy , Emily and the Flower pot man " Echo" Keith !
Very clean site too ...and ample nearby parking

The included clubs are also wide and diverse.

locations.title: The Gym Group Exeter Marsh Barton
locations.address: Unit 2 Marsh Barton Rd, Retail Park Cl, Marsh Barton, Exeter EX2 8LH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It’s a good gym with all the equipment you need for a proper workout. I’ve been going there for almost a month, and most of the machines are usually available.

The only issue I have is that they’ve stopped providing cleaning supplies for the equipment. Sometimes the machines are quite filthy because of sweat, and when I asked the staff for paper towels and cleaning spray so I could wipe down a bench before I used the bench, they said that due to budget cuts, they’re no longer allowed to provide cleaning products for members. I find that quite unhygienic and disappointing. If I end up cancelling my membership, that will be the only reason.
showerReviews.author: Raheel Ahmed

They have outdoor tables next to the pool, with umbrellas. There's even a vending machine if you need snacks. It has a lovely family atmosphere for the family swims.

locations.address: Bolham Rd, Tiverton EX16 6SG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I took my little boy swimming for the first time here.  The staff member at the desk was very friendly and told me where everything was.
The learner pool is a good size and was a good depth for my nearly four year old to be able to stand up in.  It was nice and warm and we stayed for about 45 minutes.
There are large family changing rooms, so we could fit in easily and change.
It's free parking and a good price to swim.
We will definitely be back again and again.

locations.title: PureGym Exeter Bishops Court
locations.address: Unit 1B, Sidmouth Rd, Exeter EX2 7JH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’ve had a really disappointing experience at this gym, and I honestly wouldn’t recommend it. The biggest issue is how overcrowded it gets during peak hours—it’s nearly impossible to get on any of the machines without waiting a long time, which completely ruins the workout experience. It feels like they’ve taken on far too many members for the size of the gym, and there’s no real effort to manage the congestion.

On top of that, cleanliness is a serious problem. The gym often smells bad, and the equipment doesn’t seem to be cleaned or maintained as well as it should be. It’s not a pleasant environment to work out in, and it makes me question the hygiene standards in place.

Another major downside is the attitude of some of the staff. While I understand that working in a busy gym can be stressful, certain staff members come across as actively unfriendly, almost as if they’re discouraging people from coming in—perhaps because they know the gym is already too full. It’s not what you expect when you’re paying for a membership.

Overall, this gym has been a frustrating experience. If you’re looking for a clean, welcoming, and well-managed place to work out, I’d strongly suggest looking elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Guiding Lighthouse

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a good gym, fair price for memberships and 24/7 access is always a huge plus. I like that everyone is pretty friendly, and there is a decent range of equipment to suit whatever you are training for.

However I feel that in recent visits the cleanliness of the shower/changing rooms isn't as good as it used to be, and I've been in a few times and the air con hasn't been on. It's no problem if it's during manned hours as you can ask a staff member to turn it on but it's a concern and off-putting in unmanned hours, particularly as we've had really hot weather recently.

Would give 5 stars otherwise.

locations.title: PureGym Exeter Fore Street
locations.address: 177-181 Fore St, Exeter EX4 3AX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Terrible gym. The smell is extremely strong, the toilets are not cleaned properly. Out of the four times I visited, three times it was impossible to enter the changing room due to a persistent sewage smell. I understand that the gym is busy, but that only means cleaning should be done more frequently.

I wanted to try the Bishops gym, but I couldn’t even get in just to have a look — I was told I needed to buy another membership, even though it’s supposedly the same chain. I asked whether it was possible to enter just to see if it was cleaner, but no one responded via the intercom at the entrance. I travelled there for nothing.

There are also many rusty machines, and not all of them work properly. You want to wipe the equipment before training, but paper towels are often unavailable.

Overall impression — very unpleasant, old and unhygienic. I did not renew my membership and will be looking for a gym with another company.
showerReviews.author: Ihor Andriienko

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good location and overall good equipment. 24/7 access (3 stars for these plus points).
Terrible cleanliness, too often there's no soap in changing rooms, some staff clearly don't care and seem to be more interested in chatting with their mates and gym members. Air con often not working or overwhelmed by the sheer number of people in the gym. This used to be a much better gym but the management needs a fundamental change. Only reason I haven't left yet is the convenience of location.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would consider myself the average gym goer, I got about 4 times a week and most of the time pure gym is decent enough.

One issue you will get at this particular branch is a large amount of students coming in groups during term time which can heavily affect the availability of machines as although it's in pure gyms rules to not come in groups they do anyway leading to a wait for machines or equipment.

The gym itself is nicely kitted out with everything you need and the equipment is in good condition and relatively new.

The gym is usually kept tidy and weights and machines are tidied and cleaned regularly by the team.

Only one area that isn't often very nice is the men's toilets, the urinals don't seem to rinse regularly if at all and constantly smell, and between cleanings you will not want to use the cubicles.

The showers however are nice and clean and the locker area.

It's a bit of a mixed bag, if there was another location in walking distance I would use it however I'm limited to this one.

One good days it's great, on bad days it's frustrating but all it's okay for a very busy town centre gym
showerReviews.author: Simon kalje

locations.title: Truck Haven
locations.address: Scotland Rd, Warton, Carnforth LA5 9RQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I didn’t stay in one of their rooms, just stopped off for a 45 minute break, went to the counter, validated my token and was asked if I’d like to shower or use the toilets and was directed to where I needed to go. Facilities and supplies are plentiful and staff were not only very polite and friendly, but also falling over themselves to help with whatever I asked. Food looked and smelled amazing (I was gutted to be completely devoid of any sort of an appetite during my visit) and was very reasonably priced indeed. I cannot believe that in 4 years of truck driving I’ve never been here before - I’ll definitely be making an effort to stop here again! Can’t recommend it enough.
showerReviews.author: Torin Shepherd

showerReviews.reviewText: Really good value, nice clean rooms and lovely power shower. Breakfast was excellent and really good coffee which is essential!!!!

showerReviews.reviewText: Really good value, nice clean rooms and lovely power shower. Breakfast was excellent and really good coffee which is essential!!!!
showerReviews.author: Mark Batters

showerReviews.reviewText: Room comfy and clean with great view from window though a bit overheated even with windows open (it is August).  Chair to sit on a little uncomfortable in centre of back.  Very clean. Great to have toilet and shower available as part of the room. Bit of noise from students outside the window in the evening.  Padlocked "garage" available to place a bicycle.  Breakfast available to pay at reception.   Bit of a distance to walk to available shops but fine with bike or car.  Parking for car is about 300yds from room so don't bring a heavy case as it's a steep hill up to Holland Hall.   Not very far from train station and would recommend overall.  Would be a shame to waste the rooms in holiday times...
showerReviews.author: Robert Willoughby

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for one night, it's very very rustic.
The actual bike/ motocross site is actually within the grounds of the shepherds hut.
Toilets are shared also the shower .
There is no electric as stated in the introduction on their website.
The bedroom is actually on a mezzamine floor of which no photos are on the airbnb site.
The steps are metal rungs .
I would suggest it's for younger people to hire it out.
Teenagers to mid 40's would be the ideal ages for people wanting to rent it out.
showerReviews.author: Shaun Barker
