locations.title: Exeter Racecourse Caravan and Motorhome Club Campsite
locations.address: Kennford, Exeter EX6 7XS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Well, we had a fabulous stay here. Limited to just one night unfortunately. Firstly we had a lovely welcome in reception from Julie. It was a really super, friendly welcome and was very much appreciated. We were given great information,  clear and concise and we weren't rushed to find a pitch. The pitches are large with lots of space around them and the views across the site are very nice indeed. Plenty of nature around and the hedgerows aren't manicured to within an inch of their lives. A bit like being in a meadow. It was very enjoyable. Shower and toilet facilities are clean and smart with large shower cubicles with plenty of hot water and thankfully you don't have to push a button every few seconds for water. Also, the water drop off and pick up is well designed and clean. I normally begrudge paying UK campsite prices however I'd happily pay £23.50 with C&MH membership here. It was well worth it and we will definitely return
showerReviews.author: anthony chackett

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a campsite (Google take note).
We used this site as a stopover whilst on our way to Cornwall, and to visit friends in Brixham.
The site have very easy access to the Devon Expressway so is very simple to get to
It offers grass and hardstanding pitches, most with electric. There is an older but perfectly functional facilities block with toilets, showers and wash basins etc. Washing up facilities are undercover but outside😊 Popable water, grey and black waste points.
Definitely recommended 👍

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very simple campsite with little to offer. Besides the noisy highway nearby you will be woken up by airplanes starting at the nearby Exeter airport.
The facilities are very rudimentary and it’s hard to place your towel or necessities, because of the dirty toilets, sink etc.
We were glad to take off from this „campsite“, barley doing the minimum morning toilet…
20 Pounds for a couple are ridiculous for what is offered from the staff/owners.
Better look for a better campsite.
showerReviews.author: George Honig

showerReviews.reviewText: inside the the tent was clean . on the floor there bits of carpet overlapping and uneven ground not the best outside of the tent needs a clean. Pictures show a wild floor meadow with paths cut out it was nothing like this just paths cut in normal grass not a wild flower in sight. Toilets were not so clean but didn't smell. The big problem is the out door shower the only shower it was disgusting looked like it had never been cleaned and to get to it you had to walk through hundreds of fly's and wasps not fit for humans. as a result we stayed 1 night and left. Raised my concerns with the hosts they read the messages and don't respond. as a result put in a claim for 1 night refund airBnB phone me and tried to get me a refund from them but they would not. Since Airbnb then selfs have refund me the night. I would avoid this place mainly cause of the showers but from my experience the hosts are not bothered about any concerns they will respond quickly when you want to book

showerReviews.reviewText: A perfect campsite for me. Hidden away very remotely. Cooking facilities, toilets ( great touch with painting of Albert Einstein on the gents and a painting of a woman whom i'm not sure who she is or was on the ladies) and a shower. A beautiful little rustic hideaway. Only qualm i'd say is i could hear the traffic on the nearby A30 (?) a lot at times but can't do anything about that. Would defiinitely stay here again.

The site itself is beautiful and has some lovely wildlife we have observed Robins and tips and kestrels. In flight there are also rabbits and bottom fields on occasions can see deer. Gorgeous views of the countryside too. On main access route to crealy, Exeter and exmouth. We love coming here.

The toilet block was very clean and tidy and the showers were lovely and warm!
A very quiet little campsite with no traffic noise at all but still only a 10min drive into both Exeter and Crediton makes it a perfect location.
Thank you!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a beautiful campsite. With clean ablutions. Three loos, but only one shower. I was surprised that there’s a charge for the single shower (given the charge per night) costing £1 per 7min.
All ablutions are clean and not too far away from the camp site. Lovely well kept grassy lawns and a beautiful view. Sites are spacious and some are adjoining a stream.

Unfortunately what would be a wonderful peaceful experience is often interrupted by the loud sound of passing road traffic from the road - where cars / trucks go speeding by. There’s also a train station nearby - and although I never heard the trains, I would often hear the trains “hoot” when passing through the station. Such a pity the noise detracts from what would be an amazing site.
The gentleman who greeted us upon entry was friendly and informative.
showerReviews.author: Dean Ginsburg

showerReviews.reviewText:
Honest review:
We were sold by the pitch up photos which certainly make it look a lot newer than what it is.
In reality the park is weathered but still actually quote nice, it's a great social space for the kids, ours loved it.
The football pitch certainly needs a bit of love too.

The WC and shower facilities are clean but could do with a bit TLC, like repairing some seats. A big positive with the showers is you can adjust the temperatures, great for me as I like a hot shower!

The shop and on site bar are open for a limited time on Thursday to Sunday plus have a small amount of essentials. This is due to supply and demand, I understand this. Local shops aren't on your doorstep either, they are about a 10 minute drive away.

Staff are friendly and leave you alone, can't argue with that.

There also seem to be a lot of wasps, but maybe that's also this time of year.

All in all we enjoyed out stay so would recommend if you want a down to earth site.

It's not quite a 4 star but could be with not a huge amount of effort.
showerReviews.author: Steve Illy

showerReviews.reviewText:
We found this campsite as a last minute booking via pich up.co.uk.
We have come across a good one here!! It is set in a beautiful place. It was extremely busy but the site was was kept very clean and tidy, the shower blocks are a good size and have everything you need, the water pressure during busy times in the shower block would be very slow but still good enough to rise your hair and body.
There is a bar which has live music on a Friday and Saturday (depending on the amount of people at the campsite) and the drinks are not expensive either!! Love that they offer this service and not rob you blind!! lots of sinks to do all your washing up and loads of outdoor space for the kids to play football, ride bikes and run around. Piches are huge with plenty of space we had a camper van, 4 birth tent, gazebo and wind brakes.The staff was friendly and I would recommend this place to everyone, will definitely be coming back
showerReviews.author: Louise Rose

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just come back after a fab, last minute week of Camping, elec pitch, Family of 5 & dog. Children's park and play area was great, same as evening bar which serves food and drink after 5pm. Plenty of open space, lots of wooded areas for kids and teenagers like ours to explore. Mini Premier Stores for all essentials and more on site but if not Lidl and Sainsburys is a 3 mile drive. Shower and toliet Facilities clean, hot water for both showers and dish washing up area. Running fresh water taps around pitches.
We were asked where we would like to pitch up and All I would say is pick a pitch close to wooded  boundary just to get a break from the scorching sun this time of the year (August) other than that and a few annoying wasps I highly recommend planning a trip here 😀

locations.title: Crealy Theme Park & Resort - Lodges, Glamping and Camping & Touring
locations.address: Sidmouth Rd, Exeter EX5 1DR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed four nights camping at Crealy Adventure Park, Devon, and overall it was a really enjoyable family break. I’d give it 3.5 out of 5 stars – the theme park is the main highlight, but a few things could be improved to make the stay even better.

The campsite itself is very clean, with clearly marked and spacious pitches. Staff were consistently friendly and helpful, which made check-in and day-to-day questions really easy. Security is obvious and reassuring, so I felt completely safe with my young children. The whole site is well lit at night, bins were always tidy, and the washing up areas were spotless. The showers were warm and perfectly usable, though I wouldn’t have minded if they were a touch hotter.

Our pitch had electric and water with no issues, and everything felt modern and safe. The ground was hard and a little uneven in places, with some dry patches due to the time of year, but nothing that couldn’t be managed with stronger metal pegs.

The on-site shop at reception was really well stocked, though as expected a little more expensive than a supermarket – handy for essentials. Costa coffee being available in the mornings was a big win for me.

The kids absolutely loved the theme park – it’s the big draw here and perfect for children up to young teenagers. My girls would happily rate it 5/5 just for that alone. They made new friends, had loads of fun, and for them that’s what a holiday is all about.

That said, there are a few things that bring the rating down for me. Some of the extras are quite pricey, especially the Berg cart rentals at £12 per hour – with multiple kids wanting to ride, it adds up very quickly. The play parks around the resort were fine but fairly basic, and my two would have loved a splash pad or pool as an extra option for downtime.

Food in the clubhouse was ok – a bit pricey for what it was and smaller portion sizes (think Wetherspoons-level). Service was sometimes a little slow, but the “kids eat for £1” deal was excellent value and made it much more affordable.

Entertainment is where I felt things could be stronger. It’s family-friendly, with bingo, live music, and a headline act each night. During our stay we saw wrestling, a bubble show, and a magician – all fun and great for younger children, but everything wound down by around 9–9:30pm. It would be nice to see a bit more variety, including options that entertain the adults too, and maybe extend it later into the evening to round off the day.

Despite those points, we had a really lovely week. The campsite is safe, family-oriented, and the theme park more than delivers for children. My girls came away buzzing with excitement, and that’s what matters most.

Final verdict: 3.5/5. A great choice for families with kids in the right age range, with plenty of positives – but with a few tweaks, it could easily push up to a 4.5 or 5.
showerReviews.author: Wayne Evans

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our family of 4 (2 adults, 1 kid and a 1 year old toddler) holiday was really amazing at Crealy. We’ve stayed at Haven static caravan as they were quite cheap compare to the other options and provided a good space to all of us, although there was not much information or reviews available, as they are quite a new addition on site.

The caravan was really spacious, clean, and new.
Fully fitted kitchen with all necessary appliances + washing liquid and sponges, 3 bedrooms, lots of towels and 2 toilets.

The only missing bits for us were: sharp knifes in the kitchen (I guess due to  health and safety regulations), more hangers for the towels and clothes in the bathroom.

The theme park is really good, there were so many things to do for the kids outside and inside. The softplay areas for the little kids and the more grown up kids are separated (different buildings) and it was a blessing as on one of the days the park was full of school groups and we could still enjoy the little kids softplay without being disturbed by grownup kids.

Food options were the same as in other theme parks more or less and the quality was ok.

Overall the stay was a great success and we’ll definitely come back again for another adventure.
showerReviews.author: R&T

locations.title: Cofton Holidays: Holiday Park
locations.address: Cofton Ln, Starcross, Exeter EX6 8RP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We’ve just come back from a lovely week on one of the serviced pitches. The site itself is very clean and well kept, and the staff were all really friendly and helpful. The toilet blocks and showers were spotless, which made a big difference, though the showers were a bit hit and miss — some stayed on longer than others, and a few of the locks were quite stiff.

The electricity set-up via the app was a bit of a faff at first, just something extra to think about, but once I got the hang of it I was confident enough to manage.

We were quite disappointed with the children’s evening entertainment. While it’s great to see so much effort put into it, it felt a little too pushy — we’re on holiday to relax, not to be dragged onto the dance floor every other song. It also seemed that the same children were being chosen again and again for games, which was disheartening for our daughter who waited twice and wasn’t picked. A bit more fairness and variety would really improve this. On the other hand, the adult evening entertainment was fantastic and a real highlight.

Another small downside was discovering we needed to pay extra for the indoor pool. We completely understand the need to book, but given the already high cost of the site, it felt a bit much to be charged again.

Overall, it’s a lovely site and we really enjoyed our stay. Next time, we’d probably use it for just a couple of nights rather than our base for the whole week, and put some of the savings towards exploring more of the beautiful coastline.
showerReviews.author: C G

showerReviews.author: Eleanor Bonsor

showerReviews.reviewText:
This Marriott is simply one of the best we have stayed at in the UK. The facilities are brilliant, from the spacious, well-equipped gym to the rooftop restaurant.

The rooms are lovely; our suite overlooked the farmlands and was thoughtfully designed, offering plenty of space to move around. The bathroom was also well laid out, with quality fittings and a shower that had excellent water pressure.

What truly stood out, however, was the service from all the staff. Whether it was the reception team, restaurant staff, or housekeeping, everyone we interacted with displayed genuine warmth and a sincere desire to help.

I would especially like to commend Teresa, who was an absolute delight in welcoming us and making us feel both at home and valued throughout our stay. She was always keen to assist and offered thoughtful, practical advice. Jessica Pascual was also incredibly helpful in arranging our room extension, practical, efficient, and considerate throughout the process. Emma and Prince were equally respectful and professional.

The level of customer service throughout the hotel is exceptional and rare to find in the UK, one of the most courteous and capable front desk teams we have encountered in recent times.

As Platinum Elite members, we truly appreciated how the staff went out of their way to recognise our loyalty, a thoughtful and much-valued gesture.

The breakfast spread was generous, though I felt there could be a few more options for fresh fruit and vegetarians. That said, the service remained impeccable.

The common areas of the hotel are beautifully furnished, and despite the presence of large business groups, there was always a quiet space to relax. Complimentary parking is another wonderful perk, especially given the hotel’s proximity to the city.

Overall, the staff at this hotel made us feel truly at home, we can’t wait to return.
showerReviews.author: Emily Robinson

UPDATE.... I've had a Dr referral so popped back to try and strengthen up a bit after spine surgery. I'm enjoying Aqua Fit and Barre at the moment. Still a very lovely gym .

showerReviews.reviewText:
Purely from my experience, getting on the resistance or cable machines you want can be a challenge, especially when some are out of order. I would recommend to them they get a rack for a variety of bars, they have Ez bars, but no cambered ones. There's a huge bucket of cable machine handles for the lat press, but a rack with a variety of bars might encourage people to use the benches more and introduce a new exercise without taking up space.

They also have a ridiculous sign upstairs in the cardio bit, highlighting that they sell cakes in reception. Everybody knows this, we pass by on the way in and out and don't need the sign. It's curious how they want to highlight the cakes and muffins but don't selly fruit, or savoury food. Seems like a real mistep in marketing to me.

Also, trying to find a locker can be a problem as people are always leaving their belongs in lockers with no lock on so those of us who did bother bringing a lock and can't use a locker cos they are all taken.

On the upside, the staff are lovely, and it wouldn't take much to turn this into a great gym, but it needs modernising, there's an out of date sign by the water fountain in the weights where it says phones are prohibited in the gym. Yet everyone is on one cos they do actually allow them. There doesn't seem to much of a coherent management policy.
showerReviews.author: Steve T

The new changing rooms (which are now fully open) are lush - just remember to bring a padlock for the lockers!

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm disappointed in this centre / BHlive. I have no issues with the reception staff in the centre they were helpful and kind. However, I tried to go swimming however due to very short opening times and 30 minutes slots all being booked this wasn't an option - I looked at all other centres and noticed the same thing. Then I tried to book some classes for in a weeks time, they were all already fully booked. I then attended the gym to find half the machines screens weren't working and it was impossible to complete a workout. I contacted BHlive online as I'm on a monthly contact and this was my first visit and wasnt offered any apology and simply told I would have to pay until after march's payment. I'm really disappointed in the lack of facilities available, poor opening times, run down facilities and then ontop of that the response from BHlive - not at all what I expected when I joined and will be returning to the village gym instead where facilities are open all the time with a very well equipt gym.

showerReviews.reviewText: This place has changed my life. A referral made by my physio after a long recovery from slipped discs and sciatica, I headed here to meet Rachel. She helped by talking through the plan going forward after hearing my story. I have a gym membership now and have started by swimming and attending aqua classes which you can book easily on line when available. They are amazing! So far I've done the hydro classes on weekday mornings, and the rehab class on a Wednesday evening. Different instructors each time but all have been so enjoyable. A great workout which you can do to your comfort levels. Each time I've left the pool I've felt like jelly without having the discomfort during the class. Thanks to these classes I'm already feeling more confident in my abilities and getting stronger day by day. All ages and abilities are welcome and I would highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Lala BeeGee

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visiting during the summer holidays, decided to go for a short family break.
Great big car park, nice entrance. Big clear sign, Starbucks on site, restaurant and bar on site as well as their own gym/health club with steam room and sauna. Rooms were nice and bright and spacious. We had a nice walk in shower, only downside was no bath mat inside and I have two small children so I had to request one even though I had mentioned prior arrival. The check in process was very straight forward and easy they also have self check in points for a speedy process. Receptionists were friendly and welcoming overall. Nice lounge area with a tv for anyone who wants to just sit and relax. Unfortunately we didn't have time to visit their restaurant but I would definitely consider going back to this hotel just to try the food and vibes they had to offer. We didn't have breakfast as there wasn't a good wide enough range unfortunately neither for the kids or ourselves and didn't really cater to all needs which is a shame. You should really consider offering a continental breakfast as well as a hot breakfast buffet option but with a wider range of options suitable for children as well as adults. I've only knocked one star due to the points I mentioned but I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for someone decent and nice. It's also close to the town centre and many others attractions. Don't miss out.
There are stairs as well as a lift available to the guests.
We made use of the swimming facilities as well as using the steam room and sauce for over 16's which was also very relaxing too. They have set times to follow which are given to you upon check in for family swim times and also provide you with a locker key and towel when entering.

The reception manager was very professional and he made a seating area for us one night where there was no where to sit and arranged a space for me and my two children and also gave my children two big chocolate coins which was very kind of him.

There was also a lovely man in the Starbucks on site called George who was very friendly and warm and he also made us smile with a great honest service which is always nice.

My children enjoyed their time as did we and I hope we can return sometime soon.
Overall it was a nice and pleasant experience and we look forward in returning in the nearby future.
showerReviews.author: Alisha Arafat

locations.address: East Way, Bournemouth BH8 9PZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you like not getting the services you pay for come here.

Can't reply to BH lives comment only edit mine, at your particular site you've closed for good the sauna, same story at queen's park and at pelhams and stokewood the saunas run at severely reduced hours, 1-2 hours max  in the evenings.

Also as mentioned reduced weekend opening times after your centers bizarrely posted a social media post stating "You asked we listened" and increased opening hours when you had actually reduced them.

Also the car park, another service you now have to pay for if you intend on making good use of any of the sites facilities for any length on time.

Very poor service continued closure or reduced use of facilities that we apparently pay for.

No continuity between centres some want you to use pound coins for lockers others a padlock.

This coupled with seemingly random maximum parking times which if you fall foul of your lumbered with an £85 parking fine and these times are different at every centre.

Awful weekend opening hours.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The standard of swimming lessons delivered is great, but unfortunately that’s where the positives end.

Over the last couple of months, the management of this centre has gone downhill. More too often the gents toilets downstairs are out of order, the younger receptionists (except one) are mostly quite rude and seemingly uninterested in being there.

Above the pool, the vents are full of huge mounds of dust, which drop into the pool.

The viewing area for the pool is great, but is always really hot.

Overall, the place is tired and is in desperate need of some money being spent on it to bring it up to the standards that reflect the charges they are making.
showerReviews.author: Matt Holland

Which was too shallow to swim in. Because they had booked a class into the other pool. Refused a refund. Waste of money no apologies.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Was in the area for a short break with my parents and my 5 year old daughter who loves going swimming so we decided to come for a swim here as we are Everyone Active members in our home area, plus my daughter has swimming lessons so is entitled to swim for free during public swimming sessions. Like most things post-Covid, you can't just turn up and swim, but need to book your session in advance but as an existing Everyone Active member, this was easy to do through their app. Not sure how you'd do this as a non- member.

I was surprised to find it's more pricey for a swim than in our local pool in Hornchurch, which is a very new building and, therefore, has more modern facilities. Also not a fan of the boom which chops the main pool down in size, so it's no longer a full length. I understand the reasoning about creating an area for kids, but I think roping of the end of the pool would have been fine and I doubt it has resulted in the pool being used more for galas.

As an older municipal pool, it does have a proper, separate, diving pool which you can use during public sessions, but those using it are expected to be able to swim an entire length of the pool unaided to jump off the boards.

My daughter can float and swim unaided, but has not had the opportunity to do a full length of a pool yet (and would probably not want to due to getting bored), but she wanted to try the board as she saw others doing it. I wasn't aware of the rule and was confident in her ability to jump in and immediately come back up (trying to teach her to swim underwater is hindered by her super floatiness) and get to the side, plus I was going to go first and be in the water ready for her. Anyway, she jumped without fear, loved it and was fine, but I then realised the lifeguard had been calling me to ask if she could swim a full length or not - I was too busy watching and encouraging my daughter (ooops)!

Changing rooms are okay, but split between members and public, with only 2 showers in the public section and they're both cold water only.

We went into the public side, but went into the members side to shower as that had 4 showers with adjustable controls (got water) but the lockers on that side need you to bring your own padlock to use them, which seems a bit weird.

I don't know if, by members, they mean people who pay a monthly fee for gym access or something, but I think it's ridiculous to segregate the changing areas and only allow people who pay more access to hot water in the showers.

The toilets were also better on the member's side.

All in all, this is a site that needs a good overhaul and investment to improve the changing rooms, with no segregation for members / public and more showers with hot water.

And get rid of the boom!

Finally, the car park is council run and you have to pay to park.
showerReviews.author: Hayley J Bacon

showerReviews.reviewText:
Was in the area for a short break with my parents and my 5 year old daughter who loves going swimming so we decided to come for a swim here as we are Everyone Active members in our home area, plus my daughter has swimming lessons so is entitled to swim for free during public swimming sessions. Like most things post-Covid, you can't just turn up and swim, but need to book your session in advance but as an existing Everyone Active member, this was easy to do through their app. Not sure how you'd do this as a non- member.

I was surprised to find it's more pricey for a swim than in our local pool in Hornchurch, which is a very new building and, therefore, has more modern facilities. Also not a fan of the boom which chops the main pool down in size, so it's no longer a full length. I understand the reasoning about creating an area for kids, but I think roping of the end of the pool would have been fine and I doubt it has resulted in the pool being used more for galas.

As an older municipal pool, it does have a proper, separate, diving pool which you can use during public sessions, but those using it are expected to be able to swim an entire length of the pool unaided to jump off the boards.

My daughter can float and swim unaided, but has not had the opportunity to do a full length of a pool yet (and would probably not want to due to getting bored), but she wanted to try the board as she saw others doing it. I wasn't aware of the rule and was confident in her ability to jump in and immediately come back up (trying to teach her to swim underwater is hindered by her super floatiness) and get to the side, plus I was going to go first and be in the water ready for her. Anyway, she jumped without fear, loved it and was fine, but I then realised the lifeguard had been calling me to ask if she could swim a full length or not - I was too busy watching and encouraging my daughter (ooops)!

Changing rooms are okay, but split between members and public, with only 2 showers in the public section and they're both cold water only.

We went into the public side, but went into the members side to shower as that had 4 showers with adjustable controls (got water) but the lockers on that side need you to bring your own padlock to use them, which seems a bit weird.

I don't know if, by members, they mean people who pay a monthly fee for gym access or something, but I think it's ridiculous to segregate the changing areas and only allow people who pay more access to hot water in the showers.

The toilets were also better on the member's side.

All in all, this is a site that needs a good overhaul and investment to improve the changing rooms, with no segregation for members / public and more showers with hot water.

And get rid of the boom!

Finally, the car park is council run and you have to pay to park.
showerReviews.author: Hayley J Bacon

showerReviews.reviewText: Safe to say this facility has improved so much! Everyone Active should be ashamed of themselves! Before the council took over this place was absolutely disgusting. It used to smell horrific in the changing areas, the showers used to never work, the pool was showing signs on mould and it used to look really dated. Since the Council took over, all these things have improved massively. They have also started putting toilet cleaner down the toilets. If this was still an Everyone Active ran facility. I would of said run for your lifes. But it is so much better. The only thing i would say is that they should improve on keeping the floors a bit cleaner but other then that, the place is really improving. Good job BCP Leisure staff!

locations.title: The Junction Sports & Leisure Centre
locations.address: Station Approach, Broadstone, Poole, Broadstone BH18 8AX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent value gym with great facilities and welcoming atmosphere
I’ve been a member at The Junction Broadstone for a while now and I’m really impressed with what you get for the price. At £15/month on a simple monthly contract (with blue light discount), it’s incredibly competitive - you’re not going to find better value in the area.
Facilities: The free weights section has everything you need - squat racks, bench press, and a full range of dumbbells. They’ve also got plenty of machines if that’s your preference. The facilities are clean and well-maintained throughout. The changing rooms and showers are good quality - definitely a step up from budget gym chains, though not quite at premium gym levels. As a bonus, they have a sauna and steam room included, which is fantastic at this price point. No pool, but that’s not expected for £15/month.
Atmosphere: Really welcoming environment with a good mix of people and no intimidating “lads only” vibe. Everyone’s considerate about sharing equipment - I’ve never had trouble getting on what I need, even during busy periods. The personal trainers are genuinely friendly and approachable, always saying hello and creating a positive atmosphere. The reception staff can be hit or miss in terms of friendliness - they’re running the entire leisure center so understandably stretched thin (typical of council-run facilities), but once you’re in the gym itself, everyone’s super friendly.
Practical details: Parking in the main car park costs a couple of pounds per visit, which is worth factoring in. The studio hosts various classes, and the staff are flexible - as a dancer, they let me use the studio space to practice when it’s not being used for classes, even though it’s not technically part of my membership.
Minor downsides: You have to cancel membership via email rather than in person, which is a bit annoying. It can get busy at peak times, but the respectful atmosphere means it’s never a problem.
Overall, it’s not the fanciest gym you’ll ever see, but it ticks all the boxes for a solid, no-nonsense workout environment at an unbeatable price. Highly recommended.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
showerReviews.author: Harold Baker

showerReviews.reviewText:
My son and his friend did the teenage fitness pass one day during the half-term.
Both boys had a great time and burnt off loads of energy.
The staff at reception are amazing and will help you with booking classes/activities and membership advice if you are interested - this is not required.
None of us are members but we were still able to turn up on the day and book in for swimming, table tennis, squash. (They could have done more within the price but the boys were done at this point)
The lovely lady at reception even checked with us on the way out that we did not want to book any more activities and that everyone enjoyed their visit.
My only disappointment is the cafe doesn't seem to open anymore....  I remember when there used to be a meal deal. As teenagers we would all spend the day doing various activities and get lunch, using up all our energy, and catching up with friends during the holidays. Lunch and refillable drinks were affordable. The whole place was full of people from school. It's was a shame to see the cafe closed and not buzzing like it used to be.
Now few people seem to use the teenage pass, I suspect because it's hard to book online and I personally i assumed you would need membership now.
showerReviews.author: L Pearson

locations.title: Nordic Leisure Club
locations.address: 12-14 Knyveton Rd, Boscombe, Bournemouth BH1 3QP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a review of the gym at Elstead Hotel, this is open to the public and I was a member on/off for 5 years.

The TLDR of this review is AVOID THIS GYM. There are much better gyms in the area for a cheaper price. If you have to be a member here, join on a 3 month contract and DO NOT join the gym for 12 months as it is due to be knocked down soon and the hotel will not refund you regardless of the amount of notice you give.

I initially joined in 2019 before moving to the superior Better Gym which unfortunately closed which meant I re-joined at Elstead sometime in 2021. Firstly, in that time there has been absolutely no improvements made to the facilities. Much like the rest of the hotel the gym is severely outdated and essentially falling apart. The maintenance man does his best but there's only so much you can do with equipment and facilities that are 20+ years old.

I could accept the old apparatus if the gym was well kept, clean and hygienic, however this is not the case. The gym floors are always filthy, the changing rooms are covered in dirty grimy water, the showers are often clogged with hair and the toilets regularly don't have hand towels/toilet paper. You'll often see 1 of 3 cleaners at the gym reception desk but (sorry to say as they all seem lovely) they do next to no work. Rather then giving the place a much needed tidy they seem to spend the majority of their working day hiding away in the storage cupboard / plant room.

Before I finish, I'll quickly run through some of the other many issues there are with this place.
- Dumbbells only go up to 20kg
- No 16kg dumbbells
- No barbells
- They have 2 benches but they are both short & poor quality
- 1 filthy gym mat
- No squat rack
- No pull up bar
- A treadmill that I'm sure has been out of order for 5 years
- The hot tub is actually a cold tub
- The steam room door doesn't close properly which obviously lets all the heat out
- The wooden sauna walls and roof are damaged seemingly beyond repair, the sauna is also a lot colder then others I have been in
- Only 1 toilet in each changing room
- Lack of a wet / dry area in the changing rooms meaning the whole room turns into a boggy swamp
- No hairdryer for around 6 months, recently one was added again but it seems to be one from the 19th century so surprising doesn't work too well

To finish (and most disappointingly for myself) the staff at the hotel have just generally got ruder. I'm not referring to the gym cleaners or maintenance men, more so the hotel reception staff. Maybe they don't care anymore as the hotel is due to be demolished soon and make way for flats, but any sort of positive/friendly customer service has seemingly gone out the window. The manager is a pleasant man but seems to have an issue with telling the truth, I asked to sign up to the gym on a 1 month contract (knowing that 1. they used to offer this and 2. the hotel will be flattened soon) but he said they have never offered 1 month contracts. This simply is not true and I have since spoke to 10-15 other gym go-ers who have agreed with me that the gym used to offer 1 month contracts. With the imminent demolition of the building, it is disappointing not to offer a contract shorter then 3 months for financial security. However even more disappointing is for the manager to flat out lie about offering them.
showerReviews.author: D Man

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice 25m swimming pool. We book lane swims using the places Leisure app. Cheapest place to swim in the BCP area - around £1 cheaper than BH Active or BCP leisure centres. The centre has that school sports hall aesthetic, but don't let that put you off! Pool is clean (although because of its vintage, some of the tiles are yellowed), good temperature, and super-wide slow lane. It's never too crowded and lifeguards are attentive. The changing rooms are usually fairly clean - mainly communal changing with a handful of individual cubicles. Shower cubicles and usually reliable hot showers. Lockers (£1 refundable) are well maintained. Steps up to the pool from the changing rooms can be slippy. Plenty of free parking on site. Best value swim in the area 🏊‍♀️
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

Lockers (£1 refundable) are well maintained. Steps up to the pool from the changing rooms can be slippy. Plenty of free parking on site. Best value swim in the area 🏊‍♀️
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is a 20 minute walk from where I live so no excuses for not using it.
The gym is clean and well designed, it has all the equipment / weights that I require.  I typically train during off peak hours as so there was no waiting for equipment and there was plenty of space to exercise.
The changing rooms were clean with plenty of lockers (but you do need to remember your padlock). Showers were clean.

showerReviews.reviewText: Convenient central location, well equipped, usually good equipment availability, spacious, good temperature control, gym soundtrack not overly intrusive, friendly atmosphere, helpful staff, excellent locker room and showering facilities, high level of cleanliness, and great value for money. I'm somewhat surprised by some of the more negative reviews, and don't recognise their concerns. The club often offers generous new member discounts, so give it a go...

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym is easily accessible and if you pick your times most kit is available.

That's about the extent of the good points.

Chronically under-maintained, particularly in the gents changing room which has the most disgusting bathrooms short of a festival portaloo. Urinal cakes?

Spin class is ridiculously loud. Blonde Female PT thinks she owns the place clogging up kit.

My feeling is the small things are overlooked, but these go a long way to form the approach of management in the eye of the clientele.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've used a few PureGyms now, and this one is my favourite.
For starters, the membership is very good value, the gym is a comfortable size, and the ladies' changing room is clean & was recently refurbished. Even though the branch is popular, I never had to wait to get on the equipment, and there was enough space for bodyweight exercise training. It's also a friendly branch, generally clean, and it has two class studios, to accommodate a wide range of classes.
Highly recommended.

showerReviews.reviewText: Good gym poor staff. The gym has had some recent investment which has improved things, but the changing rooms remain in a poor state of repair. The class music is also played extremely loudly to the detriment of other users. Would recommend going elsewhere, particularly if you value friendly staff. Or want a more inclusive environment if you are neurodiverse.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited this gym whilst on a mini holiday. It was okay for a PureGym.
Well laid out and it has some equipment that my normal gym doesn't have. The gym was a bit untidy, plates and dumbbells all over the place, it's not the gyms fault but still a little let down.
The air con wasn't on, it got very hot in there.
I had to walk around the whole gym to find a cleaning station. When did it become acceptable not to clean down equipment after use?
It seems like every PureGym changing room is the same. My local one is just as bad as what people say in the reviews for this one.
Overall, it was good to have a gym whilst on holiday. It served its purpose.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I initially liked this gym. Good equipment and a decent suna. Issues are though, I cannot use the changing rooms late at night (inc the suna and shower, being a chef if I wanna work out after my shift that sucks) when those facilities are Available i can only really use them in the morning when it isnt jammed (given the hours i work, i tend to wake up later in the day). Also why would I go to the gym if I cant shower after, like come on i dont wanna go home in my sweaty clothes.

Will say the changing rooms otherwise are pretty good, most of the showers have hooks and shelves.

Also ive come to find its a bit nasty, hard to actually find a spay and paper towls to wipe down equipment with unlike other gyms. Its basic curtesy to do so but i feel id have to bring my own in to do so.

You have to ask staff if you want to go in more than once in a day (let's say you left something in your car for example) not to mention the full dependency on your phone, I swear there is basically no number option so if your phone is dead better hope someone is on staff.

Sadly I'll be going to another gym after trying this one out a second time now, to sadly find it hasn’t improved at all.
showerReviews.author: Jacob White

showerReviews.reviewText: First time at R1SE for a Define class in the Arena and I'm really impressed - Front of House staff in the café were welcoming and helpful directing me where to go. Massive lockers, amazing showers and makeup/hair area with lots of products if you've forgotten your own. Louise was hosting the class and she was incredibly welcoming and made sure I was aware of and happy with the content of the class and assured me that I could take it at my own speed. The class was challenging (REALLY delivered on lower body!!) but also well-paced. Had a vegan Fat Joe shake afterwards to refuel which was delicious as well. My *only* piece of constructive feedback would be slightly better signposting of whether treadmills are involved in the class or not - if nothing else but so that those of us who aren't great runners can psych ourselves up for it!
showerReviews.author: Maddie Saunders

locations.title: Snap Fitness Winton - Now Open!
locations.address: Unit 2, 447-457 Wimborne Rd, Bournemouth BH9 2AN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a fantastic initial introduction with a highly upbeat team ready to support and answer any and all questions and queries.

The gym layout is truly well considered and the room designs  and finishing  touches go a really long way to let you know that this gym and the staff members mean business.

With a very good range of free weights suitable for all and ultra high quality timber boarding in the power lifting section, through to the awesome Hirox area further bolsters the already premium feel of the cardio area.  If resistance machines are your thing, trust me, having worked in these environments in a previous life, no expense has been ignored.

Separate and perfectly sized class rooms which are readily available for all members when not booked, all the way through to the dedicated recovery area and  don't forget the pilates area also.

Dedicated private shower rooms and an ultra smart and thought-out locker area and of course a smart modern IR Sauna, there's not a lot of room for further improvement.

If you're looking for more than the gym, the seating area is clearly visible once you mental prepare yourself for a fantastic experience by walking up the ultra grippy Steele staircase. (Use this to load up your mindset and playlist!)

The modern and easy to use interactive systems including workout plans, removes all unnecessary thinking, giving you more time to focus on you!

If you haven't signed up yet or are undecided, take a look at the competition, it won't take long because there isn't any.

Let's not forget that it's 24/7 access, look forward to seeing and meeting you in the near future.

It's your story, let someone else hold the book if it feels heavy every now and again, but never hand over the scribe, that's your weight and responsibility,  let's create something epic!!

Peace out and God bless..
showerReviews.author: Giles “GunDog” Hedgecock

locations.title: The Gym Group Bournemouth
locations.address: First Floor, 29-36 Westover Rd, Bournemouth BH1 2BZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Generally I like The Gym Group but I’m so unhappy with my home gym at Bournemouth that I’m considering moving to Puregym just because of it. The cardio kit (the oldest I’ve seen at ANY on the many branches I’ve visited) is so old & clunky - not good for older members trying to keep mobile through injury and arthritis.  Bournemouth also has poor hygiene - the male changing rooms often reek of urine.  The Bournemouth gym manager is unresponsive to constructive criticism & negative feedback and disengaged entirely from the conversation.

Other than Bournemouth I would give a 4 star rating.  My other gym I use often at Streatham is pretty good with a friendly environment and kit is rarely broken.  I like the flexibility to use other branches nationally and I’ve generally found the facilities pretty good.  Bournemouth lets the side down badly. I have to use that one regularly whenever I visit my elderly dad.
showerReviews.author: Dave Grenfell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really great space! I swapped here after university got busy and commuting to other gyms became quite a hassle. There’s a great selection of equipment ranging from cardio machines, free-weights area and even a punching bag. Only issue is that the space is relatively small so it can be difficult to find a consistent workout during peak hours. Also to mention, I’ve had a couple moments where the WIFI will cut out, however this hasn’t ruined my experience.

For the most part, SportBU Gym is incredibly welcoming and great for university students. I’ve had everything that I need to improve, and the staff are really friendly and accommodating. It’s a great place to workout and make friends. The lockers are a great addition too, with an easy to setup code system to protect your belongings. Love this gym, wish I was going here a lot sooner during university! 🏋️‍♂️
showerReviews.author: Toby Muir

showerReviews.reviewText:
1 ⭐️. Like everything at Bournemouth University, this gym opens late and closes early. Why can’t we have a 24hr gym like every other university? It seems everything at BU is a reminder of a cash-crabbing university it is.
You charge the same gym membership fees as other public gyms which operates 24hrs, yet you don’t operate on full capacity or have swimming pool facilities. This university and its faculty are just wasting students’ money.
Gym Staffs are lovely but you could have done better in terms of opening times. And don’t get me started on the lockers
showerReviews.author: Gabby

locations.title: Bournemouth Pier
locations.address: Pier Approach, Bournemouth BH2 5AA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bournemouth Beach: The Perfect Spot for Family and Friends
Bournemouth Beach is an exceptional destination for those looking to enjoy quality time with family and friends. With its seven miles of golden sand and consistently high rankings among the UK's top beaches (even voted #1 in the UK by TripAdvisor in 2024), it offers ample space for relaxation and play.
The beach is well-equipped with amenities to ensure a comfortable visit, including cafes, restaurants, kiosks, and readily available toilets with baby changing facilities. Lifeguard patrols are active from early April to late September, providing peace of mind. For added convenience, beach huts, deckchairs, sunbeds, windbreaks, and parasols are available for hire.
Beyond the sun and sand, Bournemouth Beach and its surrounding area offer a wealth of activities. The iconic Bournemouth Pier is a hub of entertainment, featuring:
* RockReef: An indoor activity attraction with climbing walls, high ropes, and the world's first pier-to-shore zip wire, offering a thrilling experience for all ages.
* Amusement Arcades: Classic seaside fun for all the family.
* Key West Bar & Grill: A popular spot for food and drink.
For those looking to explore further, the Bournemouth Land Train runs along the promenade, making it easy to travel between different sections of the beach, including to Boscombe Pier. The nearby Lower Gardens also offer a beautiful green oasis with mini-golf and tropical greenhouses.
Whether you're building sandcastles, taking a refreshing dip in the "warmest sea temperatures in the UK," or trying out watersports like paddleboarding or surfing, Bournemouth Beach provides a fantastic backdrop for memorable moments with loved ones. It's a place where relaxation meets excitement, ensuring a great time for everyone.
showerReviews.author: parth khundiwala

locations.title: Shaftesbury Lido
locations.address: Barton Hill, Shaftesbury SP7 8DQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: What a hidden gem! To be fair, it's easy to miss this outdoor pool, as it's fully enclosed on all sides with buildings, down an alley way. Free parking nearby at Barton Hill car park. Book online via their website as spaces are limited to 16 per lane swimming session. Pool is heated to around 29° during the summer season, and there is an extensive timetable. Staff were friendly and the manager went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Male and female changing rooms (not individual cubicles) were warm and clean. Poolside warm showers and lockers (£1 refundable). The pool regulars were really welcoming and like a chat. We'll be back ☺️
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

locations.title: Hengistbury Head Beach
locations.address: Southbourne, Bournemouth BH6 4EW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently visited Head beach and it was an absolutely breathtaking experience! The beach boasts pristine, soft sand that feels wonderful underfoot and stretches as far as the eye can see. The water is an inviting shade of turquoise, perfect for swimming or simply soaking up the sun.

The scenery is stunning, with waves lapping at the shore. Whether you're looking to relax with a book, enjoy water sports, or take a leisurely walk along the shoreline, this beach has it all.

Amenities are conveniently located, including clean restrooms, and lovely outdoor and indoor dining options nearby for a refreshing bite or a cool drink.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful Food at Dirty venue Leon and Toilets filthy
Go only if your desperate
Food at Leon was pretty awful. Wrapitself dry, chicken filling luke warm dry and so unappetising. Fries very dry and tepid, must have been sat all day. Tables uncleared, food all over and really grubby. I asked the lady who took my order to clean a table for us. The floor was also littered with napkins and food. She kindly brought our food over and told us they were “very under staffed”
Toilets
Distrusting, I checked 3 cubicles and they had not been flushed. Also the pans were black and stained. The toilet roll holder was dusty and walls grubby.
The whole venue needs a deep clean.
showerReviews.author: Daisy D

showerReviews.reviewText:
I went there for a shower, and breakfast.
£3 for 7min! Half of which was waiting for the water to warm up! I barely got to wash my hair (I don't think I even managed to rinse all the conditioner out!!) and it turned off, didn't even have the time to wash my body! I was going to have one of their somewhat expensive breakfasts but tbh I was so very disappointed that I didn't bother!
The ladies at the counter were pleasant which is why I've given it a star.
* I was told to get ready before putting in the token, then told not to go into the corridor naked (which seemed obvious until I saw the token machine in the corridor). That's all the information I was given, was I supposed to run it for a few minutes first? Maybe instructions on how to use it without wasting 2 of the 7 minutes inside the shower room would help.
I didnt insult your staff in my review (on the contrary) but your response..... 🤦
showerReviews.author: Carmen Harber

showerReviews.reviewText: Seems like the Managment’s priority is to keep the public areas clean but totally disregard cleaning the showers or the toilets for the HGV drivers. The showers are lukewarm warm at best with timers that run out in seconds so you’re pushing the button with soap in your eyes. (FYI Roadchef most places have moved to electrical timers it’s 2025 not the 80’s) The pot holes and poorly lit bridge to the truck parking is a recipe for falling over in the middle of the night. I’m going to start parking elsewhere in future as it’s really went down hill.
showerReviews.author: David F

showerReviews.reviewText: Really great campsite. Good price for everything included. Park for the kids, indoor play barn, fields for football and dog walking. Even allow you to walk around the farm and meet the animals. The only thing that let's them down is the showers. There is no water pressure what so ever and you have to press the button every ten seconds!
showerReviews.author: Andrea Redwood

showerReviews.reviewText:
Initially we had booked at another campsite when we arrived. They had let us down with our pitch on phoning Saint Leonards caravan and camping and explaining the situation to them the lady came back to us within a couple of minutes and said we have a pitch for you  What a amazing site probably one of the best  we’ve ever stayed at and we’ve stayed a few,
Staff or cheerful, friendly, very accommodating nothing too much trouble for them.
We had a fantastic time on your site extended our stay by two days as we were enjoying it so much weather was kind to us also
Excellent Washing facilities toilet showers were clean at every time of day
Local shops eating establishments all within walking distance bus routes bus stop close by to take you to Bournemouth pool and the surrounding areas
Haven spoken to other campers on the site many of them returning to this site again and again again we will definitely be visiting you again soon Thanks for the wonderful relaxing time, Dave and Michelle
showerReviews.author: D G

Lovely campsite. The play area is amazing , we had non electric pitch near to play area and kids enjoy every minute there. Lots of toilets and showers. Very good location,  lidl one minute down the road and a little further tesco and others.
Only the pitches were not as big as we expected.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We're currently here. All the staff we have seen have all been pleasant and welcoming! They literally work morning til night making the whole site clean and comfortable! Good size pitches (we're camping!) There's a pizza van an an Ice cream van which were onsite (Friday Night and we believe Saturday nights too). Lovely little park for the children, a barn Play area too, and we've also seen chickens and come sheep and cows nearby.
Toilet and shower facilities are well maintained, clean and easily accessible.
Power hook up pitches available too!

We will definitely return again and again!
showerReviews.author: Verity Chambers

showerReviews.reviewText: Very much enjoyed our trip here, it's very windy in spots, but is small enough of a site that it doesnt have any issues in facilities. The showers  by the toilets at the front were fantastic to be hot, but pressing the button every 4 seconds and having to take 4 times as long to shower from the lack of water coming out. Supermarkets are walkable but most other facilities are best to drive (there is a pub walkable but path is alongside the main road so not nice)

showerReviews.reviewText: Planned to stay here for 2 nights, camping, but one night was enough.  They have these rules that nobody seems to abide, it is not kids friendly, dogs roaming around freely, the soft play area is outside the gate area, the enclosed play area is actually a place full of hazards for kids (feel free to check the pictures) and the A31 nearby, means constant background noise, not exactly white noise. The shower had lukewarm water and, as an adult, you need to keep pressing the button if you want a full shower, not just a splash. We were conveniently allocated a pitch right in front of the toilets, showers, outside sinks and bins, imagine the noise and smell. They should not be able to rent pitches this close to the amenities and then have a no noise rule. Would not return, ever.
showerReviews.author: Sabina Am

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice camping site and helpful warden, however more suitable for people with caravans, as facilities are very basic and olddated. No toilet paper or soap in toilets. Showers to pay by tokens. No sink to wash your dishes.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’LL BE COMING HERE AGAIN ♥️
What a lovely place, what a lovely warden, he welcomed me with 1 hours notice on bank holiday weekend because I needed sanctuary, well I made the right choice, been here 2 hours and I’m so relaxed and calmed. There are Toilet and shower facilities too. Everything here a camper would need excellent for the low price he’s charged.  (I’ve seen negative comments about having to provide loo roll, pay for showers and the noise from planes) peeps it’s 2023 that’s the norm in most places unless you want to pay extortionate prices, which this place doesn’t do! As for the noise, maybe do your homework and don’t book a campsite at the end of a runway I guess 🤷‍♀️ personally I’m loving the planes 😀😀  my dogs are loving it too. Can’t wait to return x
showerReviews.author: trude drake

showerReviews.reviewText: Attended a Boundless Rally rally by Trev and Di Warren, thanks guys brilliant job. The Rally field is very flat and the site generally very well kept with short manicured grass and good 16A electric points. We never use the site facilities of most of the sites we use as we have our own on board, however we always check them out for our own interest, unfortunately they were dated and sorry to say they did charge for the use of the showers but again for the cost of the pitch which included electric the site represents very good value for money. Yes its slightly off the beaten track, Yes its under the flight path of Bournemouth Airport but that's why we went there to see the planes attending the Air Festival. Overall a very nice little site in our book.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Wrigley

showerReviews.reviewText: Parley Glade camping fields. Was lucky enough to get on this site late August with little advance notice and remained on site for a couple of weeks. The site is well kept and very well managed by Richard the site warden, and despite the ravages of a long hot dry spell has managed to maintain a well kept area for us to enjoy. Only one suggestion that I would love to see implimented is the upgrade of toilet and shower facilities, the current facilities being barely adequate but manageable and kept clean.
showerReviews.author: John Averill

showerReviews.reviewText: A nice tidy little campsite, adequate toilets and shower facilities. I personally use the facilities in my caravan. A good level field with more than enough fresh water points, one of the cleaner elsan points I've come across. Spot on warden who is on the ball, watch your speed as he will have you and rightly so. Personally I love the fact this campsite is situated on the flight path for Bournemouth Airport, you will be woken at 06.30 ish as the Ryanair flights get going. Only a 20 minute drive for the best beaches in the area. A good selection of shops for supermarkets are only a few minutes away. One of the best chilled sites I've come across. Definitely be returning next year.
showerReviews.author: Nick Carter

showerReviews.reviewText: Liked: Able to choose own pitch, all areas fairly flat and plenty of options. Good location for access to beaches. Friendly staff and clean facilities. Planes as mentioned on their site not really an issue at all and Grandchildren loved …

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a great stay at Parley Court this weekend. We are a family of 2 adults, 2 children and stayed in the deluxe bell tent. It was a lovely tent - airbeds and bedding all made up. It was very cute. Everyone was so friendly, it was so nice to see the children mixing with each other, playing and sharing their footballs, swing ball etc.

It was a clean site, there was a farm smell in some areas but it is next door to an equestrian centre..... you can see the horses over the fence! The noise of the planes didnt bother us.

The only reason I marked a 4 and not a 5 is because the showers were a bit untidy - however I have seen worse, just make sure you wear flip flops in the shower! Toilets were clean, just cobwebs and dust - no biggie, but most people were respectful of the toilets, not leaving them dirty and smelly.

The owners were really friendly! Thanks for a great stay.
showerReviews.author: Faye Tuckey

showerReviews.reviewText:
We've just had the most wonderful weekend stay at parley court camping in one of their bell tents.
On arrival the tent was all clean,with plenty of space for the 5 of us. We had requested a fire pit with logs and kiddling,the owners were kind enough to bring us over firelighters and a lighter to help us out.
Was so lovely to see other families and children all getting on together,having fun.
The toilets were clean,and the showers were lovely and hot,perfect first thing in the morning.
Lovely to have the horses next door,and the planes going over were an extra highlight.
The owner even brought us extra duvets as the 1st night was rather cold.nothing was too much bother.they really are so friendly and helpful.
Great to have the golfing range on site too,gave our boys some great entertainment for the evening.
Perfect location.
Overall,I would highly recommend if you want a lovely little getaway.
showerReviews.author: Jen Newman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quite possibly one of the best 'facility' campsites in the South!
From booking, communication is excellent, & then upon arrival, staff are amazing! Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff, who are all very friendly & helpful, a complete joy & lovely to see in such a troubled industry where hospitality standards are challenged & differ considerably.
The site itself is family friendly, ideal for couples & friends, but equally for solo travelers alike.
There are a few different camping areas, open & grassy spaces, some quiet & leafy, areas, & a dedicated area for the Yurts & Sheppard's Huts; all beautifully kept, very clean, & spacious pitches.
The site is located within easy reach to Poole & surrounding areas, either by car, bus or walking (roughly 1.5hours from Pool harbour & on public paths)
The site facilities are excellent! 5* Plus!
The shower blocks and toilet facilities are kept immaculate, with lovely hot & powerful showers, with little & rare waiting!
The onsite food trucks are a nice addition if you don't fancy cooking, & offer different take-aways options on different days of the week.
The converted Bar is fab! another great addition for the site & gives a sociable vibe for likeminded campers to share conversations, or just sit & relax.
Onsite there is a great play area for children, and a dedicated 'off lead' doggy area, another lovely touch.
The shop is good, offering morning pastries & coffee, however, I did feel the produce could be better, & given the locality, some meats, fish & diary from local suppliers might be nice.
Within a 5 min walk you can visit the Cow Shed, & Pantry, a super area full of artisanal suppliers, selling lots of things such as gorgeous home Fragrances, Pottery & Gifts, Fill Up store, Wooden items, and a few more!
I cant praise this campsite enough, & I cant wait to book again & visit!
showerReviews.author: Vicky “Vikster!” P

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fabulous camping experience….
Amazing welcome with lots of information given about the facilities and surrounding country side.
Plenty of loos, washing up points and showers.
The evening entertainment of local singers was absolutely wonderful! As were the cocktails. Such a great idea to have a communal bar area with seating to enjoy the music 🙌 Yoga too. I’ve added a picture of my 81 year young mum on her virgin camping trip!!!! She throughly enjoyed it as did my whole family who celebrated a family Birthday. I will recommend to all and definitely be back again! Thank you for making it a lovely night x

showerReviews.reviewText:
The View Campsite, nestled within an eco farm just outside of the quiet village of Lytchett Matravers, is the most magical of places. As you’d expect, given the name, the site affords spectacular views over the Purbecks. Absolutely glorious scenery.
With children in tow, camping is a great option for us, we chose to stay in one of the Tipis. What a memorable experience! Spacious yet cosy, the Tipi delights both children & adults! Toilets and warm, powerful showers are all provided in several areas within immaculately clean, rustic shepherds huts. Washing up stations are dotted around the site, car parking is ample and fire pits are available to hire. All giving this site its well-deserved 5/5…. but the amenities, though great, are not the very best part of The View; Cathy & Kate, a friendly and welcoming mother/daughter duo, are exceptional hosts. Both devoted to the ecological merits of their home, their animals and the wildlife of the area, these two beautiful humans embrace guests with warmth, easy chats and an invitation to join them and their musical friends around the large communal fire for evenings of food and song. (We were lucky to arrive on a night when Cathy’s daughter, Kate’s sister Ellie made fantastic pizzas - bring cash to contribute to the pot).
The View soothes the soul, delights the senses and is so much more than a field to camp in. It is a community; people, place, sound, sights, wildlife, spirituality…  If you visit, be prepared to leave The View full of gratitude for the sense of well-being and happiness that is so naturally instilled. We did. We’ll definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Jaiq Carter

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a fantastic campsite.
Christine, (the owner) has done a wonderful job of creating a spacious, family friendly and well equipped campsite.
Ample space to enjoy, with no restrictions on pitch size as far as I can make out, with plenty of water tap outlets for drinking water dotted about
There are also numerous portaloo stations and a decent shower block with 24hr on demand hot water. Well lit too so late night or early morning showers are possible.
There is also a wash basin block for hand and face washing, also with constant hot water, as too are the wash up facilities which are also ample.
An 11pm music cut off and loud noise restriction is in place so as to keep the place respectful to all. This isn't a curfew, so quiet campfire evenings can be enjoyed till late.
Christine also offers safe wood burners  for hire, along with all the wood supplies you need. Reasonably priced too.
This campsite is beautiful, and over the years we have visited, only positive things have been added.
showerReviews.author: Weekend Wildness

locations.title: Club Aria
locations.address: Telephone House, 18 Christchurch Rd, Bournemouth BH1 3NE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked a few months in advance with Peter Bull Resorts, but wasn’t informed about the building works that were ongoing until two days before. As well as the change of hands. When discussing this with reception they advised they knew about the building works since March & apparently should be finished in 5 days which would’ve been (12/07/19!) which I can not see how this was possible.

I booked this holiday resort based on what facilities they have. E.g. The outdoor heated splash pool for the children. We are advised two days before that the swimming pool would be closed & open on the day we check out. This was extremely disappointing.

There didn’t seem to be any rules on noise level on an evening also. No reception to contact about the noise from drunken people on site. So having three small children who were disrupted was not part of the the plan.

Not once were we offered any gesture of goodwill for any of the inconvenience, especially being that I expressed my disappointment. But they said they would make a note of it.

You don’t expect to pay the full amount for a stay when they have ongoing building works, which you weren’t advised of at the time of booking & reduced access to the on site facilities.

Also - the utensils in the caravan itself are atrocious. The “sharp” knives in the block, struggling to cut mushrooms. We didn’t have any scissors & no iron or ironing board. I believe those to be a basic/minimal requirement. The double bed was awful, you could feel the springs in your back. I would’ve had better sleep on the sofa.

I feel you would receive better standards in a hostel. I understand they are trying to improve the site they have, but at least prepare your guests of the name change, reduce your prices to reflect the state of the site & lack of facilities.

You have a long way to go. But safe to say we won’t be returning.

Customer service is everything & sadly you definitely lack that.
showerReviews.author: Lauren Pinkett

locations.title: Parkdean Resorts Sandford Holiday Park, Dorset
locations.address: Willow Cres, Holton Heath, Poole BH16 6JZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First got to the holiday park and it was pleasant. Very pretty holiday park, great layout, caravan easy to find.

We booked a deluxe caravan which was nice, clean and all the extras as you would expect.

The club, people are queuing from 5pm to get into the club, if you don’t want to queue, then do not expect to get a table, I was almost fishing with some idiot over a table I had been waiting for for over half an hour. We tried again on the Saturday night and gave up, just not a pleasant experience. The club is not big enough for the amount of people, entertainment was pretty decent though, so if you can get a table it’s probably worth going.

The pool, the coldest pool I have ever been in, stayed in for 5 mins to jump into broken showers. Could be so much better but really don’t bother going to the swimming pool.

Went for a curry at the local Nepalese restaurant which is just over a mile away, very nice food so well worth a visit if you like a curry.

Over all mixed experience, I would stay again as a last resort.
showerReviews.author: andy ray

showerReviews.reviewText:
First got to the holiday park and it was pleasant. Very pretty holiday park, great layout, caravan easy to find.

We booked a deluxe caravan which was nice, clean and all the extras as you would expect.

The club, people are queuing from 5pm to get into the club, if you don’t want to queue, then do not expect to get a table, I was almost fishing with some idiot over a table I had been waiting for for over half an hour. We tried again on the Saturday night and gave up, just not a pleasant experience. The club is not big enough for the amount of people, entertainment was pretty decent though, so if you can get a table it’s probably worth going.

The pool, the coldest pool I have ever been in, stayed in for 5 mins to jump into broken showers. Could be so much better but really don’t bother going to the swimming pool.

Went for a curry at the local Nepalese restaurant which is just over a mile away, very nice food so well worth a visit if you like a curry.

Over all mixed experience, I would stay again as a last resort.
showerReviews.author: andy ray

showerReviews.reviewText:
This caravan park is great if you want a lot going on. It has lots of activities for family's with children of all ages, including an indoor and outdoor swimming pool, amusement arcade, crazy golf, play areas and nightly entertainment. Its also great to take dogs too. The caravan we stayed in was spacious and clean  although they are packed in and are very close to the neighbouring vans..I would have preferred a little more space.
The onsite food places like the fish and chip shop  and chicken van were really nice if a little expensive as was the onsite shop,  but if needs must its there!.x
We went out of season so it was relatively quiet  i probably wouldn't go back peak season as it would be way to busy and cramped for me. Overall we enjoyed our stay of 3 nights.

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed in the Campervan pitches at Sandford park. The pitches were electric and a decent size, they had both grass and gravel pitches available. The pitches are located approximately 10 min walk away from the entertainment area which means they’re lovely and quiet. The communal shower blocks are kept very clean. The entertainment here was fantastic! Great for all the family, with kids shows and singers/dancers later on, also bingo! They have a great arcade and restaurant area. Aswell as 2 play areas, good for children of all ages. Would recommend!
showerReviews.author: Louise Johnson

locations.title: The Kings Arms
locations.address: 18 Castle St, Christchurch BH23 1DT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Myself and hubby have just returned from a 3 night stay here and it far exceeded our expectations. We received a warm welcome on arrival and were given tokens for a complimentary drink to use anytime during our stay. The Room was clean and homely with plenty of tea/Coffee, water and towels, we had breakfast included which was amazing and so fresh...the restaurant is gorgeous. All the staff were lovely and we got fresh cooked biscuits the chef made as a thank you on check out. The area is absolutely stunning and rich in history, loads to do without driving (I recommend a visit to the priory) already looking at booking our next stay. Thank you to everyone who made our holiday one to remember
showerReviews.author: Sarah Halls
